story:
About the Film

Synopsis

"April returns home to Toronto after travelling and working abroad for several years to help her sister, Sara, care for their mother who is facing health problems. Upon April's return, she literally unearths old family secrets that threaten the gentle balance of home. Sara, who is studying the music of french composer Erik Satie, befriends a homeless man Erik who may have a connection to her mother’s romantic past, while April equivocates on a marriage proposal from her long distance boyfriend she met on her travels, Oscar. The story culminates on the eve of their mother's birthday dinner, when Oscar arrives unannounced from Argentina and Sara’s homeless friend comes calling at the celebration."

 

Two Teaser Trailers to Whet Your Funding Appetite

 

 

The Impact: What You Get

 

"April in Autumn" is a celebration of life. It is a story about the difficulties of family and how they bring us closer together. It gives us appreciation for those who are already in, leaving, returning, or newly entering our lives.

Inspired by iconic film-makers Eric Rohmer and Mike Leigh, "April in Autumn" is a humanist reflection of real people and the small moments that change them.

A collaborative effort between all artists and their resources, it is an ensemble film following real-life characters, all of whom lead rich lives and serve purposes beyond just this story.

 

For VIEWERS

  • A whimsical, meditative, poetic, philosophical, ultimately life-affirming, celebration of life. 
  • An empathetic reflection of the inevitabilities of life's challenges: including aging, sibling rivalry, disappointment, uncertainty of the future, and loss of the past.
  • A humanist film or "dramedy" with elements of dark, life-exploring edges which touch people on deep, emotional and humanist levels. 

 

For ARTISTS

  • Allow artists to make meaningful work and build their portfolios.
  • Allow actors to develop rich characters based on authenticity,  push their abilities, and develop their craft.
  • Help us reach our goal of submitting to Cannes 2017 and other world festivals, and distribute to Canada, US and abroad with positive film festival reception and response.

 

For YOU

The designated perks to the right- which allow us to get to know YOU better and to share our passion for the work WITH you!

 

 

The April In Autumn Team: Invest In US

 

Producers- Sula Studio & esmcreative (sulastudio.com / esmcreative.com)

Writer & Director - Warren Sulatycky

Assistant Directors - Greta Pylypczak & Jordan Mulder

Starring- Caitlyn Sponheimer, Elizabeth Stuart-Morris, Sandra Pascuzzi, Mike Sniezek, Warren Sulatycky, Savannah Rankin, Constantine Pavlou, & Jimmy Limb

Director of Photography - Wes Legge

Sound - David Draper

Music Composer - Greta Pylypczak

Production & Costume Designer - Kelly Anderson

 

Help us get April in Autumn to the Cannes Festival!

Bring This Film To A Local Screen Near YOU!

 

Marketplace Potential/ Target Audience 

“April In Autumn” will appeal to both a festival art-house audience AND a commercial adult audience much like how recent indie movies “Room”, “Carol”, and “Brooklyn” were crossover mainstream successes. “April in Autumn’s” exploration of deep human themes of love, friendship, family, and emotional survival will resonate with an intelligent discerning audience seeking an experience that takes them inside full characters grappling with the small details of their lives. 

 

Where You Will See "April In Autumn"!

We want you to see it in a comfy seat at your favourite movie theatre with a big bag of popcorn, or on television (hey CBC, SuperChannel, Bravo, HBO . . . here we come!). A vigorous online marketing plan (Social Media look out!) will extend distribution beyond the theatrical marketplace to Video-On-Demand/Downloads (Hulu, Apple, Vimeo  . . .)  so you can watch the film over and over and over again, cause you just love April In Autumn so much.

Then you tell your friends and they’ll tell their friends  and . . .  you get the point. That’s how small indie films become big-hit indie films these days. Word of mouth . . .  because it’s a darn good film.

 

CANNES FILM FESTIVAL AND BEYOND! 

“April in Autumn” will be positioned as a festival film on the national and international Class A level with the objectives to pursue and win major awards. We are positioning the film first as a Cannes Film Festival entrant with our post-production completed for submission in the spring of 2017.  We know, that’s a fast turnaround, but we can do it!

Other targeted festivals following Cannes will include Venice, Berlin, Toronto, the AFM (American Film Market), Tribeca, New York and Sundance. Local Canadian and American festivals will also be targeted  to ensure a festival cinema viewing for you, dear cherished crowd funders. Producers will pursue international distribution at the widest possible roll-out level, in as many international theatrical/broadcast markets possible.

 

Your Help Makes All The Difference!

 

THANK YOU so much for taking time to read about our project. We are so grateful that you have even considered supporting it!!!

Not everyone is able to donate. And that's okay! We completely understand.

If that's the case for you, please consider helping spread the word and share our message via your social media outlets and email contacts. And if you have just $5 to spare (say, two coffees) a little does go a long way!!!

 

Yours,

The April in Autumn Team
story_txt:
About the FilmSynopsis"April returns home to Toronto after travelling and working abroad for several years to help her sister, Sara, care for their mother who is facing health problems. Upon April's return, she literally unearths old family secrets that threaten the gentle balance of home. Sara, who is studying the music of french composer Erik Satie, befriends a homeless man Erik who may have a connection to her mother’s romantic past, while April equivocates on a marriage proposal from her long distance boyfriend she met on her travels, Oscar. The story culminates on the eve of their mother's birthday dinner, when Oscar arrives unannounced from Argentina and Sara’s homeless friend comes calling at the celebration." Two Teaser Trailers to Whet Your Funding Appetite

 
 The Impact: What You Get "April in Autumn" is a celebration of life. It is a story about the difficulties of family and how they bring us closer together. It gives us appreciation for those who are already in, leaving, returning, or newly entering our lives.Inspired by iconic film-makers Eric Rohmer and Mike Leigh, "April in Autumn" is a humanist reflection of real people and the small moments that change them.A collaborative effort between all artists and their resources, it is an ensemble film following real-life characters, all of whom lead rich lives and serve purposes beyond just this story. For VIEWERS
A whimsical, meditative, poetic, philosophical, ultimately life-affirming, celebration of life. 
An empathetic reflection of the inevitabilities of life's challenges: including aging, sibling rivalry, disappointment, uncertainty of the future, and loss of the past.
A humanist film or "dramedy" with elements of dark, life-exploring edges which touch people on deep, emotional and humanist levels. 
 For ARTISTS

Allow artists to make meaningful work and build their portfolios.

Allow actors to develop rich characters based on authenticity,  push their abilities, and develop their craft.
Help us reach our goal of submitting to Cannes 2017 and other world festivals, and distribute to Canada, US and abroad with positive film festival reception and response.
 For YOUThe designated perks to the right- which allow us to get to know YOU better and to share our passion for the work WITH you!  The April In Autumn Team: Invest In US
 Producers- Sula Studio & esmcreative (sulastudio.com / esmcreative.com)Writer & Director - Warren SulatyckyAssistant Directors - Greta Pylypczak & Jordan MulderStarring- Caitlyn Sponheimer, Elizabeth Stuart-Morris, Sandra Pascuzzi, Mike Sniezek, Warren Sulatycky, Savannah Rankin, Constantine Pavlou, & Jimmy LimbDirector of Photography - Wes LeggeSound - David DraperMusic Composer - Greta PylypczakProduction & Costume Designer - Kelly Anderson Help us get April in Autumn to the Cannes Festival!Bring This Film To A Local Screen Near YOU! Marketplace Potential/ Target Audience “April In Autumn” will appeal to both a festival art-house audience AND a commercial adult audience much like how recent indie movies “Room”, “Carol”, and “Brooklyn” were crossover mainstream successes. “April in Autumn’s” exploration of deep human themes of love, friendship, family, and emotional survival will resonate with an intelligent discerning audience seeking an experience that takes them inside full characters grappling with the small details of their lives.  Where You Will See "April In Autumn"!We want you to see it in a comfy seat at your favourite movie theatre with a big bag of popcorn, or on television (hey CBC, SuperChannel, Bravo, HBO . . . here we come!). A vigorous online marketing plan (Social Media look out!) will extend distribution beyond the theatrical marketplace to Video-On-Demand/Downloads (Hulu, Apple, Vimeo  . . .)  so you can watch the film over and over and over again, cause you just love April In Autumn so much.Then you tell your friends and they’ll tell their friends  and . . .  you get the point. That’s how small indie films become big-hit indie films these days. Word of mouth . . .  because it’s a darn good film. CANNES FILM FESTIVAL AND BEYOND! “April in Autumn” will be positioned as a festival film on the national and international Class A level with the objectives to pursue and win major awards. We are positioning the film first as a Cannes Film Festival entrant with our post-production completed for submission in the spring of 2017.  We know, that’s a fast turnaround, but we can do it!Other targeted festivals following Cannes will include Venice, Berlin, Toronto, the AFM (American Film Market), Tribeca, New York and Sundance. Local Canadian and American festivals will also be targeted  to ensure a festival cinema viewing for you, dear cherished crowd funders. Producers will pursue international distribution at the widest possible roll-out level, in as many international theatrical/broadcast markets possible. Your Help Makes All The Difference! THANK YOU so much for taking time to read about our project. We are so grateful that you have even considered supporting it!!!Not everyone is able to donate. And that's okay! We completely understand.If that's the case for you, please consider helping spread the word and share our message via your social media outlets and email contacts. And if you have just $5 to spare (say, two coffees) a little does go a long way!!! Yours,The April in Autumn Team

story:
Beat of the drums unite Africa and First Nations

My name is Valerie Hill, founder and executive director of the non-profit, Dream for Uganda. Our mandate is to support Cambridge Secondary School, located in the slums of Kampala, in a place so raw and disrupted, most Westerners cringe. But at the heart of this school is a remarkable group of performing arts student, Suubi Fusion Troupe, the subject of Dream for Uganda's first documentary: Suubi: Dance, Drum, Dream. The film was screened in Nov. 2015 at the opening gala of the Grand River Film Festival, to a sold out house in Cambridge, Ontario.

The success of that film led to the filmmakers asking "do you have any other ideas?"

You bet we did and so the idea for Two Drums, Many Dreamers was born.

The Project: In March 2017, three filmmakers, crew and eight members of the First Nations performance troupe, White Pine Dancers, will travel to Uganda where they will collaborate with Suubi and other Ugandan singers, dancers, drummers and traditional storytellers.

It's important to us that these two groups drive the story, with no outside interference. They will embrace commonalities and share differences with mutual respect.

This story has never been told before. Imagine being part of it? Imagine being at the film screening and meeting Suubi and the White Pine Dancers? Imagine having your name on the film as a supporter. Without you, this stunning film might not happen.

We have support from Ugandan Tourism which will help with the air and ground transportation, but there are all the production and post productions costs and that is where we need your help.

As part of our funding team YOU will have your name attached to the project. We have even included one big perk: an adventure in Uganda, with a personal safari guide, three nights in a national park and a private performance by Suubi  plus your own copy of the film.

The funds raised will be part of our overall project budget of $200,000. Everyone has been busy applying for government grants, private foundation funding and anything else we can think of, but we really need YOU.

The Impact

In an age when our First Nations are finally being recognized for all they have suffered at the hands of colonizers, from being driven off their lands to being forced into residential schools, this film will show a side of their culture few get to experience. It is a celebration and exploration of all that makes the First Nations a justifiably proud and remarkable people.

Juno award winning Inuk singer, Susan Aglukark believes in this project and has agreed to narrate the film.

World class photographer, Sherry Prenevost, believes in the project. She will be shooting stills as well as video. Her photos are part of collections around the world including Queen Elizabeth's and David Suzuki's, among other high profile dignitaries.

Michael Summers, a full member of the Oneida Nations of the Thames, believes in this project. He will be one of the three filmmakers on the project.

MetaMedia filmmakers, Paul Francescutti and Paul Campsall, believe in the project despite the uncertain funding. Both are experienced filmmakers who have worked for major charities in Africa and South America.

Maise Sum, PhD, asst. music professor at the University of Waterloo, believes in this project and is on board as our academic advisor. Her specialty is music of Morocco and the sub-Saharan diaspora and the impact of global forces on musical traditions and identity,

The Kitchener-Waterloo Symphony believes in this project. The first combined performance of the White Pine Dancers and Suubi Fusion Troupe will be with the symphony in the 2,000 seat performance hall, Centre in the Square, Kitchener.

Past successes and future challenges:

In less than three years since Dream for Uganda became a registered non-profit we have accomplished more than most organizations do in a decade including installing a 3,500-title library complete with full-time librarian and a modern computer cataloguing system. We also installed a music room and one of our team members has painted just about the whole darned school. We also purchased new equipment and desks, fixed broken concrete floors and replaced old furniture and we've launched a entrepreneur program, providing kids with skills useful beyond high school. There are members of the Dream for Uganda team on the ground working hard at the school on a regular basis. This is our lifelong commitment.

 In May 2013, Dream for Uganda brought the first group of 10 Suubi performers to Ontario for a two-week tour.

In the fall of 2015 we brought 14 members of Suubi  (a Luganda word for 'Hope') for their second Canadian tour. The month-long tour coincided with the screening of the documentary film Suubi: Dance, Drum, Dream at the Grand River Film Festival's opening gala at the Dunfield Theatre, Cambridge. It was a sold out house.

Everywhere the film screened, Suubi performed and audiences were emotionally charged, often to the point of tears. 

We have faced a few hurdles throughout this experience, including dealing with bureaucrats who took their time processing Suubi's travel visas (we had everything finalized only hours before their flight left for Canada). We also had a private benefactor come forward at the last minute to pay for airfares after or fundraising efforts hadn't been successful.

In this new film, the scope will be bigger and we will have no control over how everything turns out, unlike the Suubi film. There will be no script, no professional actors: we are letting the Ugandans and White Pine Dancers tell the story through their collaboration. It's risky, but we feel it's necessary to give the film authenticity, that rawness that makes for great storytelling.

This is a big project and need you but if you can't help financially, please consider holding fundraisers even if it's just inviting people to your home for a card game or dinner or dessert or all three. Several small fundraisers will add up.

And pass the word on about this campaign, take ownership and be proud that you are part of something that has never been done before, something that could change how the world views First Nations and African music, culture and history.

Thank you.

story:
Defender: A Groundbreaking New Film on the Criminal Justice System in America

Hi. I'm Jeff Adachi, the writer and producer of two award winning PBS feature documentary films  asking for your help to bring a new project to life: 

"Defender" is a feature length film about the critical role that public defenders play in fighting for racial and social justice in America.  The film takes viewers on a personal and intense tour through the underbelly of the criminal injustice system, seen through the eyes of SF Public Defender Jeff Adachi, who is one of the nation’s few elected public defenders.  Adachi tells the story of how public defenders came to be, and why they play a critical role as the watchdogs of a system that over-incarcerates people of color and has long been out of control .  Adachi also exposes the racism within the system. 

Adachi represents a young African American man who is charged with assaulting police officers after being falsely accused of a crime in a case with racial overtones. In this era of mass incarceration and police shootings of young African American men, how do we, as a society, grapple with the issues of racism and implicit bias in policing and its consequences for those who question police authority?  The film also follows Adachi's public battle to allow his office to represent immigrants in deportation proceedings in post-Trump America.

The film is co-directed by Jim Choi, who has made several award winning films including "Chasing Seasons" and "The People's Hospital," and edited by Chihiro Wimbush ("Dogtown Redemption").

How You Can Help Me

I believe in this project and have helped fund the trailer for "The Ride" which is a short film; we are determined to make a feature film, but I need your help. I need to raise $20,000 complete the film.  This is what we will use the money for:

We have shot over 50 hours of footage, but we now must pay the cost of editing and completing the film. 

Once the film is completed, we will enter the film festivals across the country and world.  Most film festivals charge between $50-$100 to enter the film into festivals.  It is an important way to ensure the film is seen by critics, industry professionals and the public.

We will approach schools and educators and offer the film as a teaching tool. 

We will create an interactive website to accompany the viewing of the film, complete with a history section and teacher and student guide.

By contributing to this project, you will help bring this unique film about public defenders and criminal justice to people throughout the country at a time when criminal justice reform is a major issue on the minds of many Americans.

We will provide free copies to schools and educators who cannot afford to purchase it.

Please donate whatever you can to support our film and help make change!  

The Impact

Your contribution will help:

educate the public on the critical role that public defenders and criminal defense attorneys play in fighting for the constitutional rights of all Americans, and to eradicate racism in the criminal justice system. 

show people the importance of reforming the justice system, such as bail and sentencing reform and how we can work together as a community to fight for social justice.

create the opportunity for positive dialogue, reflection and discussion on the issue of social and racial justice in our society.

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to contributing to the Defender campaign, you  may:

Please help spread the word to your friends about our campaign.

You can use the Indiegogo share tools to alert your friends on social media!

Thank you for your help and support!

story:
LIKE BAMBOO: Stories of LGBT Asylum Seekers

This project is at a critical juncture. We need to solicit funding in order to cover the expense of activities essential to completion and distribution of the film -- editing, marketing, technical support, graphics design, venue rental, transportation for asylum seekers, and materials. The project has been self-funded up to this point, and we are now asking for broader support.

 

Funding Needed Now

The film project is just the beginning of our journey. The film will be screened to a variety of audiences through live and online screenings. We seek not only to develop greater awareness and support for this vulnerable population, but to also expand support for their potential employment, education, and legal expenses. The non-profit organization sponsors will be able to use the film(s) for their own direct fund-raising and public awareness initiatives. We are building a foundation of awareness and understanding to relieve some of the stresses and anxieties of our film subjects and their colleagues. Donations are tax deductible.

 

The Impact

Your contribution will not only help us finish, screen, and distribute the film but you will also help the Program for Torture Victims in Los Angeles (PTV) develop a fund-raising stream for their programs and services for asylum seekers. The California International Education Foundation will expand efforts to promote the film and guest speakers in local high school and universities.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with friends, colleagues, and possible funding agencies.

story:
NEW PERK!!! New perk at the $500 level where you get to choose an item that goes into the film. This can include a branded shirt, mug, hat, anything else you can think of! Talk about brand exposure! It could also be a random item that you own that you want to see in the movie (within reason of course). Let's do it!
 

Learn more about our story, the cast and crew involved, and how you can help!

 

Extended Director's Cut of the Campaign Video

 

 

 

The Promise follows the newly engaged Carl and Jillian as they embark on a romantic picnic in the wilderness. When the couple is kidnapped, perspective becomes everything. 

 

The Promise is an intense, dark comedy/thriller that is inspired by true events. We love combining comedy with other genres to make the audience feel the urge to laugh even when they feel scared, nervous or tense. This film will have you on the edge of your seat, laughing, and then immediately back on the edge of your seat. 

We are going to be running a very fun and interactive campaign because we want YOU to be part of our team. We will be running contests, promotions and even give you the chance to vote on key decisions throughout the various perk levels. These include casting decisions, choosing the mask of the kidnappers, and many more. We'll be adding new perks and contests throughout the campaign so be sure to check back. 

 

Tunnel Light Pictures is a new film production company based out of Los Angeles, CA focused on making bold and daring cross-genre feature films. 

Hollywood is filled with production companies, both big and small, producing very similar content with large teams and even larger budgets. We are doing things differently. There are a lot of voices in this town but not enough willing to stand out and be weird. That's where we come in.

 

Tyler Cole co-founded Tunnel Light Pictures two years ago and has since directed several short films, music videos and commercials. The Promise will be Tyler's feature film directorial debut. 

 

Aaron Burt has starred in five feature films and has been studying acting in LA for 15 years at The American Academy of Dramatic Arts and Brad Henke Studio. Aaron also co-founded Tunnel Light Pictures 2 years ago.

 

Tina Carbone is credited as a producer on over 20 short films, three of which (Fragile Storm, Comrade Crunch, and Killer Friends) have showcased at numerous festivals and won multiple awards. "Killer Friends" is also an Oscar qualifying film this year. 

 

Jarrod Burt has been editing feature films and post-producing at Bunim/Murray for 12 years. His credits include "Keeping up with the Kardashians", "Real World Challenge", and "Born This Way" for which his work has won him an Emmy.

 

E.K. Wimmer is an artist and musician. Under the name Veduta, he released two L.P.s, three E.P.s and was included on six compilations. Under his own name, he has released two solo records.

Wimmer has also scored several short films including "Philophobia" and "The Uber of Killing" for Tunnel Light Pictures. His first feature, "In the Company of Strangers", premiered in Los Angeles, CA on March 11, 2015. 

www.ekwimmer.com

We have the rights for When In Rome and Sturgil Simpsons "The Promise"

 

 

 

We have an incredible cast already attached and quite a few that will be announced shortly!

 

 

Jillian - Celebrity?

So many famous credits!

 

 

Carl - Aaron Burt

Starred in five feature films and some shorts (I know, I know... you already know this.. annoying)

 

 

Bruce - David Lengel

David Lengel has been a working actor for 19 years and has recurring roles on such shows as "Speechless", "Dr. Ken", and "Bosch".

 

 

Georgina - Mara Marini

Mara Marini has been a working actress for 16 years with credits from "Parks and Rec" as Brandi Maxx and also stars in the upcoming reboot of "Chips" starring Michael Pena and Dax Shepard.

 

 

Pastor Dan - Celebrity?

Been in a bunch of stuff you've seen!

 

 

Janice - Casey Messer

Casey Messer has appeared in "Odd Thomas" and "Independence Day: Resurgence" and is the entertaining host of "Good Day New Mexico," and "Direct TV's: The Screening Room". 

 

 

Detective Watson - Celebrity?

Clearly doesn't need a bio. Too famous!

 

 

Detective Wald - Celebrity?

Yeah, we got her too!

 

 

Masked Man - Celebrity?

 

 

 

Pros:

1. You  get to see an amazing and fresh film that Hollywood is too scared to take a chance on.

2. You get to vote on key creative decisions and be part of the movie making experience!

3. You get to help at least 20 people's dreams come true.

4. You get a huge (or small) tax write off (depending on donation amount).

5. You get eye candy with beautiful images and a sexy, young cast.

6. Donate for a late christmas gift to one of the cast or crew members. 

7. Don't know what to get Aaron for his bday? Easy gift!!!!!!

Cons:

1. You are out of that amount of money you donated (not counting the tax write off mentioned in the pros section).

 

 

If you can't donate due to the holidays draining the wallet, don't fret. Here are some ways you can help.

1. Post this amazing and unique campaign on your instagram/facebook/twitter. PLEASE!!!!!!

2. Email blast this fantastic campaign to everyone in your email list!!!!!! PLEASE!!!!!!!!!

3. If anyone knows any bloggers, press, or alternative ways of media, please send this campaign to them to do a write up about it. (That would be amazing!!!!!!)

4. If anyone knows a police station that we can shoot in.

5. Anna Kendrick's contact, let us know :)

6. If anyone can or knows someone who can make a detailed prosthetic pig carcass.

7. Donate private property in the woods that we could shoot on.

8. Film equipment rental donations/discounts, custom mask designers, T-shirt printers, graphic artists, blu-ray authoring, catering discounts in New Mexico or Los Angeles, the list goes on and on.

 

All we need is 6,000 people to donate 5 dollars, or...

All we need is 1,200 people to donate 25 dollars, or....

All we need is 750 people to donate 40 dollars, or...

All we need is 600 people to donate 50 dollars, or...

All we need is 400 people to donate 75 dollars, or...

All we need is 300 people to donate 100 dollars, or...

All we need is 120 people to donate 250 dollars, or...

All we need is 30 people to donate 1,000 dollars, or...

All we need is one person to donate 30,000 dollars ;)

 

 

 

 

 

 

Please feel free to email us with any questions, comments, concerns, positive thoughts, criticisms, interview requests, really anything you want to say:

Tyler@tunnellightpictures.com and Aaron@tunnellightpictures.com

 

 

Aaron's niece and nephew's believe in us.....I hope you guys do too!!!!! (Don't let their dreams die)

Special thank you to The Brian Buckley Band! All the music in our pitch video was theirs. Here's their link!!!!!!!!!!!!!

http://www.brianbuckleyband.com

"I think that if the reigning powers had any respect for good pictures or the people who could make them that this respect was probably very well tempered... but the somewhat cynical observation that poor and mediocre pictures might just as well prove successful as their pictures of higher value. Television has changed this completely, and despite the unhappy financial upheaval that its caused the movie industry it has also provided a very invigorating and stimulating challenge which has made it necessary for films to be made with more sincerity and more daring. If Hollywood lacks the color and excitement of its early days with rolls royces and leopard skin seat covers, I think on the other hand it provides the most exciting and stimulating atmosphere of opportunity and possibilities for young people today."-Stanley Kubrick
story_txt:
NEW PERK!!! New perk at the $500 level where you get to choose an item that goes into the film. This can include a branded shirt, mug, hat, anything else you can think of! Talk about brand exposure! It could also be a random item that you own that you want to see in the movie (within reason of course). Let's do it!
 

Learn more about our story, the cast and crew involved, and how you can help!
 
Extended Director's Cut of the Campaign Video


 

 


 
The Promise follows the newly engaged Carl and Jillian as they embark on a romantic picnic in the wilderness. When the couple is kidnapped, perspective becomes everything. 
 
The Promise is an intense, dark comedy/thriller that is inspired by true events. We love combining comedy with other genres to make the audience feel the urge to laugh even when they feel scared, nervous or tense. This film will have you on the edge of your seat, laughing, and then immediately back on the edge of your seat. 
We are going to be running a very fun and interactive campaign because we want YOU to be part of our team. We will be running contests, promotions and even give you the chance to vote on key decisions throughout the various perk levels. These include casting decisions, choosing the mask of the kidnappers, and many more. We'll be adding new perks and contests throughout the campaign so be sure to check back. 
 

Tunnel Light Pictures is a new film production company based out of Los Angeles, CA focused on making bold and daring cross-genre feature films. 
Hollywood is filled with production companies, both big and small, producing very similar content with large teams and even larger budgets. We are doing things differently. There are a lot of voices in this town but not enough willing to stand out and be weird. That's where we come in.
 


Tyler Cole co-founded Tunnel Light Pictures two years ago and has since directed several short films, music videos and commercials. The Promise will be Tyler's feature film directorial debut. 
 


Aaron Burt has starred in five feature films and has been studying acting in LA for 15 years at The American Academy of Dramatic Arts and Brad Henke Studio. Aaron also co-founded Tunnel Light Pictures 2 years ago.
 


Tina Carbone is credited as a producer on over 20 short films, three of which (Fragile Storm, Comrade Crunch, and Killer Friends) have showcased at numerous festivals and won multiple awards. "Killer Friends" is also an Oscar qualifying film this year. 
 


Jarrod Burt has been editing feature films and post-producing at Bunim/Murray for 12 years. His credits include "Keeping up with the Kardashians", "Real World Challenge", and "Born This Way" for which his work has won him an Emmy.
 


E.K. Wimmer is an artist and musician. Under the name Veduta, he released two L.P.s, three E.P.s and was included on six compilations. Under his own name, he has released two solo records.
Wimmer has also scored several short films including "Philophobia" and "The Uber of Killing" for Tunnel Light Pictures. His first feature, "In the Company of Strangers", premiered in Los Angeles, CA on March 11, 2015. 
www.ekwimmer.com
We have the rights for When In Rome and Sturgil Simpsons "The Promise"

 

 

 
We have an incredible cast already attached and quite a few that will be announced shortly!
 

 

Jillian - Celebrity?

So many famous credits!
 

 

Carl - Aaron Burt

Starred in five feature films and some shorts (I know, I know... you already know this.. annoying)
 

 

Bruce - David Lengel

David Lengel has been a working actor for 19 years and has recurring roles on such shows as "Speechless", "Dr. Ken", and "Bosch".
 

 

Georgina - Mara Marini

Mara Marini has been a working actress for 16 years with credits from "Parks and Rec" as Brandi Maxx and also stars in the upcoming reboot of "Chips" starring Michael Pena and Dax Shepard.
 

 

Pastor Dan - Celebrity?

Been in a bunch of stuff you've seen!
 

 

Janice - Casey Messer

Casey Messer has appeared in "Odd Thomas" and "Independence Day: Resurgence" and is the entertaining host of "Good Day New Mexico," and "Direct TV's: The Screening Room". 
 

 

Detective Watson - Celebrity?

Clearly doesn't need a bio. Too famous!
 

 

Detective Wald - Celebrity?

Yeah, we got her too!
 

 

Masked Man - Celebrity?

 
 


 
Pros:
1. You  get to see an amazing and fresh film that Hollywood is too scared to take a chance on.
2. You get to vote on key creative decisions and be part of the movie making experience!
3. You get to help at least 20 people's dreams come true.
4. You get a huge (or small) tax write off (depending on donation amount).
5. You get eye candy with beautiful images and a sexy, young cast.
6. Donate for a late christmas gift to one of the cast or crew members. 
7. Don't know what to get Aaron for his bday? Easy gift!!!!!!

story:
Bref résumé/About us

*English below*

La Paris Black Pride, une association loi 1901, est heureuse de lancer son premier week-end "Paris Black Pride" du vendredi 15 juillet jusqu’au dimanche 17 juillet 2016 dans des lieux à travers la ville lumière. Notre premier week-end est un hommage aux vies de Joséphine Baker et James Baldwin, deux proéminentes personnalités LGBT de couleur qui ont vécu en France et qui appartiennent à l’histoire de Paris. En tant qu'organisation, nous célébrons la diversité des personnes LGBT de couleur en France et de leurs alliés. La Paris Black Pride favorisera également le dialogue sur l’importance de l'inclusion sociale et la visibilité des personnes LGBT de couleurs en France et en Europe. Ce week-end comprendra un cocktail de bienvenue, une table ronde de conférences-débats, une promenade historique dans le « Paris noir », une exposition artistique, des film-documentaires et un pique-nique en plus d'une série de soirées.

***************************

Paris Black Pride, a French non-profit organization, is pleased to launch its first “Paris Black Pride Weekend” Friday July 15th through Sunday July 17th, 2016 at venues across the capital.  Our inaugural weekend is decided to the lives and legacies of Josephine Baker and James Baldwin, two LGBT people of color who called France home.  As an organization, we seek to celebrate the diversity of France’s LGBT people of color and their allies.  Paris Black Pride will also foster dialogue about increasing the social inclusion and visibility of LGBT people of color in France and across Europe. The weekend will include a meet & greet cocktail, a panel discussion, an history walk of "Black Paris", an art exhibition and a picnic in addition to a series of parties.

 Ce dont nous avons besoin/What we need 

 *English below*

  • Pour cet événement nous avons besoin d'un budget de 7000 euros pour assurer la logistique lors de ce week-end. La logistique comprend le dispositif de sécurité, les appareils audios pour la traduction simultanée lors de notre panel de discussion, la location d'une petite scène pour l'animation de notre pique-nique, la sonorisation, l'achat de matériel de décoration.
  •  Pour les dépenses, nous prévoyons donc les choses suivantes: 
  • 4000€ pour la sécurité
  • 1000€ pour la location d'appareils audio pour la traduction simultanée lors de notre panel de discussion
  • 800€ pour la location d'une petite scène pour l'animation de notre pique-nique
  • 2000€ pour la sonorisation lors du pique-nique
  • 200€ pour la pour la décoration

Si nous n'atteignons pas complètement notre objectif alors les fonds récoltés seront dédiés principalement pour la mise en place du dispositif de sécurité (env. 3500€).

Nos fournisseurs nous ayant accordé un délai de paiement, nous prolongerons cette levée de fond au delà de notre week-end inaugural de la Paris Black Pride.

***************

For this event we need a budget of 7,000 euros mainly for the logistics during the weekend. Logistics includes the security, audio equipments for simultaneous translation during our panel discussion, renting a small stage for the entertainment for our picnic, sound, and decoration.

For expenditure, we expect the following:

  • €4,000 for security
  • €1,000 for the renting of audio equipments for simultaneous translation during our panel discussion
  • €800 for the renting of a small stage for the animation of our picnic
  • €2,000 sound for the picnic
  • €200  for decoration

If we do not completely reach our goal then the funds will be dedicated mainly to security (approx. €3500).

Our suppliers have given us a payment period then we will extend the crowdfunding beyond our inaugural weekend of Paris Black Pride.

L'impact/The impact

*English below*

Depuis plus d'une décennie, la UK Black Pride a été le précurseur en étant à la tête du seul événement en Europe visant les LGBT d’origines africaines, antillaises, arabes, et asiatiques. La Paris Black Pride a été créé pour mettre en oeuvre sa détermination à répondre aux besoins des personnes de couleur LGBT qui font face à de multiples inégalités, y compris le racisme, le sexisme et l'homophobie dans la société française et dans la communauté des personnes de couleurs et enfin dans la communauté LGBT en général. En tant qu’un organisme à but non lucratif, la Paris Black Pride souhaite apporter des contributions majeures pour la communauté avec comme résultats une meilleure acceptation de soi et une véritable inclusion au sein de la communauté et du reste de la société. 

************

For more than a decade UK Black Pride has stood apart as Europe’s only pride event aimed at African, Arab, Asian and Caribbean-heritage Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Trans people. Paris Black Pride was born from the determination to amplify the needs of Black LGBT people who face multiple inequalities including racism, sexism and homophobia across French society and within Black and LGBT communities. As a nonprofit organization, Paris Black Pride is deeply willing to make contributions for Black LGBT people in ways that are inclusive of lived experiences. The visibility that will be created will strengthen Black LGBT people across French society.

 D'autres façons d'aider/Other ways to help

*English below*

 Si vous ne pouvez pas participer aux crowdfunding pour divers raisons alors nous vous serons reconnaissants de bien vouloir faire du bouche à oreille sur notre événement international autours de vous. Vous pouvez le faire en utilisant les outils de partage Indiegogo.

***********

If for some reasons you can not participate in the crowdfunding we will be grateful for you to make word of mouth around you about our international event. You can do this by using Indiegogo sharing tools.

Hotel Joséphine:

http://www.hotel-josephine.com/

Brian Scott Bagley:

http://www.brianscottbagley.fr/

story:
What is it?

What makes '3' a special story, is displaying how polyamorous relationships affect their everyday lives, as well as the relationships around them.
Our story is based on the life of Rapper/Screenwriter, Jamala 'Alamaj' Kidd. Directed by Will 'Deshair' Foskey.

Who are the producers?

Jamala 'Alamaj' Kidd (Producer)

Jamala “Alamaj” Kidd is a native of Trenton, NJ. A Hip Hop artist by trade, Alamaj has performed in arenas with French Montana, Wale, Jadakiss, and Juelz Santana to name a few. Gaining popularity with his music from online radio stations such as Pandora and Spotify, the rapper’s lifestyle has led to other businesses and ventures.

Writing and publishing “The Relationship Guidebook”, has created a demand for the rapper’s polyamorous love life to become a focal point.  Through this demand, the development of the series, “3: The New Normal”, which is based on the life of Alamaj, was created.

Whether music, business, writing, or film, Alamaj has proven a love for the arts.

www.facebook.com/TheRealAlamaj

Will Deshair Foskey (Director)

Will “Deshair” Foskey is an African-American, Content Curator, born and raised in Trenton, NJ. He spent 7 years (2006 - 2013) as a Music Industry Journalist, interviewing everybody from Babyface to Jason Mraz; from Ne-Yo to even Todd Bridges.

He is the self-published author of “The Relationship Guidebook” and “The Poeticine Book”. Both can be purchased on Kindle and found on Facebook.

Today, Mr. Foskey is the founder of Trenton Going Global Films, a Videography/Photography company, specializing in digital content consumption. He is a Canon Camera user who enjoys editing and final products.

Website: www.TrentonGoingGlobal.com

Youtube Channel: www.Youtube.com/Deshair


Nacone Martin (Associate Producer)

Nacone E. Martin is an commercial model & actress from Trenton, NJ. Her career has consisted of runway/trade shows, billboards, print work, commercials/infomercials, television and film.

Nacone has received high praise for her motivational speaking and mentor activities and has been recognized by many organizations within her community for her accomplishments. Nacone has been a role model for many upcoming, inspiring models and actors who continually seek her advice about the industry and in 2013 started her own consultant agency Childs-Martin.

Nacone expanded her brand into internet radio and in January of 2014 joined the Love Zone, USA as a co-host to the show “The Girlfriend Network” which currently has 200,000 listeners. Also as a personal trainer, in May of 2015, Nacone launched her own fitness clothing line, Enocan Fitness (her name spelled backwards) in which her slogan “I Know I Can” has become popular.

“3: The New Normal” is the first time that Nacone has stepped from in front of the camera to behind it as an associate producer and collaborator with Producers Jamala Kidd and Will Deshair Foskey bringing her knowledge of film and the industry to this project.

Nacone is represented by Funny Face Today, Inc., GMT, and Silver Model Management in New York for both modeling and acting and continues to study acting with the accomplished actress Karen Vicks who teaches out of Philadelphia.

Facebook.com/Nacone Martin  IMDb: Nacone Martin

Twitter.com/NaconeMartin  Linkedin: Nacone Martin

Instagram/Nacone Martin  www.fftmodels.com/Nacone321


What's the scenario?

3, places an in-depth focus on Polyamorous Relationships and how it directly and indirectly affects all traditional and nontraditional relationships anywhere near it.

Caleb “Cal” Gore, Maya Fields, and Brittany Kendall are in a 3 person polyamorous relationship. They live together and there’s never a dull moment. Their relationship is the talk of the town, good and bad.

Caleb’s good friend, Andrew “Drew” Sparks is in a dysfunctional relationship with Maya’s best friend, April May Gilliam. April and Andrew are coasting along, doing all the wrong things at the right time. They’d be an amazing couple if they could just get out of their own way.

The wildcard of the crew is Phillip Ward. He’s single, and unprepared to mingle. For years, he stood by Cal’s side and told him lie after lie about his sexual prowess. Phil finally admits it to Cal and becomes his protégé.

How will the money be used?

Crew

20%

Cast

20%

Production

60%

Why is it different?

3 explores the world of polyamory and answers many of the questions:

  Is it all for the man?

  Is it purely sexual?

  Can it last?

How long will it take to finish?

We expect that it will take 6 months from the day this project is funded complete the series

What perks are we offering?

By contributing to 3, not only will you be supporting endlessly talented, hard-working filmmakers; you'll be giving a timeless web series to passionate film enthusiasts like yourself all around the world.

In addition, we have a bunch of great and exclusive IndieGoGo contributor perks (see perk sidebar)

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Like and share 3 on Facebook
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to email/embed it everywhere online!
  • Tell all your friends

And that's all there is to it.

Instagram/Nacone Martin  www.fftmodels.com/Nacone321


What's the scenario?
 
3, places an in-depth focus on Polyamorous Relationships and
how it directly and indirectly affects all traditional and nontraditional
relationships anywhere near it. 
Caleb “Cal” Gore, Maya Fields, and Brittany Kendall are in a
3 person polyamorous relationship. They live together and there’s never a dull
moment. Their relationship is the talk of the town, good and bad. 
Caleb’s good friend, Andrew “Drew” Sparks is in a
dysfunctional relationship with Maya’s best friend, April May Gilliam. April
and Andrew are coasting along, doing all the wrong things at the right time.
They’d be an amazing couple if they could just get out of their own way.
The wildcard of the crew is Phillip Ward. He’s single, and
unprepared to mingle. For years, he stood by Cal’s side and told him lie after
lie about his sexual prowess. Phil finally admits it to Cal and becomes his
protégé.

How will the money be used?
  




Crew


20%




Cast


20%




Production


60%






Why is it different?


3 explores the world of polyamory and answers many
of the questions:
  Is
it all for the man?
  Is
it purely sexual?
  Can
it last?

How long will it take to finish?



We expect that it will take 6
months from the day this project is funded complete the series
What
perks are we offering?
By contributing to 3, not
only will you be supporting endlessly talented, hard-working filmmakers; you'll
be giving a timeless web series to passionate film enthusiasts like yourself
all around the world.


In addition, we have a bunch of great and
exclusive IndieGoGo contributor perks (see perk sidebar)


Other Ways You Can Help 

Like and share 3 on Facebook


Use the
     Indiegogo share tools to email/embed it everywhere online!
Tell all
     your friends

And that's all there is to it.

story:
About The Short Film

Joey Newman is fed up, with his father passing, his terrible customer service job, his crush turning him down and  his past experiences with Catholic School: Joey wants to end it all but decides against it, until accidentally, Joey falls to his death. He wakes up in a room with no windows or doors, with a phone and an office plant. The phone only dials one number, and that's Saint Support: A biblical tech support line, which started-up to help people in Limbo reach the Afterlife. It was created out of Heaven's fascination with modern human culture. Joey has to go through 7 layers of customer service Hell, in order to get where he needs to go.


Significance

Themes & Morality

  • It is a film about the brevity of life and appreciating the people we have while we are alive.

  • Bureaucracy could exist anywhere in universe and why that's unfortunate.

  • It's inspired by tales of struggle with Comcast Customer Service.

  • Catholic guilt put under the lens of satire.

What We Need & What You're Getting

The total budget of Saint Support ($1,900) goes into the production of the project: set design, props, materials, and rentals. Feeding the crew, will be done regardless of the budget. This is a low budget project, the cast and crew is entirely volunteer based. If we end up going significantly over and beyond the goal,  we will split those funds between the crew, cast and rewards.


  • $500 in lens and extra rentals

  • $400 - Set and Prop Design

  • $300 - Pre Production Work

  • $700 - Food & Crafty

  • $400  - Rewards budget for a $2,300 goal.

  • If we don't reach the entire goal, the funds will go in to rentals and food as priorities.

There's Some Amazing Perks

  • Afterlife Magazine A visual lookbook into the behind the scenes of the Saint Support production, the movie's world and it's characters.

  • A Signed Poster by the Cast and Crew

  • Live Online Screening Party and Q&A

  • Get in the credits and get a great amount of Saint Support themed merch.

  • Downloads of the film.

  • Demon status, items designed with a hellish touch.

  • Fake Your Own Funeral: This reward would be an experience where we would film a fake funeral for you, almost half of this reward would go into a small private funeral for the contributor, it would be staged and you could have as much involvement as you would like. The rest of the funds from this perk would pay the cast and crew.

The Team

Rupert Wild - Director

Jackson Rosenfeld - Writer, Creator, Executive Producer

Dylan Saliba - DP

Brandon Cartwright - AD


Wisdom Risks & Challenges

  • Saint Support is not a sacrilegious film, but it gets close at times. The film's purpose is not to hate on religion of any kind, but is a statement against extreme religious oppression, guilt, and the corporatization of religion.

  • This project is a big portfolio piece for everyone involved and will be submitted to film festivals at the years end.

  • I have almost a decade of experience in writing, directing and producing narrative short films as a student.

  • Making a film is like trying to keep an avalanche from coming down a mountain, your vision is at the top of the mountain and you have to make sure you keep everything at the top so it doesn't fall apart.

  • We are already in pre production, and it is running smoothly. It will happen, and there are 20+ people already involved.

  • We are putting our cast, sets, locations and props together, and we need to make sure to be as organized as possible. The screenplay, storyboard and shot list are already completed.


If you cannot donate, a share would be very appreciated. Thank you, from the Saint Support Team.

story:
A feature-length documentary dives deep inside the surprising rise of Donald Trump.  

TEAM:

Josh Bernstein is an eight-time Emmy Award-winning television reporter.  Josh has been honored with two prestigious Edward R. Murrow Awards and was previously named Alabama’s Best Investigative Reporter by the Associated Press.

Frank Bass is a Pulitzer Prize-winning reporter and a former Texas Headliners Foundation Reporter of the Year. Frank has been a staff reporter for the Wall Street Journal, the Associated Press, Bloomberg News, the Houston Post, and Al Jazeera International.

Marc Shaffer is an award-winning documentary filmmaker.  Marc's films have been presented on PBS, National Geographic and Al Jazeera International, online and in theaters and festivals. 

Advisors

Keith Bowers is former head of international current affairs radio and television programming for the BBC.

Bill Buzenberg is former VP of NPR News and executive director of the Center for Public Integrity.

Mark Horvit is executive director of Investigative Reporters and Editors.

Cynthia Kane is a documentary executive, formerly of the Sundance Channel, Showtime, ITVS and Al Jazeera.

Tia Lessin is an Academy Award-nominated documentary filmmaker.

James Steele is an iconic investigative reporter who with partner Don Barlett is the only winner of two Pulitzer Prizes and two National Magazine Awards.

story:
'The Story of Airlander' Documentary series

'The Story of Airlander' is a three year documentary project, telling the incredible story of the Airlander hybrid airship.

PLEASE NOTE: All presales have now transferred to www.airlander.deanarnett.com

UPDATE (APRIL 2017) - Now Airlander 10 is back out of the shed, we expect delivery of all discs to be in Sept / Oct 2017. Many thanks again for all your patience but we felt it importnat to capture the whole story.


Airships have captivated the public for decades. These majestic, giant ships, that 'hang' in the air, seem to defy physics. They are the graceful, silent, creation of big dreamers. They are the symbols of big dreams. They are the epitome of man's deep rooted desire to create machines many times bigger than themselves that tame nature.

Hybrid Air Vehicles have spent years developing the airship idea, taking it to the next level by creating not only the world's largest Hybrid Aircraft, but the world's largest flying aircraft, Airlander!


Several other companies around the world are developing giant airships for a number of roles;
- airships that carry cargo,
- airships that provide low cost communications,
- airships carrying security surveillance equipment
- and airships that provide an environmentally friendly alternative to conventional aircraft.

But the giant Airlander airship, has got there first.
 


However, the Airlander, built by Hybrid Air Vehicles at the famous old Cardington airship hangars (where the R101 airship was built), has not had an easy journey. In its original form, as a surveillance ship for the US Army, budget cuts meant she was soon cancelled, scrapped and cut up. Against all the odds, she was saved and what came next can only be descibed as an inspirational story of incredible achievement. It's a story of a small group of men battling against the odds, taking on some of the biggest companies in the world by realising the dream of the original designer, who died just two months before their first order.

With unique, behind the scenes access from the last two and a half years (already filmed), leading up to and including the first flight, this amazing story can be told for the first time.

 

What this campaign will fund

This funding will unlock nearly three years of unfunded filming behind the scenes, following the story of Airlander. With official, unique, behind the scenes access to design and building work, technical, strategic, financial and managment challenges and meetings - this is a story like no other.

Ultimately your contribution will pay for the post production process of the mini series, including:

  • Editing costs
  • Music costs
  • Archive costs
  • Computer animation costs
  • Sound mixing and picture grading costs
  • DVD and Blu-Ray mastering costs
  • Completion costs to produce a broadcast master for possible transmission on a major global broadcaster

 

 

    Who is making it?

    Internationally award winning documentary filmmaker, Dean Arnett is making 'The Story of Airlander', along with two other major airship documentaries (not part of this campaign but coming out later in 2016) through the production company, Dean Media Ltd.

    Dean has been in the industry for nearly thirty years and now splits his time between documentary making and delivering training on production and filmmaking for major broadcasters around the world such as the BBC.

    You can find out more about Dean and the background of 'The Story of Airlander' at his website - www.airlander.deanarnett.com

    Risks & Challenges

    Nearly three years of unfunded filming has taken place so far, so we will make sure this series is completed no matter what.

    You WILL see 'The Story of Airlander' in 2016 on your TV!

     

     

     

      So what do I get?

       

      We want you to be as excited about this story and project as we are. So we want to share as much with you as we possibly can. From regular news updates to credits at the end of films to executive producer status to special edition Blu-Ray discs of the series and limited edition posters, we want to reward your help.



      The Story of Airlander is an independent production. Whilst it is authorised by Hybrid Air Vehicles it is not funded by them and is completely independent of H.A.V., their crowd funding campaigns and their projects. This is NOT a corporate video and allows us to tell the FULL story.



      Airlander club members contributing to this campaign, will however, get an additional disc featuring the 30 minute film 'Flying the Airlander'', not available anywhere else. For more details of the airlander club and it's benefits visit here... http://www.hybridairvehicles.com/airlander-club

       

      After nearly three years of completely independent, unfunded filming, this series is almost finished, so join us now and be part of the final leg of this incredibly exciting journey!
       


      all videos, pictures and images ©2016 Dean Media Ltd

story:
FELLOW WHOVIANS!  LEND YOUR RESPECTIVE LISTENING APPARATUS!

Thank you Fans!  We made episode 2!  Have we told you how amazing you are?  Check it out HERE!
Guess what...the gang wants to make....ANOTHER EPISODE!  A BETTER ONE!  How can you do that?  A LOUD HUSH was so great!    We can, and we will!  If you can help us out.

For those who don't know the Ginger Doctor?  
Have you been stuck in the gridlocked motorway of NewNewYork hyped upon bliss?!  Just kidding!  

Doctor Who: The Ginger Chronicles is the first professional, independent Doctor Who series that not only comes from the US, but stars a lady-ginger Doctor.

The Ginger Chronicles has professionals working in front and behind the camera all working to bring you a great episode. For you, the Doctor Who fan, our series is a great opportunity to see the world through the eyes of the Doctor as she comes to grips with the mysteries of the universe and womanhood.  Womanhood is far more complicated.

Doctor Who: The Ginger Chronicles’ first episode, 'A Dame to Kill' has over 25,000 views in its short life-span on the web and in conventions. But we couldn't stop there.  Then 'A Loud Hush', A Doctor Who/Buffy The Vampire Slayer Crossover there to make the Whedon and Moffat fans join hands and sing songs around the green glow of the web.  We now have a script in the works for episode three.  This is gonna be the big one!  

Lilly really enjoys playing the Doctor.  Until the BBC calls her up and offers her the role this is the only way for her to live her dream of being a gender fluid time traveling alien with an accent.  

*CHRIS CHINBALL, HERE I AM!*

Why do we need you?

Once again...this is a FAN SERIES!  We make $0 from doing this.  While we would love to do this again, we can't afford another on our own dime.  Most of us do this acting/filming thing for a living and this offers a monetary reward envied only by those who make less than nothing.  

Our team really has fun putting the whole thing together for you!  However, remember those professionals we mentioned earlier?  The ones who do this and only this for a living?  Yeah, they tell us they want to do this in exchange for a strange thing called money.  We had some extra lying around, and you had some extra lying around on the last two.  This was able to pay the discounted fee these professionals gave us to get going and start getting a fanbase.  Now we need your help to make another episode and this time we have to pay a little more.  

From Left to Right:Tom Gore, Tim Bell, Rebecca Larken, Steven Hancock, Lilly Nelson


Below is an approximation of where all this money goes.

And let's not forget that we have to fulfill the perks.  And there are IGG fees.  Making a movie is HARD!  Yes, we could make another episode and it would eventually get out in three years.  Or we could do one using a cheaper camera guy and less effective CG.  But we don't want to step back.  We want to get one out this year with the quality that you might find on the BBC.  This means we have to pay our production staff like anyone else.   Would you step away from your job to do a similar job you like slightly more for free?  I don't think so.  The whole filmmaking process is a 24/7 job.  

We love entertaining you and want desperately to continue to do so. And we think you want the same thing.  

And remember… there are no “small” donations, so whether you can give a little or a lot, we promise to use every single dollar we receive to make this episode the best one yet!

We realize you can easily donate somewhere else. I mean honestly, you could spend your money on an electric toothbrush for your infant or the newest adult themed novelty item that keeps beat with your favorite music.   But we thank you for considering donating to art and fandom.  We take our obligation to you, our backers, very seriously.   We love you all!

STRETCH GOALS 

If you deem us worthy to donate more than we ask for, we have a few plans. 

SPECIAL PERK At $ 6,000 every donor who donates at least $10 gets a set of 3 exclusive digital movie posters!  Created by our cadre of impressive graphic artists, these exclusive digital posters are free to all donors of $10 or more when we hit $7,000

$ 8,000

At this level we get to work on the interior TARDIS console, making it far more functional and definitely more like the sexy thing we all know and love. We’ll install telepathic relays, chrome levers, buttons that light up, smoke, mirrors; all the ringing-dinging things we can find.

SPECIAL PERK At $ 10,000 every donor who donates at least $20 gets a logo patch with the design featured on the front of our T-Shirt.

Anything over $10,000 and we will faint.  
So much to be done!  Go Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/DoctorWhoGingerChronicles to stay updated on all the progress!
If you prefer to Donate without perks just PayPal us at DoctorWhoTheGingerChronicles@gmail.com
And MOST of ALL

THANK YOU and GERONIMO!!!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Aaron Zomback, I am a cinema creator and this will be my 2nd movie. This past winter 2016 I self-funded and completed EXPANDED METAL (23:33min) which is my first cinema project. 

EXPANDED METAL is available to stream online at https://vimeo.com/aaronzomback/expandedmetal

A few requests before watching:

1) Watch in HD 1080p (Click the HD button) and in darkest lighting conditions possible.

2) Turn the volume as high as it can go and use headphones or the best sound system that is accessible.


In EXPANDED METAL, we see a group of young Dwellers underground who stare and 'feed' on the flickering lights from Above. I still have not completely left the 'world' of EXPANDED METAL yet and this next short, which will not exceed 11min, will occur in the same aether as EXPANDED METAL. Think of it as a continuation in the same cinematic map. 

[EXPANDED METAL (2016) - STILL IMAGES]


My inspiration comes from the Mystery and all of my senses: vision, smell, touch, hearing, and taste. Together these 5 senses compose my Cinema and effectively produces vibrations and energies that you, the spectator, will feel. Feelings such as fear, paranoia, and desire. Cinema is still in its infancy and we humans have just barely TAPPED it's potential.

I believe that the great cinema artists who've come before us hooked us on the right track - but unfortunately we have derailed ourselves from these artists' great struggles and passions.

As Gilles Deleuze wrote, "One cannot object by pointing to the vast proportion of rubbish in cinematographic production - it is no worse than anywhere else, although it does have unparalleled economic and industrial consequences . The great cinema directors are hence merely more vulnerable - it is infinitely easier to prevent them from doing their work."

and he goes on to say...

"The history of cinema is a long martyrology. Nevertheless, the cinema still forms part of art and part of thought in the irreplaceable, autonomous forms which these directors were able to invent and get screened, in spite of everything."

I create cinema so that I can grab your senses and shake them up. I want you to WAKE UP from the menial tasks of our day-to-day existence and feel something that is unspeakable.

I ask for your monetary contribution so that I too can invent and get screened, in spite of everything.

Thank you.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I have a goal to raise 2,500$ to fund this project which will be put towards paying the cast members, equipment rentals, costumes, other collaborators such as sound and production assistants, and post-production.
  • Even if my goal of 2,500$ is not reached - I will put all of what I am able to raise towards this production.

The Impact

  • I chose to self-fund my first movie, EXPANDED METAL, because I wanted to prove that I can finish what I start.
  • I know exactly what it takes to produce a short movie
  • I know how to get things done.
  • This finished production will be released to screen online and in venues next fall 2016/winter 2017

Risks & Challenges

  • The only risk is that I don't receive any donations and I am unable to continue my work in cinema.
story_txt:
Short Summary My name is Aaron Zomback, I am a cinema creator and this will be my 2nd movie. This past winter 2016 I self-funded and completed EXPANDED METAL (23:33min) which is my first cinema project. 
EXPANDED METAL is available to stream online at https://vimeo.com/aaronzomback/expandedmetal
A few requests before watching:
1) Watch in HD 1080p (Click the HD button) and in darkest lighting conditions possible.
2) Turn the volume as high as it can go and use headphones or the best sound system that is accessible.

In EXPANDED METAL, we see a group of young Dwellers underground who stare and 'feed' on the flickering lights from Above. I still have not completely left the 'world' of EXPANDED METAL yet and this next short, which will not exceed 11min, will occur in the same aether as EXPANDED METAL. Think of it as a continuation in the same cinematic map.

story: HEY GUYS!!!! My name is Russell Peterkin. I am the writer/creator of a web series called Mob Days. Mob Days started filming in late October 2015 and finished up filming in late February 2016. Mob days is about the mafia in 1968. There are three main characters Christopher, Billy And Tommy and how they endure the pressure and consequences of being in the mob. They run with the Venetti crime family. We pitched five mini episodes to the audience to see if they like it and would now like to make a return to finish off the second half of the first season. We will be using the contributions to pay the cast and to upgrade some of our production equipment. The risk and the challenges are having people willing and able to invest in our project. How we can overcome this challenge is promoting and marketing. One unique tool is word of mouth telling once person and that person telling a few more people.

story:
HEROES RISING

Help us fund our project about kids learning filmmaking and changing the conversation about heroin addiction.

Around the country communities are responding to the heroin epidemic. It is grim. It is overwhelming. Resources don’t begin to match the problem.

And attitudes range from punitive to pity, without enough other elements coming into play.

Kids becoming Super Heroes:

Enter Captain Solar and the Helios Corps. ‘Heroes  Rising’ is the short film Wega Arts is making with and about teenagers, It is about kids who find a way to tap into their strength by speaking up, by inspiring each other, and by actively working for change in the community. The film combines comic book style graphics, special effects, and live action.

High School kids will be working alongside professional filmmakers as both cast and crew to make the short film ‘Heroes Rising’.  Along with learning filmmaking, the kids will have the opportunity to have a positive impact on their peers and their communities.


It all comes down to the value of telling a story in images-learning the steps in planning each scene and breaking down shots. Good stuff!

How will this film change the world?

We will inspire some young filmmakers to go on and do great things.

Most importantly, we will be creating a tool that can bring kids and adults together to have a meaningful and constructive dialogue about the heroin and opioid problem. Groups of resilient kids, each drawing on their own inner superhero, will go a long way toward fighting the heroin epidemic.

The film will be presented to local community groups and schools with discussions led by Jesse Heffernan of Helios Recovery. Although we are based in Central Wisconsin the film will be made available to community groups nationwide.

Please find your own super hero within yourself and support Heroes Rising!

UPDATE: July 25 - Filming is completed and the workshop was a terrific experience for all involved. We are moving on to post production. We will be working with the workshop participants to edit and animate the movie as well as work on the sound.


What we need funding for…

To make this film we need to pay for...

Equipment Rental: Camera, lights, grip truck and more. And of course, drone shots.

Costumes: Creating iconic super heroes takes some spandex and a lot of designing and sewing and other materials, shoes, boots, insignia, and more.

Travel and stipends: Our crew includes local filmmakers, and two traveling here from NYC. Our sound guy, Louis Gordon, came to Wisconsin when we showed his film in the Weyauwega International Film Festival, in November 2015. We agreed to get in touch because we wanted to do a short as a learning opportunity. And now, he will be here, with his experience and equipment.

Crew: Sound person, Cinematographer and other crew members will receive stipends for their work.

Special FX, Graphic Artist, Animator & Musical Score: Expertise and experience required. And talent.

Editing and Post Production: A very crucial part of filmmaking.

Food for cast and crew: Very, very important!

The outreach program led by Jesse Heffernan of Helios Recovery which will follow the film’s premieres will require a lot of organization and mechanics and the production of dvds and materials.

The film will be shot over the Summer with post production completed in the Fall. More at Heroes Rising

Check out this Video about our animator Craig Knitt...

About us…

Wega Arts is a non-profit arts organization located in Weyauwega, Wisconsin. Wega Arts owns and operates the historic Gerold Opera House, which serves as our home base. Since starting in 2007 we have presented numerous original plays and several original musicals, concerts, arts shows and the annual Weyauwega International Film Festival held each November at the Gerold. One of Wega Arts’ first projects was working with local kids to make a documentary film, ‘Getting to the Bottom of Lake Weyauwega’, about the problems with our local lake. Wega Arts’ Artistic Director Kathy Fehl and Executive Director Ian Teal have a background in theater and film. More at Wega Arts

Kids Filming GETTING TO THE BOTTOM OF LAKE WEYAUWEGA


Who's Who...

Kathy Fehl - Screen Play Writer / Executive Producer

Artistic Director of Wega Arts since founding it with Ian Teal in 2007. Wrote, directed, and produced plays in NYC, co-wrote, and produced MINT JULEP, feature film with David Morse, Angelica Page, John Mezzacappa & James Gandolfini, With Wega Arts: produced documentary GETTING TO THE BOTTOM OF LAKE WEYAUWEGA, wrote two one act plays, and two musicals: SECRETS of the DEAD and VILLAINS of VAUDEVILLE. Produced and directed many others.

Ian Teal – Director / Executive Producer

Executive Director of Wega Arts since founding it with Kathy Fehl in 2007. Original member of comedy troupe AFTERWORDS, which performed in NYC and on Martha’s Vineyard, developed amphitheater on the Vineyard and produced plays there, wrote and directed plays in NYC. Directed the premiere of Richard Vetere’s JOHNNY ON THE PONY. Directed movie EMERALD TRIANGLE. Worked as crew and actor in Jon Jost’s feature ALL THE VERMEERS in NEW YORK. Directed, and co-wrote and co-produced MINT JULEP, feature film with David Morse, Angelica Page, John Mezzacappa and James Gandolfini. With Wega Arts: taught kids elements of filmmaking during the making of GETTING TO THE BOTTOM OF LAKE WEYAUWEGA.

Jesse Heffernan – Helios Recovery / Executive Producer

Jesse Heffernan is a Certified Recovery Coach & consultant with 15 years in long term recovery from substance use. He has worked with medical providers, and the WI State Council on AODA, local coalitions and grass roots nonprofits as an advocate for implementation of culturally intelligent, recovery oriented continuum's of care. He has trained over 70 coaches statewide in WI. It is his belief that Recovery is a process of moving from surviving to thriving as a whole person. He is a creative, imaginative, forward-thinking and committed Servant Leader, Program Director and Community Net worker who works to create a meaningful and positive change through innovative solutions to complex community and individual needs.

Craig Anthony Knitt— Graphic Artist/ Animator

Craig has made several award winning films, including best narrative short from the Weyauwega International Film Festival. Craig is one of the founders of the Wildwood Festival in Appleton. He is a graphic illustrator, an animator, and maker and lover of comic books. Craig is currently working on a film with middle school kids at the Boys and Girls Club in Green Bay. He will build the graphic cards and work on the animation which will be a part of Heroes Rising.

Adam Racette – Score / Soundtrack Producer

Adam Racette, (Bo1katt) is a musician, producer, and event organizer from Appleton,WI. He is owner and founder of Face Entertainment LLC, which has brought over 70 National touring acts to his home state and provided countless opportunities for the local musicians in his area. Coming from a background of partying hard and trouble, Adam has found a new life in staying clean, being involved in community outreach events and providing other artists, that live a clean life from drugs and alcohol, with a platform to spread a good message through their music. These services are provided through a new idea called A.I.R. (Artists In Recovery) and Allies. 

Matt Quade – Artist / Soundtrack Producer

Matt Quade, (Rhythmical Braille) is a musician out of Brownsville Texas. Focused on bringing positive insight and energy through his unique style of music. Quade states his musical roots range from Rock/rap to Funk and Reggae. Never using any substance of drugs through out his life, gives Quade a mind state he calls, " Raw Emotion" that he brings on to his work and to the stage for the crowd to feel. "I've never been high on any drug. Never even tried smoking weed. i don't need it. The love i have for this music is what i would think is my only drug. im cool with that." R. Braille is currently in the works with Face Entertainment's owner and founder, Adam Racette, to bring and spread the love through his music and passion with what he does.

 John Jackson Miller – Creative Consultant / Associate Producer

"New York Times bestselling author and comics historian John Jackson Miller has written more than twenty novels and graphic novels, including the Star Trek: Prey novel trilogy from Pocket Books releasing monthly starting in September 2016. He has written several Star Wars novels including Kenobi and A New Dawn, and comics in the Mass Effect universe. His first Halo comics and prose work appears in two different volumes releasing this fall. His fiction website is http://www.farawaypress.com. A Wisconsin resident, he is happy to support "Heroes Rising" both for its cause and to support the arts in the state."

Maggie Thompson Creative Consultant / Associate Producer

Maggie Thompson collected comic books when she was 4 years old and has been an active collector ever since. She began publishing fanzines with Don Thompson when she was 18, beginning with a flyer to promote their upcoming Comic Art. She married Don in 1962, and they were among the pioneers in what developed into comic-book fandom, becoming co-editors of Comics Buyer’s Guide in 1983; she continued editing the magazine after his death in 1994. Though CBG ceased publication in January 2013, her projects continue, including participation in Comic-Con International’s Toucan blog and in Gemstone’s Scoop newsletter. Among her other credits are a story arc for Innovation’s Dark Shadows title and awards that include Eisner Awards, an Inkpot Award, the Diamond Lifetime Fandom Award, the Bob Clampett Humanitarian Award, and the Friends of Lulu Women of Distinction Award.

Adam Gundersheimer - Director of Photography/Workshop Leader

Adam is a graduate of NYU Tisch’s school of film and television program. He has been credited as director of photography for over 17 narrative films since 2011, and his work has spanned documentaries, commercials, and music videos. He is also the co-founder of the award-winning Panoptica Films production company.

Todd Mallasch - First AD/Key Grip

Todd is a film crew grip for projects all over the Midwest on commercials, films and many spots for the NFL in Green Bay.
