story:
WHERE DO WE GO FROM HERE tells how family, core of union, growth and education, can become a place of pain and failure. A man, after killing his wife, experiences a dilemma: what to do of the seven-year-old son knocking at the door of his study?

DOVE SI VA DA QUI racconta come la famiglia, nucleo di unione, crescita e formazione, diventa uno spazio di dolore e fallimento. Un uomo, dopo aver ucciso la moglie, vive un dilemma: che fare del figlio di sette anni che bussa alla porta del suo studio?

 

WHERE DO WE GO FROM HERE is a short film that develops the drama of male violence against women and children, focusing on the violent man's story. The script deepens newspaper crimes tragedies. I’ve asked myself: “what was it like when they were happy? How did they feel before they behave in so extreme and violent way? How did they face the eyes of those who once loved them?” WHERE DO WE GO FROM HERE comes from the purpose to tell if something healthy and positive remains in family relationships, when anger and loneliness have prevailed.

DOVE SI VA DA QUI è un cortometraggio che si sviluppa intorno al dramma della violenza maschile sulle donne e sui bambini, con la peculiarità di mettere al centro della storia l'uomo violento. Il soggetto approfondisce le tragedie che riempiono la cronaca nera dei quotidiani. Mi sono chiesto: “com’era la vita di queste persone quando erano felici? Come si sono sentite prime di commettere gesti così estremi e violenti? Come hanno affrontato lo sguardo di chi un tempo li amava?”.  DOVE SI VA DA QUI nasce dal desiderio di indagare se rimane qualcosa di sano e positivo nelle relazioni familiari, quando rabbia e solitudine hanno avuto il sopravvento.

WHERE DO WE GO FROM HERE allows me to bring to the screen ordinary people dark side, a path started with Il Gatto del Maine, best short film at Roma International Film Festival in 2012. If in the previously short film I tried to explore “the banality of evil” with negative and avoid of any ethical conflict characters, in WHERE DO WE GO FROM HERE the main character is haunted by a deep inner conflict, a family man who becomes executioner. The stylistic choices will be focused on keep the audience both in and out of the characters because what happens is so intimate and complicate that you can’t explain it all the way. While I was writing the script, I tailed the two characters to imagine what could go through their own heart and head, to deeply understand while this story has to be told.

Con DOVE SI VA DA QUI proseguo il percorso iniziato con Il Gatto del Maine, miglior cortometraggio al Festival Internazionale del Film di Roma nel 2012, ovvero portare sullo schermo il lato oscuro delle persone “comuni”. Se nel corto precedente ho tentato di esplorare “la banalità del male” con personaggi negativi e privi di qualunque conflitto etico, il protagonista di DOVE SI VA DA QUI è al contrario tormentato da un profondo conflitto interiore, poichè da padre di famiglia diventa carnefice. Le scelte stilistiche avranno l'obiettivo di tenere lo spettatore in bilico nei confronti dei personaggi lasciandolo al tempo stesso dentro e fuori da essi: ciò che accade dentro di loro è così intimo e complesso da non poter essere spiegato. Nello scrivere la sceneggiatura ho immaginato di pedinare i due protagonisti per cercare di capire cosa possa passar loro nel cuore e nella testa, per comprendere a fondo perché questa storia debba essere raccontata. 

WHERE DO WE GO FROM HERE will develop two different points of view: father-son emotional relationship on the one hand and the killer and his potential victim affair on the other. The fatal and social nature of the storytelling will develop also a tension aspect: will the child be able to save himself? Will the father find the clarity to understand his insane direction?

DOVE SI VA DA QUI porterà lo spettatore ad assumere un doppio punto di vista narrativo: da una parte l’emotiva relazione padre-figlio, dall’altra la vicenda di un assassino e della sua potenziale vittima. La natura tragica e sociale della narrazione svilupperà anche una dimensione tensiva: riuscirà il bambino a salvarsi? Ritroverà il padre la lucidità per comprendere il folle percorso che ha intrapreso?

It wasn’t easy to find an experienced and talented actor for a so delicate and risky role: Peppino Mazzotta was chosen for his ability to play with personality and experience the murder father role, an ordinary face man full of nuances and contradictions. Peppino Mazzotta - movie, theater and tv actor - has shown ease and versatility playing  naturally both positive and comforting role like Inspector Fazio once in Il Commissario Montalbano (an talian famous tv series for Rai Uno), both controversial and murky criminal with respectable face role like the main character of Anime Nere by Francesco Munzi (2014), winner of 9 Donatello David and 3 Silver Ribbon award.

Non è stato semplice trovare un attore esperto e di talento per un ruolo così delicato e rischioso: Peppino Mazzotta è stato scelto per la capacità di interpretare con personalità ed equilibrio il ruolo del padre assassino, un uomo dal volto comune ricco di sfumature e contraddizioni. Attore cinematografico, teatrale e televisivo, Peppino Mazzotta ha mostrato negli ultimi anni grande versatilità nell'interpretare sia ruoli positivi come quello dell’ispettore Fazio nella serie tv Il Commissario Montalbano (Rai Uno), sia ruoli controversi e oscuri come quello del criminale con la faccia perbene, protagonista del film Anime Nere di Francesco Munzi (2014), vincitore di 9 David di Donatello e 3 Nastri d’Argento. 

The young co-star was chosen after we've met many kids. Even if he’s only 8 years old, Riccardo shown great professionalism and talent, he immersed himself in an emotional condition able to return the character’s fragility. After several experiences in commercials (including Mulino Bianco one's with Antonio Banderas) for the first time he contends with a dramatic role in a film.

Il piccolo coprotagonista è stato scelto dopo aver incontrato numerosi bambini. Nonostante abbia solo 8 anni, Riccardo ha dimostrato grande professionalità e attitudine nel calarsi in una condizione emotiva capace di restituire la fragilità del personaggio. Dopo varie esperienze in pubblicità (tra cui Mulino Bianco con Antonio Banderas) si misura per la prima volta con un ruolo cinematografico e drammatico.

The production company Oki Doki Film was immediately interested in WHERE DO WE GO FROM HERE screenplay. We chosen together cast and crew, we shot a teaser video and we launched a Facebook page where you can be updated on project development. The film production and distribution company ZEN MOVIE has become partner of the project, as co-producer of the short film, for the distribution of WHERE DO WE GO FROM HERE in the national and international festival circuit. We’ve also started a partnership with some important organizations that daily work to help violent men and theirs victims, like NoiNo.org community and LVD Centre (free ourselves from violence)and the ARES Centre.

La casa di produzione Oki Doki Film fin da subito ha dimostrato interesse per la sceneggiatura di DOVE SI VA DA QUI. Insieme abbiamo formato il cast e scelto le principali figure professionali della troupe, abbiamo girato un teaser e lanciato la pagina Facebook del cortometraggio dove è possibile essere aggiornati sull’evoluzione del progetto. La casa di produzione e distribuzione cinematografica ZEN MOVIE è diventata partner del progetto in qualità di co-produttore del cortometraggio, ci supporterà nel percorso di promozione del cortometraggio all’interno del circuito festivaliero nazionale e internazionale. In questi mesi abbiamo inoltre avviato un dialogo con alcune importanti associazioni che si occupano di aiutare gli uomini maltrattanti e le loro vittime, come la community di NoiNo.org, il Centro LDV (Liberiamoci dalla violenza) di Modena e il Centro ARES (Centro di ascolto uomini autori di violenza domestica) di Bassano del Grappa. 

 

 

We ourselves have invested in this short film and we’ve found the support of early contributors. But that’s not enough! We need to picked up 8,000 euro to sustain the production costs.

Abbiamo investito in prima persona e abbiamo coinvolto i primi finanziatori. Ma non basta! Abbiamo bisogno di ottenere altri 8.000 euro per sostenere i costi di produzione.

 

 

WHERE DO WE GO FROM HERE is an independent project, so we need your help! Every contributions, no matter how small, is very important for me and for all of us. Your contributions will also be paid off with small rewards we’ll give you to thank you for your support! You can find them in the PERKS section.

DOVE SI VA DA QUI è un progetto indipendente, per questo abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto!  Ogni contributo, anche il più piccolo, è fondamentale per me e per tutti noi. ll tuo contributo sarà ripagato con delle piccole ricompense che saremo felici di donarti per ringraziarti del tuo sostegno! Puoi scoprirli subito nella sezione “PERKS”, sul lato destro dello schermo.

 
 

Author of short films and music videos, as a director he begins in 2005 directing  Piazza Vittorio a music video for Fonderia, which received the audience award at 12th Capalbio Short Film Festival. In the following years he realized comedies like Il Malato (Arcipelago Film Festivsl award winner in 2008), social commitment short film like Oggi ho altro da fare about youth unemployment (Bolzano Film Festival and Sulmona Film Festival award winner), and Sessanta percento about mental illness. Il Gatto del Maine is his last work, best short film at Roma International Film Festival in 2012.

Autore di cortometraggi e videoclip musicali, esordisce nel 2005 con la regia di Piazza Vittorio per la band Fonderia, premio del pubblico al 12° Capalbio Short Film Festival. Negli anni successivi, alla produzione di lavori musicali alterna la realizzazione di commedie come Il Malato (vincitore all’Arcipelago Film Festival 2008), corti d’impegno sociale come Oggi ho altro da fare, storia di disoccupazione giovanile (vincitore al Bolzano film festival e al Sulmona film festival), e Sessanta percento, storia di malattia mentale. Ultimo corto è Il Gatto del Maine (2012), vincitore al Festival Internazionale del film di Roma 2012.

Oki Doki Film is an independent movie and multimedia production company, a creative factory working into three areas: MOVIE, TV and COMMUNICATION - www.okidokifilm.it. Since 2007 Oki Doki Fim produced several short films and documentaries screened at italian and international film festival (Tutto vero!, CometeCOMETe, PerDono, L'altro ospedale) and in 2013 it produced – directed by Beppe Manzi – the first feature film Gli Anni e i Giorni, about small-town boys and girl last year of school. In 2015 Falling. Una storia d’amore, script written by Beppe Manzi and the screenwriter Mariano Di Nardo, was among the finalists at Solinas Award. Currently working on: Feel The Wind - post production - documentary about the paralympic training year of Martina Caironi, the fastest woman with leg prothesis; Subs Heroes - in production - creative documentary co-produced with Duel:Film about Italiansubs community. 

Oki Doki Film è una società di produzione cinematografica e multimediale, factory creativa che lavora nei settori CINEMA, TV e COMUNICAZIONE - www.okidokifilm.it. Dal 2007 produce cortometraggi e documentari presentati in festival italiani e internazionali (Tutto vero!, CometeCOMETe, PerDono, L'altro ospedale) e nel 2013 produce - per la regia di Beppe Manzi - il primo lungometraggio Gli Anni e i Giorni, docufilm che racconta l'ultimo anno di liceo di un gruppo di ragazzi di provincia. Nel 2015 Falling. Una storia d'amore, soggetto scritto da Beppe Manzi con lo sceneggiatore Mariano di Nardo, è tra i finalisti del Premio Solinas. Tra i progetti in lavorazione: L'Aria sul Viso - in post produzione - documentario  che racconta l'anno di preparazione alle Paralimpiadi di Martina Caironi, la donna con protesi più veloce al mondo;  Subs Heroes - in post produzione - creative documentary che racconta la comunità dei fansubber, in coproduzione con Duel:Film e Gray Ladder.

Zen Movie is a film production and distribution company founded to produce short films by young authors and to promote them through the major national and international festivals - www.zenmovie.it. Among the short films produced and distributed: Charles and Clara - directed by Giulio Mastromauro, owner of the company - winner of over 50 awards worldwide including the Special Prize at the David di Donatello 2014, Niente by Alessandro Porzio and Nuvola, nominated for Nastri d'Argento and winner of several international award. Among short films distributed by the company Moby Dick, by Nicola Sorcinelli with Kasia Smutniak and La Quiete, by Gabriele Galli with Mimmo Calopresti. Currently on work: A winter and Marylin, an animation film.

Zen Movie è una casa di produzione e distribuzione cinematografica nata con l'obiettivo di realizzare cortometraggi di giovani autori e promuoverli nei maggiori festival nazionali e internazionali - www.zenmovie.it. Tra i cortometraggi prodotti e distribuiti: Carlo e Clara - per la regia di Giulio Mastromauro, titolare della società - vincitore di oltre 50 premi nel mondo tra cui il Premio Speciale ai David di Donatello 2014, Niente di Alessandro Porzio e Nuvola, candidato ai Nastri d'Argento e vincitore di numeri premi internazionali. Tra i cortometraggi distribuiti dalla società Moby Dick, di Nicola Sorcinelli con Kasia Smutniak e La Quiete, di Gabriele Galli con Mimmo Calopresti. Sono attualmente in lavorazione i cortometraggi Un inverno e Marylin, un progetto di animazione.

You can be part of the crew, contributing to the birth WHERE DO WE GO FROM HERE and taking it on the big screen! If you can not make a donation, you can still be helpful sharing the link of our campaign on socials or by email.

Puoi diventare parte di questo gruppo, contribuendo a far nascere DOVE SI VA DA QUI e portarlo sul grande schermo! Se non puoi fare una donazione, puoi essere comunque indispensabile condividendo il link della nostra campagna sulle tue pagine social o via e-mail, facendoci così conoscere ai tuoi amici.

Thanks for you support! - Grazie per il tuo aiuto!

La natura tragica e sociale della narrazione svilupperà anche una dimensione tensiva: riuscirà il bambino a salvarsi? Ritroverà il padre la lucidità per comprendere il folle percorso che ha intrapreso?It wasn’t easy to find an experienced and talented actor for a so delicate and risky role: Peppino Mazzotta was chosen for his ability to play with personality and experience the murder father role, an ordinary face man full of nuances and contradictions. Peppino Mazzotta - movie, theater and tv actor - has shown ease and versatility playing  naturally both positive and comforting role like Inspector Fazio once in Il Commissario Montalbano (an talian famous tv series for Rai Uno), both controversial and murky criminal with respectable face role like the main character of Anime Nere by Francesco Munzi (2014), winner of 9 Donatello David and 3 Silver Ribbon award.Non è stato semplice trovare un attore esperto e di talento per un ruolo così delicato e rischioso: Peppino Mazzotta è stato scelto per la capacità di interpretare con personalità ed equilibrio il ruolo del padre assassino, un uomo dal volto comune ricco di sfumature e contraddizioni. Attore cinematografico, teatrale e televisivo, Peppino Mazzotta ha mostrato negli ultimi anni grande versatilità nell'interpretare sia ruoli positivi come quello dell’ispettore Fazio nella serie tv Il Commissario Montalbano (Rai Uno), sia ruoli controversi e oscuri come quello del criminale con la faccia perbene, protagonista del film Anime Nere di Francesco Munzi (2014), vincitore di 9 David di Donatello e 3 Nastri d’Argento. The young co-star was chosen after we've met many kids. Even if he’s only 8 years old, Riccardo shown great professionalism and talent, he immersed himself in an emotional condition able to return the character’s fragility. After several experiences in commercials (including Mulino Bianco one's with Antonio Banderas) for the first time he contends with a dramatic role in a film.Il piccolo coprotagonista è stato scelto dopo aver incontrato numerosi bambini. Nonostante abbia solo 8 anni, Riccardo ha dimostrato grande professionalità e attitudine nel calarsi in una condizione emotiva capace di restituire la fragilità del personaggio. Dopo varie esperienze in pubblicità (tra cui Mulino Bianco con Antonio Banderas) si misura per la prima volta con un ruolo cinematografico e drammatico.The production company Oki Doki Film was immediately interested in WHERE DO WE GO FROM HERE screenplay. We chosen together cast and crew, we shot a teaser video and we launched a Facebook page where you can be updated on project development. The film production and distribution company ZEN MOVIE has become partner of the project, as co-producer of the short film, for the distribution of WHERE DO WE GO FROM HERE in the national and international festival circuit. We’ve also started a partnership with some important organizations that daily work to help violent men and theirs victims, like NoiNo.org community and LVD Centre (free ourselves from violence)and the ARES Centre.La casa di produzione Oki Doki Film fin da subito ha dimostrato interesse per la sceneggiatura di DOVE SI VA DA QUI. Insieme abbiamo formato il cast e scelto le principali figure professionali della troupe, abbiamo girato un teaser e lanciato la pagina Facebook del cortometraggio dove è possibile essere aggiornati sull’evoluzione del progetto. La casa di produzione e distribuzione cinematografica ZEN MOVIE è diventata partner del progetto in qualità di co-produttore del cortometraggio, ci supporterà nel percorso di promozione del cortometraggio all’interno del circuito festivaliero nazionale e internazionale. In questi mesi abbiamo inoltre avviato un dialogo con alcune importanti associazioni che si occupano di aiutare gli uomini maltrattanti e le loro vittime, come la community di NoiNo.org, il Centro LDV (Liberiamoci dalla violenza) di Modena e il Centro ARES (Centro di ascolto uomini autori di violenza domestica) di Bassano del Grappa.   We ourselves have invested in this short film and we’ve found the support of early contributors. But that’s not enough! We need to picked up 8,000 euro to sustain the production costs.Abbiamo investito in prima persona e abbiamo coinvolto i primi finanziatori. Ma non basta! Abbiamo bisogno di ottenere altri 8.000 euro per sostenere i costi di produzione.  WHERE DO WE GO FROM HERE is an independent project, so we need your help! Every contributions, no matter how small, is very important for me and for all of us. Your contributions will also be paid off with small rewards we’ll give you to thank you for your support! You can find them in the PERKS section.DOVE SI VA DA QUI è un progetto indipendente, per questo abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto!  Ogni contributo, anche il più piccolo, è fondamentale per me e per tutti noi. ll tuo contributo sarà ripagato con delle piccole ricompense che saremo felici di donarti per ringraziarti del tuo sostegno! Puoi scoprirli subito nella sezione “PERKS”, sul lato destro dello schermo.
 


 Author of short films and music videos, as a director he begins in 2005 directing  Piazza Vittorio a music video for Fonderia, which received the audience award at 12th Capalbio Short Film Festival. In the following years he realized comedies like Il Malato (Arcipelago Film Festivsl award winner in 2008), social commitment short film like Oggi ho altro da fare about youth unemployment (Bolzano Film Festival and Sulmona Film Festival award winner), and Sessanta percento about mental illness. Il Gatto del Maine is his last work, best short film at Roma International Film Festival in 2012.Autore di cortometraggi e videoclip musicali, esordisce nel 2005 con la regia di Piazza Vittorio per la band Fonderia, premio del pubblico al 12° Capalbio Short Film Festival. Negli anni successivi, alla produzione di lavori musicali alterna la realizzazione di commedie come Il Malato (vincitore all’Arcipelago Film Festival 2008), corti d’impegno sociale come Oggi ho altro da fare, storia di disoccupazione giovanile (vincitore al Bolzano film festival e al Sulmona film festival), e Sessanta percento, storia di malattia mentale. Ultimo corto è Il Gatto del Maine (2012), vincitore al Festival Internazionale del film di Roma 2012.Oki Doki Film is an independent movie and multimedia production company, a creative factory working into three areas: MOVIE, TV and COMMUNICATION - www.okidokifilm.it. Since 2007 Oki Doki Fim produced several short films and documentaries screened at italian and international film festival (Tutto vero!, CometeCOMETe, PerDono, L'altro ospedale) and in 2013 it produced – directed by Beppe Manzi – the first feature film Gli Anni e i Giorni, about small-town boys and girl last year of school. In 2015 Falling. Una storia d’amore, script written by Beppe Manzi and the screenwriter Mariano Di Nardo, was among the finalists at Solinas Award. Currently working on: Feel The Wind - post production - documentary about the paralympic training year of Martina Caironi, the fastest woman with leg prothesis; Subs Heroes - in production - creative documentary co-produced with Duel:Film about Italiansubs community. Oki Doki Film è una società di produzione cinematografica e multimediale, factory creativa che lavora nei settori CINEMA, TV e COMUNICAZIONE - www.okidokifilm.it. Dal 2007 produce cortometraggi e documentari presentati in festival italiani e internazionali (Tutto vero!, CometeCOMETe, PerDono, L'altro ospedale) e nel 2013 produce - per la regia di Beppe Manzi - il primo lungometraggio Gli Anni e i Giorni, docufilm che racconta l'ultimo anno di liceo di un gruppo di ragazzi di provincia. Nel 2015 Falling. Una storia d'amore, soggetto scritto da Beppe Manzi con lo sceneggiatore Mariano di Nardo, è tra i finalisti del Premio Solinas. Tra i progetti in lavorazione: L'Aria sul Viso - in post produzione - documentario  che racconta l'anno di preparazione alle Paralimpiadi di Martina Caironi, la donna con protesi più veloce al mondo;  Subs Heroes - in post produzione - creative documentary che racconta la comunità dei fansubber, in coproduzione con Duel:Film e Gray Ladder.Zen Movie is a film production and distribution company founded to produce short films by young authors and to promote them through the major national and international festivals - www.zenmovie.it. Among the short films produced and distributed: Charles and Clara - directed by Giulio Mastromauro, owner of the company - winner of over 50 awards worldwide including the Special Prize at the David di Donatello 2014, Niente by Alessandro Porzio and Nuvola, nominated for Nastri d'Argento and winner of several international award. Among short films distributed by the company Moby Dick, by Nicola Sorcinelli with Kasia Smutniak and La Quiete, by Gabriele Galli with Mimmo Calopresti. Currently on work: A winter and Marylin, an animation film.Zen Movie è una casa di produzione e distribuzione cinematografica nata con l'obiettivo di realizzare cortometraggi di giovani autori e promuoverli nei maggiori festival nazionali e internazionali - www.zenmovie.it. Tra i cortometraggi prodotti e distribuiti: Carlo e Clara - per la regia di Giulio Mastromauro, titolare della società - vincitore di oltre 50 premi nel mondo tra cui il Premio Speciale ai David di Donatello 2014, Niente di Alessandro Porzio e Nuvola, candidato ai Nastri d'Argento e vincitore di numeri premi internazionali. Tra i cortometraggi distribuiti dalla società Moby Dick, di Nicola Sorcinelli con Kasia Smutniak e La Quiete, di Gabriele Galli con Mimmo Calopresti. Sono attualmente in lavorazione i cortometraggi Un inverno e Marylin, un progetto di animazione.You can be part of the crew, contributing to the birth WHERE DO WE GO FROM HERE and taking it on the big screen! If you can not make a donation, you can still be helpful sharing the link of our campaign on socials or by email.Puoi diventare parte di questo gruppo, contribuendo a far nascere DOVE SI VA DA QUI e portarlo sul grande schermo! Se non puoi fare una donazione, puoi essere comunque indispensabile condividendo il link della nostra campagna sulle tue pagine social o via e-mail, facendoci così conoscere ai tuoi amici.Thanks for you support! - Grazie per il tuo aiuto!

story:
So It Follows

Chenoah began as a idea in 2014, through the combined efforts of Jordan Garry (filmmaker), Mariah Alexander-Buffalomeat (Actor, Sac & Fox), and Gene Weeden (Co-Director, Apache & Narragansett). In order to make this production a screen reality, we will need the support of interested donors such as yourself. Please become a part of our effort.

 

Why We Feel Our Project is Important

"Our people have been misunderstood for centuries. The word “Indian” symbolizes a lot of our nation’s history. Even today many Americans assume our culture comprises one unified group of people. But Native Americans were and will always be a nation of many tribes with different traditions, different alliances and different beliefs. Our way of life and the way of our ancestors has attracted the minds of the masses because balance, love and an understanding for the Earth are what we all must share in this modern day and age."

"The history of our people before the early times may not have been written. But the stories passed on from generation to generation will always paint a picture of what life was like."

"Hollywood has made billions exploiting and lying about our people. But today we the people have the ability to rise above to tell our own stories. Narrative films have the ability to create jobs in a way that no documentary film can. Movies are the storytelling medium of the modern age. With entertainment, viewers can experience the past in a way that’s truthful to the time. This story is a work of fiction, but all depictions are historically correct."

"Help us promote the history and culture of Native Americans by supporting us and talented crew of local artists. With your donations, we may have a chance to produce a film that will educate, entertain, employ and inspire."

Thank You... (Gene)

 

Our Incentives

As tokens of our appreciation we present our backers with genuine Native American handmade creations and varies digital assets from our production. 

Please keep in mind, that all hand made creations are one of a kind and take time. Rest assured, our craft makers will go right to work, filling the orders of our backers after our indiegogo campaign has concluded.

All digital assets, such as media kits, will be made available to recipients immediately following the production of Chenoah in the spring of 2017.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

 

Please help us have the opportunity to be heard.

Please use the Indiegogo tools to spread the word!

story:
"A Night in the Life" is an upcoming short film about a young woman with insomnia and her struggle to get through the night. This will be a graduation film produced at The London Film School.

The narrative follows a single night in the life of Ava, a sleep-deprived city-dweller who lives with her intuitive pet dog Bubbles. Throughout the night, she spies on a mysterious neighbour through her telescope, and he watches her silently through his. For most people with insomnia, the torture of not being able to attain something as simple as a good night's rest is indescribable. The film endeavors to vocalise those feelings. To depict a surreal world where time doesn't move as it should, where the need for companionship is urgent, and where the most ordinary things become extravagant.

This story was created when the Director decided to share her own experience with insomnia through film. The goal is to depict not only insomnia, but the mental struggle and loneliness that results from it.

Gabrielle Gozo / Writer & Director

Gabrielle started off as a graphic designer. After earning a BFA in Graphic Design, she worked as a mid-level and then senior designer for a number of advertising agencies and design studios in New York City. Clients Gabrielle produced work for include New York University, GlaxoSmithKline, New York Institute of Technology, Rockefeller Brothers Fund, the American Museum of Natural History, Everyday Health, and Johnson & Johnson. Her combined interests in storytelling and visual art brought her to work on independent films as a Production Designer and Set Decorator ("Minor Embarrassments", Official Selection at NYC Web Fest) before attending The London Film School (LFS) to earn a Masters in Filmmaking. At LFS, Gabrielle has contributed to films as a Production Designer, Editor ("KALI", Official Selection at Kasseler Dokfest), and Art Director. In addition to the art department, Gabrielle is a Writer, with a number of short and feature-length screenplays under her belt. ’A Night in the Life’ is Gabrielle’s graduation film.

Anastasia Raykova / Producer & Editor

Anastasia studied IT at university but then realized that her true passion is filmmaking. Along with her friends she started making films as a hobby but after getting success and producing an award-winning film “Stars”, she was encouraged to pursue career in filmmaking. Anastasia moved to Lisbon where she studied TV Production and worked on several film and TV projects. Constantly looking for professional development, Anastasia enrolled in the MA filmmaking course at the London Film School. During her education she had the opportunity to be a director, camera operator and producer. The last project “Enchanted” that Anastasia produced was quite challenging but the production finished successfully. Now she has jumped on board of “A Night in the Life” and will be taking on the role of editor as well.

Yiannis Manolopoulos / Director of Photography

After degrees in Philosophy and Project Management, Yiannis studied and practiced in the London Film School, specializing in cinematography and since then has been involved as a DoP and Steadicam operator, in numerous professional productions around the world, including the UK, Scotland, France, Greece, Turkey, Iran and Lebanon. His goal is to grow as a cinematographer and enable people sharing his passion for cinema to do what they love best, share stories through the creation of cinematic images. Yiannis was the recipient of the LFS 2014 PANALUX award for Cinematography and a recent graduate of the ASC Masterclass workshop. His first feature film as a Director of Photography, "Utopia", was longlisted for the 88th Academy awards, as the 2016 Afghanistan foreign film submission.

Kinsey Yukki Zhang / Production Designer

Kinsey graduated from the University of Toronto with a double major degree in Environmental Science Studies and Visual Art Communication. However, her learning experience at Sheridan College, which most of her art classes take place, has inspired and motivated her to go further in the field of Art Studies. With a huge interest in creative writing and video art, Kinsey was actively involved with student film festivals and workshops though college years. In 2015, Kinsey’s three short stories were chosen to be recorded and played on a Canadian radio channel ‘Life Rattle’; her story ‘Vein’ was selected at the 22nd Annual Totally Unknown Writers Festival in Toronto. and published in the 2015 festival stories. After university, Kinsey moved to Japan and worked as an intern in a local gallery, and online editor for youth fashion website. Kinsey started to embrace various approaches to the current Visual Culture, and keep wanting to learn other platforms which bridge idea and people. Early 2016, Kinsey enrolled in the MA filmmaking course at the London Film School, and she is still studying and thriving to create something connects the visuals and the human in the practice of filmmaking.

James Barnes / Casting Director

James began acting at the National Youth Theatre in 2008. He later trained at the American Academy of Dramatic Arts. Select credits include: KING LEAR, PRINCE OF DENMARK at the National Theatre, DANGEROUS LADY (Theatre Royal Stratford East), HOUSE OF ATREUS (Keochang International Festival of Theatre), CYMBELINE (Arts Theatre) and THE BALLERINA (Theatre 503). James recently concluded a UK/US tour, playing the title role of OTHELLO, culminating at Theatrelab NYC. Nominated ‘Best Actor’ at Film Life’s annual American Black Film Festival for his role in SABLE FABLE.

 

1st Assistant Camera: Matt Thomas
Assistant Director: Sedi Ghadiri
Gaffer: Antoine Billon
Sparks: Alessandro Fazio, Michelle Cho
Script Supervisor: Alice Fiennes
Makeup & Hair: Victoria Haffner
Production Assistants: Eliot Keown, Tim Archibald
Stills Photographer: Gabriele Sciotto

"A Night in the Life" is a student film and as such, we have a tight budget. We currently have some funds in the form of equity from The London Film School, some small private donations and the Director's own savings, but it doesn’t yet cover everything.

As film students, we're accustomed to working carefully with small budgets effectively so that nothing goes to waste. Here's a breakdown of how your contribution will be spent:

Not only will you be helping out on a great project, but there are some lovely perks for you in return! Check them out. Any questions? Email us at anightinthelife.film@gmail.com.

All creative projects involve some risks, but it's important that we know what our specific challenges are.

Finding affordable locations that suit the film, such as a luxury high-rise, is a primary challenge. Filming overnight and working with an animal + trainer also present difficult tasks for us. Once it leaves the cutting room, distribution and the film festival circuit are also issues that we have to take care of. With our collective experience and drive, these are challenges that we can overcome.

The best films aren't always the easiest films, and we're looking forward to creating one that we can be proud of.

Can't contribute right now? You can still help us out by sharing our campaign! It's very easy and we'd really appreciate it.

Facebook: facebook.com/ANITLfilm

Twitter: twitter.com/ANITLfilm

Thank you for helping us to tell a great story! Stand by for updates!

story:
Everyone has choices in life, and this story shows one man's life unravelling in front of him with quick choices he must make... will he make the right ones? 

 

 

ABOUT THE TEAM: 

My name is Jayde Williams and I am here to help tell just one story of someone's struggle. Someone's struggle with their addiction to alcohol, their relationship falling apart and becoming less confident each day in their work and career.  I am passionate about helping people - bringing them up, reassuring them that no matter what is going on in their life, it can be overcome. 

I am not the only one here to tell the story though, I have an amazing team that works right beside me bringing this story to life. Dan Felska, our Producer, gives tireless efforts day and night on promoting this film, bringing new, fresh ideas to each meeting we have and... also keeping the teams' ass in line.  Our Editor, Melvin Deer, has been studying non-linear editing for the past two years, is Avid certified and won the best editor award at the Scottsdale Community College film festival last year. He is ready to bring his skills yet again this year with adding his unique visions and flow of the film together in his edit. Kyle Larson and Nina Nandin, our Art Director and Production Designer, are the best pair to have on your side. Joined at the hip since high school these two have clear visions and true artist eyes. They know exactly how to bring a set to life and will be giving each character in Central Office, their own unique touch. James Fatica, our Director of Photography, knows how to really work those camera angles ;) Studying Cinematography for the past few years and will be shooting this picture on the one and only, Red.  Together, this team will bring Central Office to life! 

ABOUT THE MAIN CHARACTER:

William Benson is an independent contractor who installs equipment for what is called a Central Office. A Central Office is a building that operates all business and home phone lines. Will's line of work is dying due to new technology, his alcoholism is causing his pregnant wife to re-think being with him and all the while he has no clue that he will end up being one person's only chance of survival. What would you do if your job meant overhearing a conversation you weren't supposed to? 

 

OUR GOAL AND IMPACT:

Our goal for this is to not only bring an inspiring film to Arizona, but to hopefully help anyone going through the same problem's as Will. Knowing that you are not alone in what you are going through is important, and by contributing to this film, you are helping show that anyone can get through his or her hardships as well. Together, we can inspire someone to make a different choice in THEIR life through this film. If we've helped just one person in the world to make the choice of overcoming their alcohol addiction, or to repair a broken relationship, or finally sign up for that class that jump starts their career... then we've achieved our goal. 

 

NO MONEY? NO PROBLEM.  

If you are unable to contribute toward the funding, but are still passionate about one of the subjects the film touches, you can help us in many other ways. Simply spread the word! Tell us YOUR story. We would love to hear from you about what you or a loved one are going through and how a film helped inspire you to make a different choice in life.  What film was it? What different choices did you make? Share our project with others and we will share your story in our updates on how you overcame what you were going through.
story_txt:
Everyone has choices in life, and this story shows one man's life unravelling in front of him with quick choices he must make... will he make the right ones? 
 
 
ABOUT THE TEAM: 
My name is Jayde Williams and I am here to help tell just one story of someone's struggle. Someone's struggle with their addiction to alcohol, their relationship falling apart and becoming less confident each day in their work and career.  I am passionate about helping people - bringing them up, reassuring them that no matter what is going on in their life, it can be overcome. 
I am not the only one here to tell the story though, I have an amazing team that works right beside me bringing this story to life. Dan Felska, our Producer, gives tireless efforts day and night on promoting this film, bringing new, fresh ideas to each meeting we have and... also keeping the teams' ass in line.  Our Editor, Melvin Deer, has been studying non-linear editing for the past two years, is Avid certified and won the best editor award at the Scottsdale Community College film festival last year. He is ready to bring his skills yet again this year with adding his unique visions and flow of the film together in his edit. Kyle Larson and Nina Nandin, our Art Director and Production Designer, are the best pair to have on your side. Joined at the hip since high school these two have clear visions and true artist eyes. They know exactly how to bring a set to life and will be giving each character in Central Office, their own unique touch. James Fatica, our Director of Photography, knows how to really work those camera angles ;) Studying Cinematography for the past few years and will be shooting this picture on the one and only, Red.  Together, this team will bring Central Office to life!

story:
Short Summary

So I Have This Friend is a documentary film series that promotes dialogue as a pathway to peace. Developed from the belief that well-crafted, creative storytelling cultivates a more compassionate world, this project will follow singer/songwriter Timothy Palmer, filmmaker Nathan Driskell, and Behavior Analyst Julia Smith from Germany to Jordan, the West Bank and Israel as we explore individual stories of resistance and resilience, conflict and compassion, and the forces that bind us all together.

What We Need & What You Get

Thanks to a generous donor, RE:, the non-profit that I (Timothy) founded and direct, received $30,000 in initial funding for this series! So, I'm teaming up with long-time creative collaborator, Nathan Driskell, who will direct the first batch of stories we're working on. Even though we have the lion's share of funding for this project, we have until May 18 to raise an additional $2,500 to help cover the cost of film equipment and insurance. So, we thought we would reach out to each of you with an invitation to join us on this journey.  If 100 people support this project with just $25, you help ensure that we're able to capture and produce the stories of those we encounter at the quality of which we're capable, and with the care each individual story deserves. Besides the supporter perks we've included for this project, all backers will have access to behind the scenes experiences as we craft our first batch of stories. Thanks again for your support.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to support this project financially, we hope you'll consider sharing this page with your friends, family, and other folks you know. We can't wait to share these stories with you all, and we are incredibly grateful that you're willing to take these steps with us!

 

Your friends.

Timothy, Nathan, and Julia

story:
About The Filmmaker and Story

  • Hello, my name is Royal Day and I'm passionate about telling inspiring stories through the use of film. I've been making films for over 8yrs, I have had years of professional experience I'm currently furthering my directing craft & studies at the New York Film Academy.
  • Your help will allow us to tell this story in a way that's touching, insightful and has quality.
  • This is the second time I've use Indigogo to get funding for another passion project, we got all the funding in August and about to call picture lock.
  • Casting and locations have been set and they are under contract. Below is an idea of who will be playing who.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I'm seeking to raise $900 to make this film, all funds will go straight to the logistics and costs associated in making a low budget film. More details are included in the ad. See above.
  • If you donate to my film, you'll a private link to the film, early before the public will get see.
  • If I don't reach the exact goal then whatever funds I receive will go towards the essential costs for this film.

 

The Impact

  • I was adopted when I was about 2yrs old. I've know most of my life. I didn't know for the longest time about closed adoptions. Many people, today old and young fas 
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • I'm a student who has experience and who's getting better and better on every project. It's a learning process but I work hard to produce meaningful and quality pieces.

Risks & Challenges

  • Filmmaking can be hard, especially as film student in New York City who doesn't have much money  when logistics, money and unforgiving city life can knock you down and tell you your vision or film isn't possible.
  • But, over the past months of producing films under insane and intense circumstances with little to no time I've been able to rise above the odds to produce work in a timely and graceful manner.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can financially donate, I understand but you can still help! You can bring share this my page on social media, like it and just start the conversation with friends or people you know who've dealt with this issue.

And that's all there is to it, thanks again for taking your time to consider helping and donating.

- Royal Day

I was adopted when I was about 2yrs old. I've know most of my life. I didn't know for the longest time about closed adoptions. Many people, today old and young fas 
Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
I'm a student who has experience and who's getting better and better on every project. It's a learning process but I work hard to produce meaningful and quality pieces.


Risks & Challenges

Filmmaking can be hard, especially as film student in New York City who doesn't have much money  when logistics, money and unforgiving city life can knock you down and tell you your vision or film isn't possible.
But, over the past months of producing films under insane and intense circumstances with little to no time I've been able to rise above the odds to produce work in a timely and graceful manner.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can financially donate, I understand but you can still help! You can bring share this my page on social media, like it and just start the conversation with friends or people you know who've dealt with this issue.
And that's all there is to it, thanks again for taking your time to consider helping and donating.- Royal Day

story:
THE ESCORT - A Feature Film about Love, Romance, and Relationships for Today's Generation  

‘The Escort’ is a drama with a simple concept – a young man has 60 minutes to convince an escort to leave her line of work – but despite the premise of featuring only one location and two characters the story evolves into something more, examining the state of relationships today in a digitally-obsessed world where sex is easily available at our fingertips and the idea of love has been greatly distorted. 

Written over the course of 6 months after interviewing both current and former escorts, the film provides both an indictment of the exploitation of women in this industry while examining the wider socio-political structure of our society which has led to a segment of women feeling they have been put in a position where they have no choice but to enter this line of work. It asks the question of whether true love can be found in a profession that sells a false version of it while opening our eyes to the destruction caused for those who sell their body and those who purchase the use of one. 

Yet at its core ‘The Escort’ is a film about two deeply flawed individuals – a woman who is no damsel in distress and a young man who is no saint – drowning in pain who over the course of their journey come to realize that they may have found their savior in each other. It is ‘Chasing Amy’ for a new generation, a film featuring two refreshingly friendly, relatable characters who engage in a frank and honest discussion about sex in a verbal battle akin to a tennis match as both try to fight for their beliefs and peel away the layers revealing who they really are. 

​Chasing Amy

Every generation has a film that reflects the state of relationships for themselves and for me that movie was ‘Chasing Amy’, and while we have had films both before and since from ‘Sex, Lies and Videotape’ to ‘Closer’ and ‘Shame’ no film has spoken to me more than Kevin Smith’s deeply personal story. ‘The Escort’ intends to do just that for a new generation of filmgoers as we examine the impact the social media age has played on society, relationships, and sex in general with a story that while fictional has become deeply personal as a result of the interviews held with real escorts whose stories I intend to tell.

The Goal 

With a passion to make this film I have spent the past 2 years scraping together a small budget to accomplish this goal, with a similarly passionate cast and crew coming onboard to bring the story of 'The Escort' to life.

And we shot the film with principal photography having completed in February with a first cut created last week. Yet with funds having been exhausted and the need to make that final stretch crucial in the post-production stage I am in need of your help to finish this project and bring ‘The Escort’ to our screens. 

While the editors are continuing to shape the film funds will be necessary for certain requirements including grading, ADR, film festival entry fees, and ensuring costs for rewards shipping are met. In addition we are looking to reshoot one scene and for this reason I am seeking £4,000 to take the final steps, although anything extra that is raised will go directly towards the film itself.

My intent has always been to prove that features can still be made effectively for low budgets as reflected by the works of Chris Nolan ('Following'), Robert Rodriguez ('El Mariachi'), and Kevin Smith ('Clerks'), but any extra funding would help enhance it and achieve additional goals, from post-production to submitting to a wider number of film festivals so that we may have the chance to raise awareness by reaching a wider audience through festival submissions. Any amount raised will go directly into the completion of ‘The Escort’ and I am appreciative of any support you can give. 

With your help I believe ‘The Escort’ will be a film that not only acts as a pleasant date movie like ‘Chasing Amy’ and ‘Before Sunrise’ with food for thought but also serves to stimulate the conversation about relationships today, and lead to a wider discussion around issues which have yet to be tackled, such as the exploitation of workers and the misappropriation of talent which prevent them from achieving their dreams despite their skillsets. And ultimately to shed light on the escort industry in its current state. 

Before Sunrise

If for any reason you can’t pledge funds towards this film but would like to support please share this project and spread the word to friends, family, neighbours, strangers, social media, and anyone who comes to mind for if even 1 person pledges as a result of your actions that is one step closer towards the completion of this film, so each and every person who supports this project will be the deciding factor in the completion of this film.

 

The Escort

Good Deeds mean Great Rewards 

Your support means the world to me and my gratitude must be responded in kind. Noting that ‘The Escort’ is ultimately about human connection the rewards on offer are a continuation of this theme, with props among the rewards on offer although due to the subject matter of this film we have to be selective with what is picked! 

Who We Are

 

The team includes (but was not limited to):

Bizhan Tong (Writer/Director) has been writing screenplays for the past 17 years having started at the age of 12 and at 14 launched a DVD website in order to indulge in his passion for movies and make short films. Going on to study at the University of Manchester Bizhan continued to write and create films at every opportunity, producing the award-winning feature ‘Fix’ starring Olivia Wilde (Tron Legacy, House) and directed the short ‘Ticket’ starring Rory Girvan (Sky TV’s ‘Stella’). In addition to taking filmmaking courses taught by Elliot Grove at Raindance Bizhan filmed various corporate videos to see how far he could stretch the boundless limitations of art within a corporate structure, which included a stop-motion animation and an homage to ‘24’. Inspired with the idea of writing ‘The Escort’ after a chance encounter with one while waiting for a meeting Bizhan’s passion for this project grew, and he spent 2015 and 2016 embarking on his biggest adventure yet - the making of this film. After bringing together a cast and crew Bizhan set to work and in February 2017 shot 'The Escort' which was entirely self-funded by himself. With a first cut having been created he is now in need of your help to bring this journey to its end.

Laura De Casto (Consulting Producer) is the former MD of Tartan Films, overseeing many major releases that were brought to Western audiences including 'The Grudge', 'The Ring', and 'Battle Royale'. A film producer, Laura's credits include 'Guy X' with Jason Biggs and Michael Ironside, and 'Boogie Woogie' starring Gillian Anderson and Amanda Seyfried.

Aftershock London (Wardrobe) is a global luxury fashion brand whose clients include Madonna, Katherine Jenkins, and Dame Helen Mirren. A brand that embodies comfort with the dresses they design, the clothes Veronica wears reflect the persona she adopts for her clients and that she wears for herself, and just as Armani helped exude the world of Richard Gere's 'American Gigolo' so too will Aftershock London with the world of 'The Escort'.

Kevin Leslie (Actor) is an award-winning performer having won Best Actor at the Marbella Film Festival for his portrayal of Reggie Kray in the film 'The Rise of the Krays', a role he would reprise the following year in 'The Fall of the Krays'. A highly versatile actor Kevin's credits also include 'Rise of the Footsoldier 3', 'Vengeance' with Stu Bennett, and 'Cowgirl Romance'.

Olivia Moyles (Actress) is a highly versatile actress who previously appeared in 'The Rise of the Krays'. After an extensive casting search we were delighted to bring Olivia Moyles onboard whose chameleonic range help embody the multi-layered personas Veronica hides behind to do this character justice.

Andrew Bajulaiye (Editor) graduated from Brunel University with a BSc in Multimedia Design & Technology. He is a motion graphics designer and offline editor with vast experience, having worked in the video games industry and on various commercial campaigns which include Nissan, Sonic the Hedgehog, The Crew, Metro, and Defiance. Involved in this project since its inception, Andrew's editing style help reflect the themes of 'The Escort' - a classic story told for a modern generation.

Robyn Collins (Co-Editor) graduated from London Metropolitan University with a BA [Hons] in Graphic Design. Robyn decided to move into pursuing a career in post production, studying Editing at the Met Film School. Robyn's experience and studies shaped her understanding of imagery and attention to detail enabling her to successfully compose and cultivate reactions from audiences which are instrumental in bringing 'The Escort' narrative alive.

Dane Gerous Schmidt (Composer) is an award-winning composer with a penchant for various genres and a specialty for suspense. A graduate of K-State University, Dane also owns a record label, Gerbil Hamster Records. His music will help convey the underlying themes of 'The Escort' and use the power of sound to externalize the inner turmoil our characters face.

Rebecca Hadfield (Hair and Makeup Artist) is a graduate of the prestigious Christine Blundell Makeup Academy with extensive experience in film, TV, commercials, and theatre. Her recent credits include being a Hair and Makeup Trainee for Disney's 'Beauty and the Beast' starring Emma Watson, DC's 'Wonder Woman', and 'Paddington 2'. The characters of 'The Escort' both hold secrets and Rebecca's work will help resonate the idea of identity, her artistry conveying the masks people show to others and that which they cannot hide from themselves.

Stewart Allen (Assistant DOP) is a documentary filmmaker. Having worked for Channel 4 in the past Stewart has since gone on to film a variety of shorts, and more recently completed a documentary feature on long distance running. He currently freelances as a lighting cameraman for various corporate and educational projects.

John Bucknall (Storyboard Artist) is an artist and photographer whose keen eye for detail made him a crucial element of the team, his drawings helping us to effectively plan in bringing 'The Escort' to life.

Risks and challenges

There are inarguably many challenges in the making of any film, with the biggest obstacles based on overcoming budget constraints and ensuring that the movie is completed. Fortunately in this instance that challenge has been negated by the film having already been shot, therefore your donations will be used to support the film in its post-production process. In addition the support of Laura De Casto who was the former MD of Tartan Films aids us in navigating around any unexpected challenges which may occur, and the biggest challenges now are to reshoot one scene while improving audio via ADR and completing all other elements including grading and FX so that the film which is released will be a reflection of what was originally envisaged.

I have set a delivery date of October 2017 in order to ensure the digital downloads are sent by that time. I will also provide frequent updates via Facebook, Twitter, and this page so that you may follow and interact with us throughout the journey as the film is created and released within this timeframe.

There are inarguably many challenges in the making of any film, with the biggest obstacles based on overcoming budget constraints and ensuring that the movie is completed. Fortunately in this instance that challenge has been negated by the film having already been shot, therefore your donations will be used to support the film in its post-production process. In addition the support of Laura De Casto who was the former MD of Tartan Films aids us in navigating around any unexpected challenges which may occur, and the biggest challenges now are to reshoot one scene while improving audio via ADR and completing all other elements including grading and FX so that the film which is released will be a reflection of what was originally envisaged.
I have set a delivery date of October 2017 in order to ensure the digital downloads are sent by that time. I will also provide frequent updates via Facebook, Twitter, and this page so that you may follow and interact with us throughout the journey as the film is created and released within this timeframe.

story:
Hello!

My name is Charlie Brant, and i'm originally from a small town in the west midlands, called Wolverhampton! I'm currently living and studying in Norwich, attending Norwich University of the Arts in my third and final year of studying Film and moving image production. 

For my Graduation film i'm making a short documentary on the subject of myself and my dad, our relationship together and how alcoholism, addiction and tattoos have played a part in both of our lives. 
I wanted to document how alcoholism can have an effect on a relationship between father and daughter, and how is has been a challenge over the years when I was growing up, but now more than anything else it has brought us closer in so many ways.
My documentary tells the story of my dad Darren Brant and how over the span of his life he has been through a lot, suffering with alcoholism and addiction, having to raise a daughter single handedly from a young age and going through rehab and recovery, with the light at the end of the tunnel being an unconventional method of tattoos.

I'm launching this campaign because this is a very personal and intimate story to both myself and my dad, one that I wanted the world to see.
In the UK alcohol addiction is something that is not often spoken about. Let alone in a  positive or uplifting light, it's something that is often easily ignored or brushed off. However, alcohol dependancy occurs in 4% of Women and around 9% of Men. It's something that is a lot more common that we think, and I wanted to show mine and my dads experience with it and how our lives have both been effected by it, and that there are always options and help to those who need it, sometimes in the least obvious of places. A tattoo studio! 

Why I need your help!

Films unfortunately cost a lot of money, your contributions will be going towards funding travel for myself, my subjects and crew from Norwich to Wolverhampton and  back (which happens to be an expensive train journey!) You will be also helping with cost of general production, catering and other expenses. 
Another thing your donations will be helping me with is funding for me to be able to enter my film into film festivals, so that I can share my film further and do some more work that I care about in the future!
But there are some really cool perks for helping out with my film! So look out for those! 

So the reason for this campaign is not only to get some contributions to my project but also to  help spread the word and to make as many people aware of what i'm doing as possible! So please share it if you can! 
This is a project that I care about, something that I have involved myself in and it is a story that I truly want everyone to see. 

Overall helping me with this campaign will help me to fund not only my film, but it will allow me to take it further, it will ensure that i'm able to use my film after university, enter it into film festivals and help me to use it entering into my career in film and documentary in the future. 

This is a story that I would like to be able to take further in the future and be able to use for future employment and for a professional showreel. 
 

If you can't contribute! I completely understand, of course not everyone is able to! 
But there are some other ways you can help me out as well! 
It would be so helpful if you could share my campaign with your friends, family neighbour or even strangers! Anyone who you think would be interested in contributing, or helping out in other ways.

Thank you for looking at my campaign, and I really hope you can contribute in any way you can!

story:
A Still Sunrise

 

Hello there!

We are a talented team of up and coming international filmmakers that would like to present to you an exciting project. “A Still Sunrise” is a short zombie film like no other. We are extremely passionate about this project and are seeking all the help we can to make our story a reality.

A very ambitious short film, “A Still Sunrise” is set in a world ravaged by a zombie outbreak. Told from the perspective of a couple still in the grip of mourning over the loss of their son; the film follows the characters of Janice, a grieving mother and her abusive husband Ben, as they try to survive in a world where the dead walk. The film deals with the complex emotions of loss, blame and abuse; a theme, unfortunately, which is still all too familiar in our society.

Combining the elements of a zombie horror and a family drama, “A Still Sunrise” will be a unique and powerful film that tackles difficult subjects with tension, tenderness and terror. We are very excited about this project and believe, with the right funding, can create something that will have a lasting impact on anyone who watches it.

Thank you.

 

The Crew

Andy Chapman, Screenwriter

A passionate screenwriter, currently studying a masters degree in scriptwriting at UCLAN, in Preston.

“As a writer, I strive to tell thought provoking stories that speak of the world we live in. With “A Still Sunrise” I wanted to depict a world where the horror isn’t always outside - it could be sleeping right next to us.”

 

Iakovos Panagopoulos, Director

A PhD candidate, filmmaker and researcher, with a background in Greek television and cinema.

"From the first time I read the script, the film got my attention. It combines social and political issues with horror and sci-fi elements and it's a challenge I am really looking forward to take on."

 

Giuseppe Mineo, Producer

Italian screenwriter with a feature film under his belt, turned producer in order to bring A Still Sunrise to life.

"That first draft hooked me up straight away. And the development journey from first draft to final was just amazing. I look forward to seeing the final product. And I am sure you will be too."

 

Przemek Mark Przystup, Director of Photography

Talented cinematographer with a great vision for A Still Sunrise.

"Violence, drama and hostile environment meet in one original script. What's not to like?"

 

Pransu Binay Kumar, Editor

A skilled all-rounder with experience both behind the camera and in the post-production studio.

"I have worked with the director in previous projects and this has created an understanding of the script and filmmaking vision that I'm sure will help in the post-production process."

 

Dave Harrison, Sound Designer and Production Recordist

A sound expert with a knack for everything audio related, from mixing and mastering, to foley work and sound design. 

"After reading the script I was very interested in joining the production. I've always had a soft spot for horror related film as a sound designer as it opens up the opportunity to create and build interesting soundscapes in a manner unlike most other genres."

 

The Cast

Jamie Lee Hill, Lead Male Actor 

Jamie Lee-Hill, award winning actor known for Far From the Madding Crowd and Who Killed Nelson Nutmeg?, as well as several diverse roles in independent movies.

"As soon as I read the script I leapt at the chance of playing the lead role. It would be great to be reunited with Iakovos Panagopoulos who will be directing as he was director of photography on Flawless which picked up several awards including best actor for myself. Producer Giuseppe is another from last year's dream team. I am a big fan of the Walking Dead and this film reminds me of the depth of characterisation and difficult dilemmas which arise in the family conflicts whilst the world around them is falling apart. My character Ben is dark, and I can't think of many people better than Hannaj Bang Bendz to play opposite me in some challenging scenes."

 

Hannaj Bang Bendz, Lead Female Actress

Award-winning actress of Danish heritage. She learnt writing and storytelling before embarking in her acting career. Hannaj secured a lead role in Black Ops: Operation Fire Magic, which eventually aired on the History Channel and streamed on Netflix (US).

 

Oliver John Lock, Supporting Actor

Talented young actor who, despite the young age, has already worked on many theatre productions, short films and commercials.

"I'm really excited to be playing Shawn in A Still Sunrise. Not only do I get to play Jamie's son again; I  also get to play the part of a zombie! I mean, what boy wouldn't want to be a zombie?"

 

What do we need?

We need £3600 in order to make the best film we can. Here's a rough outline of the budget:

Location Rental: £600

- We're going to need to rent a country house for seven days.

Insurance: £500

- We need insurance for the very expensive kit we will be using.

Transport: £350

- We will need to transport people back and forth from a, most likely remote location.

Catering : £900

- Food, Drinks and Snacks for 15 to 20 people (cast and crew) every day for 7 days

Set Dressing: £400

- We'll have to completely transform the country house we're filming in and it'll take a lot of work

Make-up: £300

- What's a zombie film without great make-up??

Props and Costumes: £200

- The characters will show their personalities not only through their actions and words, but also through their costumes and the props they use.

Admin Costs (DVD prints, perks, stationery): £100

- This money will mostly help out in paying you back and thanking you for your support.

Festival Fees: £250

- We believe that the film will be worthy of competing with the best of the best and will be release in the festival circuit (we've calculated 10 film festival with an average entry fee of £25).

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you can't pledge money to the campaign. There are a ton of other ways you can help us. You can start by just sharing the campaign on Facebook or Twitter and let everybody know that they can help us by either pledging or sharing! Every little help is appreciated.

Thanks for your support,

The Team of A Still Sunrise
