story:
Where is the money going?


The Gonads Punk Spinal Crap Tour     November 2017        check out the IMDB Page

Celebrating forty years of failure! The Sex Pistols and The Clash lit the punk rock fuse in 1976. A year later the NME said punk was dead, but a whole new wave of real working class bands like Sham, Menace, the UK Subs was emerging. The genie was out of the bottle. The Gonads were part of that 1977 second wave and the first street-punk band ever to be described as “Oi!”

They never signed to a major, never watered down their sound and never had hits, keeping strictly underground.

Fortunately for you, they are coming back to the USA again, to give it back, legendary punk anthems & Oi-Oi drinking songs!

CURRY ON UP THE GONADS is a riot of documentary about the making of a mockumentary of a blue collar PUNK BAND at different stages of their 40 YEARS of DOOMED EXISTENCE. There are ups and downs, but in the end there’s always FUN TO BE HAD. Some of it legal...The film tackles sex, drugs, rock n’ roll of course, but also delusions of adequacy, hubris, hooliganism, extreme drunkenness, philosophy, premature ejaculation and Indian food.

Check out what's happening behind the scenes everyday! It's like an interactive soap opera... & they haven't even gotten to the US yet!

http://treelineartistsagency.com/the-gonads/

The Gonads are a beer-loving good time street-punk band. They play punk, Oi, Ska and drinking songs and are as down to earth as a Deptford sidewalk.

Born in 1977, The Gonads have been gigging regularly ever since they reformed in 1994. They’ve played France, Germany, Sweden, the USA, all over the UK including Cockermouth, Upper Dicker and Nether Wallop. 40 years after they first formed, the band are still going strong. 

As his alter ego Garry Bushell, singer Gal managed the Cockney Rejects and The Blood, gave Oi! to the world and compiled the first four Oi albums. He reformed the Gonads in 1981 in solidarity with the Oi! movement, contributing ‘Tucker’s Ruckers Ain’t No Suckers’ to Carry On Oi!

The band notched up an Indie chart smash hit  with their first e.p. Pure Punk For Row People which included the classics ‘I Lost My Love To A UK Sub’ and ‘Punk Rock Will Never Die’.  They spent the next five years writing much-loved streetpunk classics such as ‘Jobs Not Jails’, ‘SE7 Dole Day’, ‘Eat The Rich’ and ‘The Joys Of Oi!’. Their later gems include ‘Gob’, ‘Alconaut’, ‘Oi Nutter’, ‘Dance Fat Boy, Dance’ and ‘Grant Mitchell’.

Best known in the UK now for his hard-hitting, award-winning newspaper columns, Garry was originally a staff writer on the UK rock weekly Sounds where he wrote about bands as exciting and diverse as The Specials, The Ruts and Iron Maiden as well as the streetpunk phenomenon known as Oi!

Garry wrote the official biographies of Iron Maiden, the Cockney Rejects and Twisted Sister, and published Dance Craze – The 2-Tone Story.

As a rock writer, he has contributed to Kerrang, Classic Rock, Vive Le Rock and Street Sounds – which he launch edited. He has written a series of hard-boiled pulp fiction novels and appeared on more than 2,000 TV shows. His own late night TV show ran for two series on ITV, attaining an audience share high of 68%. Howard Stern once dubbed him “my ambassador in England”.

About Sandie West: represents Film/TV at Treeline Artists Agency.  Currently in the stages of 10 Film projects with her production company in Venice Beach called Beach Dancer Films. This comedy and tour is now in pre-production and filming will begin November 11th  2017. Meanwhile, Sandie is producing 2 other films, Too Much Too Young, Serial Killer. Sandie produced The Inaugural Punk Film Festival in Los Angeles this March 2017 in conjunction with The Punk Rock Museum. Award winners were Jack Grisham from TSOL for Code Blue (with Andy Dick) L7: Pretend We're Dead & Susan Dynner, Punks not Dead.  Sandie loves all aspects of filmmaking and has been  producing annually Film Festivals  in Los Angeles such as Silicon Beach, Playa Vista, Culver City and Marina Del Rey Film Festivals  as well as chair for The Venice Media District.  

Garry Bushell and Sandie West previously worked together on "We are the Flowers in your Dustbin", a more serious in depth documentary about the street punk scene of the early 1980's.  We are the Flowers is in post-production (which stars Garry Bushell) This is where the director, Sandie West, first found the inspiration for this mockumentary about "The Gonads".  Sandie says "Garry is very accomplished and entertaining and dedicated and it is about time that we saw how much fun it is behind the scenes in the world of Garry Bushell and The Gonads.  Garry also had a very successful Late Night Show in London that celebrity fans of Garry would show up without payment to be on the show that some dub "the Simon Cowell" of the UK...I am sure Garry taught Simon the ropes to being an outspoken media figure!

This campaign is of historical significance in the world of comedy and music.  The 'Oi' street punk movement has never gone away and is more popular than it's ever been around the world. 

We want you, the audience, to come out to the California Tour November 2017 and meet the Godfather of Oi!  It’s a historical moment, and people don’t live forever.  Come out now while Garry can still hear you!!!  Please share this historic event on your social networks, and we will be casting for extreme punk characters of every color, punks, skinheads, and rude boys in 2018, even if you want to be an extra, we want you!  Meanwhile there are a some scripted comedy scenes and some improv scenes we are casting for November 2017  and we will  shoot the unique story of this band.  We will shoot in the day and evenings before the punk shows and in some cases during their gigs from November 11-19th.  Guaranteed tons of fun!

The legendary band, The Gonads, will be here on a California tour November 2017 in order to film this part of the documentary which will then be 2/3rd's in the can.  In 2018, we will cast the Gonads and already have the lead actor who will also be the opener for the tour on some of the club dates.  We will recant this unique story of the band from 1975 til now!  The great thing about the tour here on the West Coast in 2017 is you get to see and interact with the band!  They are as funny and as poignant as they ever have been.  Just shows having a punk attitude and laughing over a few beers can add to longevity. 

Yes, it is their 40th year anniversary.  We will need to transport them from the UK, and have a three person camera crew follow their every moments, which are deigned in destiny to be funny.  They will be meeting up with other musical celebrities, for example the punk rock curry dinner, which is a tradition, where Lars from Rancid will join and possibly Ozzy Osbourne, and maybe you’ll join us as an Indie Go Go contributor.  In 2018, we will need to cast union actors and pay them.  We will also need to pay an editor and camera people as well as the sets.  However, Beach Dancer Films (an independent female owned production company) will provide and finance about 60% of the locations and talent, so this project will come to fruition and will be at your nearest movie theater, whether you like it or not!  There’s no doubt about it, The Gonads are coming to a screen soon! 

From a Punk Rock Curry Dinner Event (100 seating banquet with an acoustic set), to appearing in the film or going to a show on the sunset strip or having The Gonads sing a punk rock sob story about you, this is fun personified and the film hasn't even hit your screen yet!  

The funds, even if we don’t reach our entire goal, will be 100% going toward the making of the film.  All other needs will be begged, borrowed, and stolen til it comes to a screen near you, like it or not!

40 years of Punk! Punk gave the world individuality, regardless of race or financial status. It became a voice for the people and is still going strong.

40 yrs of failure, and The Gonads just laugh in the face of adversity.  The difference your contribution will make: It will finally give The Gonads the acclaim they deserve.  They persevered and you will find out why the scene has continually stayed underground but grown worldwide and if you love to laugh, then our contribution to the punk scene will be explained to the world on the big screen.

Legendary UK punk band The Gonads, come to USA and bring you oi, drinking songs and punk anthems.

The risks and challenges, the way we see it are minimal, apart from somebody getting a head butt in the mosh pit!  This is a passion project, and a true story.  Will Jimmy Kimmel put us on his tv show?  Will Howard Stern still want Garry to be his ambassador to the UK?  We feel there will be a great deal of publicity around this.  Punk Rock has lived for 40 years as a healthy subculture.

Can't contribute! Share & break the internet about "Punk Matters" are other Ways You Can Help! Buy your tickets here without "meet and greet" extras. 

Alex's Bar  Nov 12th
The Viper room Nov 15th
Til 2 club San Diego Nov 16th
The Dive Bar Las Vegas Nov 18th
Director Ken Webster says: "Gal and the band redefine how a punk band should play. The basement club rang with noise as they ripped up all the rule books. Great fun, fantastic lyrics, brilliant night out. They must be South East London's finest bands. Long live Punk!

Legendary UK punk band The Gonads in Los Angeles for the first time since 1998. Incidentally, during extensive research, the first instance of a band being referred to as 'Oi!' is in the pages of Sounds.  It  was discovered not to be the "Cockney Rejects" as widely thought, but in fact The Gonads in July 1979 . Pre-dating the first Cockney Rejects record even, Gonads are described as "Punk with an Oi Oi venge(a)nce."

Expect special drinks at the club plays. Snakebites, Lager tops! Proudly display your UK genuine punk T shirts, The Gonads Punk Spinal Crap Tour November 2017. The greatest story ever to blow off your gonads!

GET YOUR GONADS tackles the topics of sex, drugs, rock n’ roll and after seeing this film your  philosophy of life will be “nothing can hold me back”, in every way!  We mean “every way” side-ways, back-wards and on-wards! and sung in Chinese!!!

The Team

Sandie West, AKA Pink Power Ranger (yes really!) Producer & Director, Get your Gonads, Director, Beach Dancer Films

Ama McDonald, Cinematographer

Jonathan Rach, Writer, Director, Cinematographer, Producer

     

Vaughn Lindstrom, editor extraordinaire & singer of Diegos Umbrella.

Jason  Tour Manager/Producer - Jason McHugh is an American television producer and actor, best known for his work with Trey Parker and Matt Stone. He produced both Cannibal! The Musical and Orgazmo and played Frank Miller in Cannibal! and part of the porno crew in Orgazmo. 

PNX News. Diana & Casey Royer will "Punk" the punxs!

The Gonads

Garry Bushell, Lead Vocals

 

Shiragirl, Vox

At Warped Tour, a stage is named after Shiragirl who rocked many stages across the US and Canada, including support slots for Rancid, NOFX, Juliette Lewis, and Joan Jett herself - as well as spots on the Real World Brooklyn, Warped 2010 Tour Compilation (“Fight for It”) Fuse TV (“Sick Day” music video), Brooklyn Pride, Babes Burnin Rubber to Fight Breast Cancer, Brooklyn/NYC/Baltimore Pride festivals, Mermaid Parade, and Conquer Entertainment arena performances including American Airlines Arena for over 25,000 people. Journalists and fans compare Shira’s energetic onstage person to Gwen Stefani, Madonna, and Peaches. You won’t want to miss this show, complete with song, dance and spectacle.

Geoff Palmer AKA Geoff Useless  plays guitar and likes cheap beer (so buy him a few rounds)! Geoff is co-founder, co-songwriter and plays lead guitar in a traditional rock and roll /powerpop band called The Connection. Steven Van Zandt (of Bruce Springsteen's E Street Band and tv show The Sopranos) has named six Connection songs as "Coolest Song in the World”. Putting each in heavy rotation on his Sirius XM radio show. Giving the band continual nationwide exposure. Geoff has toured Europe, Japan, Canada and America with his bands. Other notable acts, where Geoff played & is a singer-songwriter are The Guts, The New Trocaderos, Kurt Baker Band, The Queers, The Nobodys and The Useless Fucks. 

Clyde Ward

Played in Rock bands since school. Thin Lizzy fanatic (own everything they ever did till Phil popped his clogs - R.i.P.) Loved early Ska and also 2-tone. Punk and Oi stopped me in my tracks. The aggression and the visceral nature of it. I wanted to be part of that. Signed to EMI and then Warners before I was 20, did the Rockstar bit and have the scars. Met Gal (so far back I can’t remember) and The Gonads became a labour of love for me. We wrote and recorded a ton of stuff and it just worked, there was some kind of magic there. I now produce everything from Rock to Ska/Reggae/Street Punk to Indie Metal. I also (of course) play Bass for The Gonads.

Jay Letendre

Raised on classic rock, grown up on punk rock.  I strummed my way from Mid Step Crisis, to The Uprisers with Todd Radict and former Bruiser drummer Rodger Shosa all the way to 2,000 Tons of TNT with The Gonads.  A family man, a care giver, a shit giver, a Tripod; I’m punk rock till I die!

Rodger Shosa

I Started banging drums at the ripe ol’ age of 10, largely because I wasn’t smart enough to do anything else.  In ’84 I helped start 5 Balls of Power which lasted 3 years before the band moved to NYC and became the Radicts.   I stayed behind out of my taste for beer and lack of taste for living in NY. I then helped start a little known local Oi! band named the Bruisers with a couple old long time friends. Through the 90’s and 00’s I found myself in many different bands including the world famous Jupiter 2, the Queers, Thee Monkey Butlers and the ever so not gigging American Werewolf. A brief hiatus from drumming brought me dangerously close to getting my shit together so, with a former 5 Balls singer Todd, long time friend and cohort Adam, and the massive presence of J Tippy, we started The Uprisers.  As the song goes, punk rock ruined my life, but I wouldn’t change a thing.

Corrupted Youth

From East Los! Angeles. Nacho has been a fan of the "Oi" scene that Garry Bushell created since he was 15 bearing a tattoo on his arm.  Corrupted Youth created the East L.A. backyard scene as seen on the film Los Punks.  A rare punk-rock duet, they're led by old school East L.A. drunk punk singers Louie and Nacho, the crowd loves them. Their best sing along song? "The Beer for Breakfast. 

Matamoska

Matamoska Straight outta Montebello, California, Ska-punk charged, english-spanish, two tone, 3rd wave & too much energy drink angst. Catch us at the show and buy us all a beer, all 8 of us!
story_txt: Where is the money going?The Gonads Punk Spinal Crap Tour     November 2017        check out the IMDB PageCelebrating forty years of failure! The Sex Pistols and The Clash lit the punk rock fuse in 1976. A year later the NME said punk was dead, but a whole new wave of real working class bands like Sham, Menace, the UK Subs was emerging. The genie was out of the bottle. The Gonads were part of that 1977 second wave and the first street-punk band ever to be described as “Oi!”They never signed to a major, never watered down their sound and never had hits, keeping strictly underground.Fortunately for you, they are coming back to the USA again, to give it back, legendary punk anthems & Oi-Oi drinking songs!CURRY ON UP THE GONADS is a riot of documentary about the making of a mockumentary of a blue collar PUNK BAND at different stages of their 40 YEARS of DOOMED EXISTENCE. There are ups and downs, but in the end there’s always FUN TO BE HAD. Some of it legal...The film tackles sex, drugs, rock n’ roll of course, but also delusions of adequacy, hubris, hooliganism, extreme drunkenness, philosophy, premature ejaculation and Indian food.Check out what's happening behind the scenes everyday! It's like an interactive soap opera... & they haven't even gotten to the US yet!http://treelineartistsagency.com/the-gonads/The Gonads are a beer-loving good time street-punk band. They play punk, Oi, Ska and drinking songs and are as down to earth as a Deptford sidewalk.Born in 1977, The Gonads have been gigging regularly ever since they reformed in 1994. They’ve played France, Germany, Sweden, the USA, all over the UK including Cockermouth, Upper Dicker and Nether Wallop. 40 years after they first formed, the band are still going strong. As his alter ego Garry Bushell, singer Gal managed the Cockney Rejects and The Blood, gave Oi! to the world and compiled the first four Oi albums. He reformed the Gonads in 1981 in solidarity with the Oi! movement, contributing ‘Tucker’s Ruckers Ain’t No Suckers’ to Carry On Oi!The band notched up an Indie chart smash hit  with their first e.p. Pure Punk For Row People which included the classics ‘I Lost My Love To A UK Sub’ and ‘Punk Rock Will Never Die’.  They spent the next five years writing much-loved streetpunk classics such as ‘Jobs Not Jails’, ‘SE7 Dole Day’, ‘Eat The Rich’ and ‘The Joys Of Oi!’. Their later gems include ‘Gob’, ‘Alconaut’, ‘Oi Nutter’, ‘Dance Fat Boy, Dance’ and ‘Grant Mitchell’.Best known in the UK now for his hard-hitting, award-winning newspaper columns, Garry was originally a staff writer on the UK rock weekly Sounds where he wrote about bands as exciting and diverse as The Specials, The Ruts and Iron Maiden as well as the streetpunk phenomenon known as Oi!Garry wrote the official biographies of Iron Maiden, the Cockney Rejects and Twisted Sister, and published Dance Craze – The 2-Tone Story.As a rock writer, he has contributed to Kerrang, Classic Rock, Vive Le Rock and Street Sounds – which he launch edited. He has written a series of hard-boiled pulp fiction novels and appeared on more than 2,000 TV shows. His own late night TV show ran for two series on ITV, attaining an audience share high of 68%. Howard Stern once dubbed him “my ambassador in England”.About Sandie West: represents Film/TV at Treeline Artists Agency.  Currently in the stages of 10 Film projects with her production company in Venice Beach called Beach Dancer Films. This comedy and tour is now in pre-production and filming will begin November 11th  2017. Meanwhile, Sandie is producing 2 other films, Too Much Too Young, Serial Killer. Sandie produced The Inaugural Punk Film Festival in Los Angeles this March 2017 in conjunction with The Punk Rock Museum. Award winners were Jack Grisham from TSOL for Code Blue (with Andy Dick) L7: Pretend We're Dead & Susan Dynner, Punks not Dead.  Sandie loves all aspects of filmmaking and has been  producing annually Film Festivals  in Los Angeles such as Silicon Beach, Playa Vista, Culver City and Marina Del Rey Film Festivals  as well as chair for The Venice Media District.  Garry Bushell and Sandie West previously worked together on "We are the Flowers in your Dustbin", a more serious in depth documentary about the street punk scene of the early 1980's.  We are the Flowers is in post-production (which stars Garry Bushell) This is where the director, Sandie West, first found the inspiration for this mockumentary about "The Gonads".  Sandie says "Garry is very accomplished and entertaining and dedicated and it is about time that we saw how much fun it is behind the scenes in the world of Garry Bushell and The Gonads.  Garry also had a very successful Late Night Show in London that celebrity fans of Garry would show up without payment to be on the show that some dub "the Simon Cowell" of the UK...I am sure Garry taught Simon the ropes to being an outspoken media figure!This campaign is of historical significance in the world of comedy and music.  The 'Oi' street punk movement has never gone away and is more popular than it's ever been around the world. We want you, the audience, to come out to the California Tour November 2017 and meet the Godfather of Oi!  It’s a historical moment, and people don’t live forever.  Come out now while Garry can still hear you!!!  Please share this historic event on your social networks, and we will be casting for extreme punk characters of every color, punks, skinheads, and rude boys in 2018, even if you want to be an extra, we want you!  Meanwhile there are a some scripted comedy scenes and some improv scenes we are casting for November 2017  and we will  shoot the unique story of this band.  We will shoot in the day and evenings before the punk shows and in some cases during their gigs from November 11-19th.  Guaranteed tons of fun!The legendary band, The Gonads, will be here on a California tour November 2017 in order to film this part of the documentary which will then be 2/3rd's in the can.  In 2018, we will cast the Gonads and already have the lead actor who will also be the opener for the tour on some of the club dates.  We will recant this unique story of the band from 1975 til now!  The great thing about the tour here on the West Coast in 2017 is you get to see and interact with the band!  They are as funny and as poignant as they ever have been.  Just shows having a punk attitude and laughing over a few beers can add to longevity. Yes, it is their 40th year anniversary.  We will need to transport them from the UK, and have a three person camera crew follow their every moments, which are deigned in destiny to be funny.  They will be meeting up with other musical celebrities, for example the punk rock curry dinner, which is a tradition, where Lars from Rancid will join and possibly Ozzy Osbourne, and maybe you’ll join us as an Indie Go Go contributor.  In 2018, we will need to cast union actors and pay them.  We will also need to pay an editor and camera people as well as the sets.  However, Beach Dancer Films (an independent female owned production company) will provide and finance about 60% of the locations and talent, so this project will come to fruition and will be at your nearest movie theater, whether you like it or not!  There’s no doubt about it, The Gonads are coming to a screen soon! From a Punk Rock Curry Dinner Event (100 seating banquet with an acoustic set), to appearing in the film or going to a show on the sunset strip or having The Gonads sing a punk rock sob story about you, this is fun personified and the film hasn't even hit your screen yet!  The funds, even if we don’t reach our entire goal, will be 100% going toward the making of the film.  All other needs will be begged, borrowed, and stolen til it comes to a screen near you, like it or not!40 years of Punk! Punk gave the world individuality, regardless of race or financial status. It became a voice for the people and is still going strong.40 yrs of failure, and The Gonads just laugh in the face of adversity.  The difference your contribution will make: It will finally give The Gonads the acclaim they deserve.  They persevered and you will find out why the scene has continually stayed underground but grown worldwide and if you love to laugh, then our contribution to the punk scene will be explained to the world on the big screen.Legendary UK punk band The Gonads, come to USA and bring you oi, drinking songs and punk anthems.The risks and challenges, the way we see it are minimal, apart from somebody getting a head butt in the mosh pit!  This is a passion project, and a true story.  Will Jimmy Kimmel put us on his tv show?  Will Howard Stern still want Garry to be his ambassador to the UK?  We feel there will be a great deal of publicity around this.  Punk Rock has lived for 40 years as a healthy subculture.Can't contribute! Share & break the internet about "Punk Matters" are other Ways You Can Help! Buy your tickets here without "meet and greet" extras.  Alex's Bar  Nov 12thThe Viper room Nov 15thTil 2 club San Diego Nov 16thThe Dive Bar Las Vegas Nov 18thDirector Ken Webster says: "Gal and the band redefine how a punk band should play. The basement club rang with noise as they ripped up all the rule books. Great fun, fantastic lyrics, brilliant night out. They must be South East London's finest bands. Long live Punk!Legendary UK punk band The Gonads in Los Angeles for the first time since 1998. Incidentally, during extensive research, the first instance of a band being referred to as 'Oi!' is in the pages of Sounds.  It  was discovered not to be the "Cockney Rejects" as widely thought, but in fact The Gonads in July 1979 . Pre-dating the first Cockney Rejects record even, Gonads are described as "Punk with an Oi Oi venge(a)nce."Expect special drinks at the club plays. Snakebites, Lager tops! Proudly display your UK genuine punk T shirts, The Gonads Punk Spinal Crap Tour November 2017. The greatest story ever to blow off your gonads!GET YOUR GONADS tackles the topics of sex, drugs, rock n’ roll and after seeing this film your  philosophy of life will be “nothing can hold me back”, in every way!  We mean “every way” side-ways, back-wards and on-wards! and sung in Chinese!!!The TeamSandie West, AKA Pink Power Ranger (yes really!) Producer & Director, Get your Gonads, Director, Beach Dancer FilmsAma McDonald, CinematographerJonathan Rach, Writer, Director, Cinematographer, Producer      Vaughn Lindstrom, editor extraordinaire & singer of Diegos Umbrella.Jason  Tour Manager/Producer - Jason McHugh is an American television producer and actor, best known for his work with Trey Parker and Matt Stone. He produced both Cannibal! The Musical and Orgazmo and played Frank Miller in Cannibal! and part of the porno crew in Orgazmo. PNX News. Diana & Casey Royer will "Punk" the punxs!The GonadsGarry Bushell, Lead Vocals Shiragirl, VoxAt Warped Tour, a stage is named after Shiragirl who rocked many stages across the US and Canada, including support slots for Rancid, NOFX, Juliette Lewis, and Joan Jett herself - as well as spots on the Real World Brooklyn, Warped 2010 Tour Compilation (“Fight for It”) Fuse TV (“Sick Day” music video), Brooklyn Pride, Babes Burnin Rubber to Fight Breast Cancer, Brooklyn/NYC/Baltimore Pride festivals, Mermaid Parade, and Conquer Entertainment arena performances including American Airlines Arena for over 25,000 people. Journalists and fans compare Shira’s energetic onstage person to Gwen Stefani, Madonna, and Peaches. You won’t want to miss this show, complete with song, dance and spectacle.Geoff Palmer AKA Geoff Useless  plays guitar and likes cheap beer (so buy him a few rounds)! Geoff is co-founder, co-songwriter and plays lead guitar in a traditional rock and roll /powerpop band called The Connection. Steven Van Zandt (of Bruce Springsteen's E Street Band and tv show The Sopranos) has named six Connection songs as "Coolest Song in the World”. Putting each in heavy rotation on his Sirius XM radio show. Giving the band continual nationwide exposure. Geoff has toured Europe, Japan, Canada and America with his bands. Other notable acts, where Geoff played & is a singer-songwriter are The Guts, The New Trocaderos, Kurt Baker Band, The Queers, The Nobodys and The Useless Fucks. Clyde WardPlayed in Rock bands since school. Angeles. Nacho has been a fan of the "Oi" scene that Garry Bushell created since he was 15 bearing a tattoo on his arm.  Corrupted Youth created the East L.A. backyard scene as seen on the film Los Punks.  A rare punk-rock duet, they're led by old school East L.A. drunk punk singers Louie and Nacho, the crowd loves them. Catch us at the show and buy us all a beer, all 8 of us!

story:
I initiated GRRL HAUS in the winter of 2014 to screen my films and friends’ films. We were making short films on a low budget (or no budget) while working or going to school, and GRRL HAUS became our approach to celebrate our real passions and to showcase all the hard work we had put into our works of art. The reality is that the film scene was (and still is) dominated by male voices, and yet I was surrounded by all these incredible women filmmakers who were not being exposed and acclaimed in the way that they deserved. Although many of us didn't have the equipment and financial backing that many of our male counterparts had, we were somehow making something out of nothing. We developed a united DIY spirit out of necessity, but as we oversaw our own projects, we collectively embraced the freedom to not compromise our visions. What initially began as a way to screen and promote my films and my friends’ films has now expanded into international events that celebrate and honor the work of women filmmakers. Artists who have shown in GRRL HAUS are at all levels and points in their careers, from filmmakers who have shown at major festivals to first time student filmmakers.

There is an impetus and motivation for GRRL HAUS to continue to grow its community of artists in a supportive environment to help us gain strengths as artists together.  This is really a project done out of love of art, cinema and to promote the talent of underrepresented women in the arts. Our most recent event was in Berlin and included 11 filmmakers, 8 short films and a musical performance at the end of the screening. The films selected were from previous events screened in the US with the addition of a selection of local Berlin based films.

I am currently doing most of work for GRRL HAUS. One of my main goals for the future of GRRL HAUS is to increase submissions from around the world to represent diversity in all its forms and encourage more underrepresented voices of women to be heard. Achieving this goal requires more people to help with outreach and promotion. 

For the past few events, I’ve have had volunteers and interns to help with the screenings. For the future, I would like to hire a crew to help with the events, because GRRL HAUS is expanding and attracting more and more entries from around the world. As an artist myself (and as a woman), I know first-hand how it feels to not be compensated adequately for hard work, and I also know that women are chronically underpaid and undervalued. I feel that it is important to be able to compensate all my interns many of whom are studying film and/or beginning their own careers as filmmakers. These individuals assist in acquiring and viewing submissions, help with press releases and promotion, locate potential venues, contact/contract vendors and musicians for events as well as offer overall assistance with setting up the theater. Other needs are hiring a designer to help with all the promotional materials and hiring a social media intern to assist with outreach. 

Additional costs are in the promotion of the events, postcards, posters, flyers, pins, stickers, programs etc. as well as the production of merchandise such as t-shirts and bags, and as we expand to events in Europe and other countries, the costs of rental spaces/theaters.

The goal is to make GRRL HAUS self-sustaining, and my hope is that by hiring and getting more people involved in the administrative side of things we will find a way to make it a self-sustaining bi-or triannual festival, all while keeping the DIY spirit alive.

The next scheduled GRRL HAUS event will be taking place at the Brattle Theatre in Cambridge, Massachusetts on Dec. 18, 2017, and we will be accepting submissions from Sept 8th to Nov. 15th. If you are interested in submitting, look here: https://filmfreeway.com/festival/GRRLHAUSCINEMA

The only qualifier to submit to GRRL HAUS is that the short film must have been made by a woman and be no longer than 20 minutes, other than that the films can be about anything of the film-maker’s choosing.

Press: 

http://bust.com/movies/18855-grrl-haus-cinema.html

https://digboston.com/open-haus-grrl-haus-cinem...

https://bostonhassle.com/go-to-grrl-haus-cinema/

https://digboston.com/haus-rules-on-the-brattle...

Media:

http://grrlhauscinema.weebly.com

https://www.facebook.com/GRRLHAUSCINEMA

https://www.instagram.com/grrlhauscinema/

https://vimeo.com/grrlhauscinema

story:
Lola is Sixteen

Lola is a swimmer

Lola likes drawing portraits

Lola is unique

Lola is quiet but not shy

Lola is alone but not lonely

Lola is fond of unique individuals

Lola is fond of her step mum,

Christine

Lola is innocent

Lola is a virgin

Lola is aware

Lola is calculating

Lola is a liar

Lola makes people do crazy things

Lola wants to kiss Christine

Lola is a collector of images, of portraits, of people

Lola draws her next conquest

Lola films their forbidden moments

This film was created from curiosity and personal experience of teenagehood. Our heightened senses and emotions during this period of our lives are fascinating. Everything is new and exciting but we just don't know it until it's over. This paired with finding one's sexuality and experimenting with it is an important subject that needs to be explored. As young women, we need to be confident in our desires and not be submissive. We are not there to only to be pleased but also to be pleasured. This film takes inspiration from Sophie Hyde’s Australian Film, 52 Tuesdays, and Gia Coppola’s, Palo Alto.

It explores the themes of youth and sexuality and represents the empowerment of women and their sexuality through their teenage years.

 

This film is a daydream.

It's riding in a car and listening to your favourite song.

It's lazing around in your bedroom dreamy time.

It's pastel pink and blue

 

We are two female filmmakers who want to create a unique insight into the female empowerment of sexuality through teenagehood. 

 

 

We need funds to create the beautiful sets, get locations and make our actors look beautiful. We have worked hard to try and provide unique and personal items to our contributors. Any little bit helps but if you can't contribute, please stay updated on our campaign anyway, come to our events and spread the word!

We hope to create a visually stunning film that tells a unique and powerful story relevant to today.

story:
Summary:

Our names are Hillary Hamilton (Writer, Producer & CAROLE) and Erin Ryan (Director & 2nd Producer), and we're the creative team behind the new quirky and cringe-worthy comedic web series 'Meet Carole.' This classic 'Fish out of Water' tale is set in modern New York City...in what ways do you relate? Have you moved to the big city with no family or friends? Your street smarts are being tested? Navigating around a new city is a daunting reality? Get ready to get uprooted watching Carole's adventures and misfortunes in The Big Apple on 'Meet Carole' The Series.

The Concept:

It started from an idea for a short film about a sweet, naïve girl from the Midwest who tries hopelessly to make friends with her new neighbors in NYC. From that initial pilot/short, the series has morphed into a 10-episode series.

The Plan:

We've created the Pilot episode and we are now asking you to join us in creating the remaining 9-episodes of the series with a contribution. Each episode is approximately 8-10mins long. Inspired by Mike Myers ('Austin Powers') comedic styling, several of the actors will play multiple roles in the series. See if you'll spot them!!

The Team:

Hillary Hamilton (Writer, Producer & CAROLE) recently wrapped supporting roles on the scripted crime series 'Shadow of Doubt' and 'I Am Homicide.' Hillary produced two comedic shorts in 2015; 'Power Play' premiered at the Asians on Film Festival in LA and 'Peggy & The Plan B' premiered at the Hang Onto Your Shorts Film Festival in Asbury Park, NJ and the Big Mini Media Film Festival in Brooklyn, NY.  

Erin Ryan (Director & 2nd Producer) recently Co-Directed the feature film 'Love Isn't Enough' (2016) which premiered at the Black Harvest Film Festival in Chicago this Summer. It also screened at the Long Beach Indie Film Festival in California where it was nominated in the category for "Best Feature Narrative - Drama." 

Ryan Schwerzler (Director of Photography) and Erin teamed up to create Soulful Pictures this year. They've worked extensively on other short films such as 'My Other Half,' 'Here Lies Us' (Paracosmic Pictures) and 'This Is You and Me' (April / Summer Films).

James Rohan (Camera Operator/AC) is a filmmaker in the New York City area, working in various departments on a multitude of projects.

Maria Gagas is our excellent editor whose award-winning work on "Le Cirque Mentale" is still traveling the festival circuit.

David Elmy plays Carole's neighbor and unlikely new friend, BUD. He performs regularly with The Improvised Lifetime Movie at the Peoples Improv Theater (The PIT, NYC) and with the indie team, Blindhead at Triple Crown.

Jonathan Zipper plays Carole's husband, ROGER. Roger's Finance job moved the couple from St. Louis to NYC. Jonathan recently Guest-starred on the Lifetime (LMN) series, 'My Crazy Ex.'

What We Need & What You Get:

We are asking for you to join our 'Meet Carole' Team and help us complete the series with a contribution. We are looking to raise $17,000 to complete the (9) remaining episodes of the series which breaks down to approximately $1,800 per episode, a very small budget. The money we raise will go towards renting camera equipment, food/beverages on set, editing, music scoring, original song creation, set décor, wardrobe, props, Marketing Materials (posters, postcards, etc.), location rentals, film festival and web fest submissions, web-hosting for the series website, and finally......paying our cast + crew a small stipend for their creative services.

What you get for joining our team through a contribution? Check-out the great PERKS! 

The Impact:

Everyone who moves from another part of the US to NYC has a unique story about the 'Big City.' We New Yorkers, imports or homegrown, mostly have a love/hate relationship with this city we call home. While, it can be harsh place, in another moment, it can send a tingle of excitement and wonder through your soul. We want to share Carole's whimsical story about how she approaches NYC. What has your experience been like? Share with us!!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please spread the word (on Instagram at #IMetCarole and 'like' us), and tune in to watch the series when it goes live at www.CaroleNYC.com so you get a chance to Meet Carole!

story:
A 48 days feature film by 3 female directors


3 award winning female 48 Hour Filmmakers take up the next challenge and will co-create a full feature film in only 48 days. That's right: writing, shooting and editing, all in just 48 days. 

The Team

The female filmmakers joining this adventure are:

Julie Whitis - winner 48 Hour Asheville/USA 2015
Claudia Fernandez - Producer 48 Hour Film Project Latin America
Vanessa Arguedas - 48 Hour Filmmaker Bolivia

The Story

"All Souled Out"
Sometimes your soul has to wander to broaden your view.

When Sean has an extreme out of body experience, his soul must wander across two continents in search of the perfect replacement body so he can win back his one true love. On this life altering journey he will go through a variety of different hosts ensuring a slew of interesting, hilarious, and sometimes awkward situations. He tries to navigate each new life to the best of his capabilities. He feels he is learning a little more about life with each new body, but as things keep changing, he starts to fear he may be all souled out.

A film about growth, love, and laughs.

What You Get & What We Need

We want to share our passion for filmmaking with you! You can become part of this great film adventure. You can follow our adventures on Facebook and Twitter. We will share our struggles, our insights, our victories, our celebrations.

For a little financial support we also write your name in our credit list.

Yes, we do need a little financial support: to make this unique film we need some money to rent camera's, light and other film equipment. And we need a little money to buy some sandwiches for our fabulous cast and crew. All cast and crew are volunteers.

Your donation, small or big, will make a difference to make this project happen for real or not. Invest your coins in a multi continent film project!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you won't have the financial means to support us with a few dollars or euros, you can still support us, by:

- visit and share our website
- liking our Facebook page
- sharing our project with friends on Facebook or by mail

Our goal is to share our passion for female filmmaking and cross-continent storytelling.

Let's embark on this epic once-in-a-lifetime journey together!

story:
Death In The Evening    

This is a "flexible" fundraising campaign, because with today's technology we can produce this film on location for $20,000 dollars. BUT... The more money that is raised, then obviously the film can only get better and better!

I've researched and met so many talented and creative people in the film industry, from Actors, Directors, Cinematographers, Editors, Technicians , Production Studios etc...etc...and the FINAL team will be in place when we know our final budget.

This film will be an intense, dynamic, poignant film...simply powerful, and I feel strongly...an Award Winning Film!

  • I've been a musician (drummer/vocalist) artist and writer all my life! I've also been a business executive, but... for the last 4 years I've focused on screenwriting and working for a wonderful non-profit organization called Straydog.org, which is a No-Kill Dog Shelter and Sanctuary. So, if you love dogs, maybe you can help them out.
  • Making this film, and seeing it on the big-screen, and entered into Film Festivals all over the world, is my only passion right now.
  • If you are a creative, smart person and want to feel great by helping out with a financial gift to this campaign, then please do!...and Thank You !!!!
  • Below is link for 2015 Bahama Int'l Film Festival showing the winners! I'm listed on page 60.
  •  http://www.bintlfilmfest.com/images/pdfs/BIFF_p...

What We Need & What You Get

  • We've designed several budgets depending on the total amount that is donated.
  • If we hit the $20,000 range or above, we can shoot in the Bahamas, and secure certain actors, crew, studios, post production enhancement etc...etc...and take the film to an ultimate level.
  • We've got a lot of great perks, as you can see! AND...I'm even open to offering unique, personal perks for generous donations. I guess you'd call them "Custom Perks!"

The Impact

Everyone that contributes or donates to this movie, is in essence a producer of the film!

  • I feel the writing, the actual script, is just about perfect, and it tells a wonderful story, and will be very successful as an entry into the many Film Festivals.

Risks & Challenges

We are simply making a short, prototype, concept film that can be made at any price level between:

$20,000 and $100,000

  • I've learned a long time ago that you can accomplish anything as long as you surround yourself with experienced, talented, professionals, and together, sharing your vision, handwork, and creativity, the outcome can be magical, perfect, excellent and sometimes it just may be brilliant.
  • I'll be putting my own small life-savings into this project, and along with  your financial assistance, you can be a part of a fun, exciting, adventure!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you found this project interesting and something you like, then please help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

"Elly" was not created overnight.  We went through several drafts before the final script was ready to shoot.  Our crew was chosen carefully, and everyone worked hard - for free - to turn this film into a reality.

We spent only 139 dollars to create the short film, because we did it for each other.  We know how to be thrifty, but you wouldn't know it from the final product.  It looks and sounds beautiful, and we've proven that it does not take millions of dollars to create a quality movie.

I'm Jeff Seemann, and this film is my creation.  I've spent countless hours perfecting "Elly", and I have a passionate team behind me ready to continue this project.  We are graduates (or soon-to-be graduates) from the University Of Cincinnati, and our careers are in film (and music, for our score department).  This is what we do, and we take great pride in our work.

What We Need & What You Get

We're setting a goal of 50,000 dollars, but we think we can film the full-length version for even less.  That may sound like a lot of money, but in the film industry, it's a very small amount.

No massive salaries will be paid on this film.  Crew and cast will be paid a small amount for their work, and LRB Productions will use donations to feed lunch to the cast and crew on long days.  But the majority of your donations will go towards renting equipment for the shoot.  Camera, lighting, sound, locations - all of this costs money, but we know that we can do it all for a cheap rate and still deliver quality.  Just look at what we did the first time around - we can do it again!

We are also offering perks for your donations!  

  • Every donation, no matter what the size, will get you an invitation to be an extra in the film.  The script takes place on a college campus, so we will need background actors of all ages - some will play students, some will be professors and faculty, and one of those people will be YOU!
  • Donations of 50 dollars or more will get your name in the credits of this film (as a contributor).  It may sound silly, but the feeling of seeing your name on the big screen....well, nothing really compares to that.
  • If you really want to get involved, I have a special treat.  One of the characters in the film will be named after you (first and last name) if you donate 1,000 or more dollars.  The name will either be spoken or shown on screen (such as a name plate on a desk, etc).  We can't promise that your character will survive, though....it is a horror film, after all.  Maybe for 5,000.......lol

The Impact

The majority of people involved in this project are college-aged filmmakers.  They've done short films and independent projects and have experience.  But for a number of them, this could be their first budgeted film with high visibility.

Your donation could actually help launch a film career for many people.  Trust me, that's a big deal.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you might not be able to donate to our project.  You can still help.  Just ask me how, there are many many ways to get involved with "Elly", be a part of a great film, and yes....get your name in the credits!

Contact me at Jeff@LRB-Productions.com and let's get started!

story:
What We Need & What You Get

Though we are students at the University of Georgia, this is an independent project. This means we don't get funding from the university.

  • We need $1500 to feed our hungry crew and actors who will be on set all day. We will use your donations to rent equipment like lighting, so we can illuminate our beautiful cast. We also need support for the transportation and compensation costs for the cat and its owner.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will still make this movie on a smaller budget. So rest assured, you will be feeding us with any dollar you chip in. 
  • If you donate, we want to thank you. To show our gratitude, contributors will get anything from an early screener of the film to special thank you in our credits.

Background

  • Director Joe Youorski and producer Schafer Sirmer, as well as many of the crew members, are students at UGA who are pursuing a Mass Media Arts/Entertainment & Media Studies degree under Grady College. 
  • Joe Youorski previously directed No Joke, a short film produced in 2016 that has played in five film festivals along the east coast. The film received a WonderFilm award from the WonderRoot's Generally Local, Mostly Independent film selection and Best Student Ensemble at the Brightside Tavern Shorts Fest. 
  • All of us have background in creating films, but we just can't get enough. We have more stories to tell, and we need your support. 

The Impact

Don't Shoot the Cat is a movie about two teenagers coming of age in the southern college town of Athens, Georgia. This film tackles themes around growing up, change, and family pets. 

The film is a capstone project for many of the crew members as they prepare to graduate. We are hoping to make this short film as great as it can be, both in terms of the story it tells and the craft behind the scenes.

How to help

If you can't donate, no problem. Like and share our Facebook page to stay informed about our progress, and share this campaign to let your friends know about the movie.

story:
The real struggles most gang members’ deal with is the loss of innocence that starts at a young age. Pressure from their own families often leave them with no other choice than to be swept up with the gang lifestyle, no matter what the repercussions are. 

I believe this is an important topic, and it is important to get this story out there to an audience. 

The challenges facing this project are the typical logistical problems that face every film project. My past experience with films and other projects has shown my ability to begin a project, tackle the problems, and take the project to completion, even when the logistics were daunting (For example see the website for my Haunted House - Ambrosehauntedmaze.com).

With your help I can make my vision a reality, and bring this story to light.

story:
Sane Love

A 10 minute drama about a pregnant woman who suffers from schizophrenia, where her husband doesn't want her to keep the baby, due to her mental illness.

This film's objective is to bring awareness to this mental disorder and see these individuals as people, just like you and I. These individuals are not "crazy" and do not find their identity in their mental illness. They are not schizophrenics, rather, are people who have schizophrenia.

These individuals are not "crazy" and do not find their identity in their mental illness. They are not schizophrenics, rather, are people who have schizophrenia.

story:
My Life Story

Again, my name is Adrian Morales. And it has taken me 35 years to bring my story to life. I have worked and saved every penny to raise enough funds to produce, direct, and hire professional actors (Mexican actors) to tell my story to the world. I took a leap of faith and have spent over $110,000 dollars.  My goal and passion is to share with the world what really happened to thousands of innocent lives that were lost, massacred, or disappeared during this conflict. To date, no one has really brought any films or documentaries to life regarding this bloody conflict.  

Short Summary

I was at my house, my dad told me to go pick-up some credentials to nearest city named Jutiapa, Guatemala, this was a military zone. I had an awful feeling that things were not going to go well, and I hesitated but my father insisted I go along.  I traveled and took a bus to Juatiapa.  When I arrived, I asked for Colonel Fuentes who was in charged of the military command. 

As time passed, Col. Fuentes never arrived and I was handcuffed and put in jail and this is where my story begins.  Tortured, beaten, and hungry I managed to escape from death.

Conflicts do occur throughout the world but this story really shows how the indigenous populations were targeted by the military and the right wing government. If you can feel the pain, and sorrow that I have gone through in my life, by making a donation we can be able to complete post-production of the movie. 

 

CAST

Miguel Angel Rodriguez (El Judicial)

Alejandro Tommasi

Luis Bayardo

Oscar Travenblugh

Valetin Trujillo Jr.

Arturo Vasquez

Isela Vega

Olivia Collins

Diana Goldenberg

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding to complete the post production costs, in addition to these other costs associated with the film.

  • Story rights - Not registered yet (my life story)
  • Screen play (I wrote it myself)
  • I spent $40,000 on Mexican actors
  • Spent $55,000 in production costs on location in Veracruz, Mexico
  • Director $15,000
  • Traveled, hotels, food, other accommodations for crew of 60 (Veracruz, Mexico)
  • We have raw footage of the film which has not been edited yet (29 days of filming)
  • We need special effects
 

    The Impact

    During the 1980's, there were many conflicts in Central America and covert projects in the region with the support of the Reagan administration and the CIA. El Salvador had a full-blown civil war supported by the US government, and Nicaragua had become a communist nation controlled by the Sandinistas. In the mean time, a civil war was taking place in Guatemala but this war never got the media coverage or support from other nations.  The right-wing government had a campaign of indigenous cleansing, whereby the government military wanted to completely eliminate and destroy the indigenous Maya population.

    My story is one of survival. However, I was the lucky one. Thousands, upon thousands were disappeared never to be heard from again. By supporting this film, we can bring more light and exposure to what happened during this period.

    This is our first project, we are new with regards to making an independent film. Nonetheless, many of the actors listed here are professionals.

     

    Risks & Challenges

    I have run out of funds. I have no US based contacts in the film industry. There are risks involved in not getting enough funds to complete the entire project. So far, I have spent everything I have but I never give up, and I am certain someone will help me to complete this project.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Yes, we need to get a professional film editor who can help us. Film score, I still don't music in the film. I need a publicist, and a press agent. Please help me share my story and make noise about it.
story_txt:
My Life Story
Again, my name is Adrian Morales. And it has taken me 35 years to bring my story to life. I have worked and saved every penny to raise enough funds to produce, direct, and hire professional actors (Mexican actors) to tell my story to the world. I took a leap of faith and have spent over $110,000 dollars.  My goal and passion is to share with the world what really happened to thousands of innocent lives that were lost, massacred, or disappeared during this conflict. To date, no one has really brought any films or documentaries to life regarding this bloody conflict.  
Short Summary
I was at my house, my dad told me to go pick-up some credentials to nearest city named Jutiapa, Guatemala, this was a military zone. I had an awful feeling that things were not going to go well, and I hesitated but my father insisted I go along.  I traveled and took a bus to Juatiapa.  When I arrived, I asked for Colonel Fuentes who was in charged of the military command. 
As time passed, Col. Fuentes never arrived and I was handcuffed and put in jail and this is where my story begins.  Tortured, beaten, and hungry I managed to escape from death.
Conflicts do occur throughout the world but this story really shows how the indigenous populations were targeted by the military and the right wing government. If you can feel the pain, and sorrow that I have gone through in my life, by making a donation we can be able to complete post-production of the movie. 
 
CAST
Miguel Angel Rodriguez (El Judicial)
Alejandro Tommasi
Luis Bayardo
Oscar Travenblugh
Valetin Trujillo Jr.
Arturo Vasquez
Isela Vega
Olivia Collins
Diana Goldenberg

We need special effects
 

The Impact

In the mean time, a civil war was taking place in Guatemala but this war never got the media coverage or support from other nations.  The right-wing government had a campaign of indigenous cleansing, whereby the government military wanted to completely eliminate and destroy the indigenous Maya population.
My story is one of survival. However, I was the lucky one. Thousands, upon thousands were disappeared never to be heard from again. By supporting this film, we can bring more light and exposure to what happened during this period.
This is our first project, we are new with regards to making an independent film. Nonetheless, many of the actors listed here are professionals.
 

Risks & Challenges
I have run out of funds. I have no US based contacts in the film industry. There are risks involved in not getting enough funds to complete the entire project. So far, I have spent everything I have but I never give up, and I am certain someone will help me to complete this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

story:
Une vieille maison, une chapelle, des pionniers légendaires, un village

L’ancienne maison d’Albénie Bourque, située au cœur du village de Cocagne, au Nouveau-Brunswick, a suscité de nombreuses heures de recherche auprès des conservateurs et des historiens pour savoir son âge et si elle aurait servi de chapelle à l’époque. La tradition d’une chapelle associée à cette maison nous mène à jeter un regard sur l’histoire de la première chapelle de Cocagne. Celle-ci fut érigée vers 1798-1800 sur la côte sud de la rivière. Une trentaine d’années plus tard, en 1832, on transporta la chapelle sur la glace de l’autre côté de la rivière. Elle fut installée près du site de l’église actuelle.


 

La recherche

Le film explore les hypothèses historiques, les anecdotes, les mémoires vivantes, l’oralité de l’histoire et la culture matérielle autour de cette maison, jusqu’aux résultats d’une étude dendrochronologique sous la direction du conservateur du Musée acadien de l’Université de Moncton, Bernard LeBlanc, expert en architecture acadienne.



 

La vie extraordinaire de Joseph Gueguen

Nous examinons aussi la vie d’un des fondateurs du village, Joseph Gueguen, figure dominante en Acadie et moins connu dans la culture populaire. Né le 2 mai 1741 à Morlaix, France, il deviendra domestique, secrétaire, interprète, traducteur, marchand, fondateur, capitaine de goelette, pionnier, prospère et juge de paix.


 

De Morlaix à Cocagne

À la fin d’avril 1753, un jeune Gueguen de 12 ans, s’embarqua pour l’Acadie en compagnie de l’abbé Jean-Louis Le Loutre. Il devint domestique et secrétaire de son frère utérin, Jean Manach, prêtre missionnaire originaire de Morlaix. Gueguen l’accompagna dans ses visites pastorales et, de cette façon, il apprit à maîtriser la langue Mi'kmaq. De même, il put rencontrer nombre de chefs, d’administrateurs coloniaux, de commerçants, de trafiquants de fourrures et de paysans acadiens. Il semble qu’entre 1770 et 1790 Gueguen fut le commerçant le plus prospère de l’Acadie. 

Marie Caissie

Gueguen s’est marié trois fois, qui n’était pas une coutume dans ces temps-là. Sa deuxième épouse, Marie Caissie, était un personnage qui peut bien être rangé parmi ceux qui ressortent le plus dans l’histoire de l’Acadie. Marie a été bien remarquée, elle a été condamnée, mais jamais bien comprise, victime qu’elle était des croyances de son temps et de la condition féminine d’alors. À Cocagne, Marie menaçait un bon mari de le tuer, mais elle préféra le quitter pour s’attirer la condamnation générale. Toute cette partie du film sera illustrée par les dessins de Mario Doucette. Paul Surette assurera la narration.
 

Pourquoi ce film

Le film veut conclure sur l’importance de la sauvegarde des traditions orales, l’appartenance chère d’un héritage patrimoinial, et la conservation des mémoires collectives qui fondent nos identités.


Émilen Bourque (Albénie à Émilien à Francois à Hippolyte à Jeannotte Bourg)

Avec la participation de



​




 

L’équipe derrière les rideaux


 

Où nous sommes rendus

Le travail déjà accompli comprend la recherche extensive sur la maison, l’enregistrement des tests de carottage, des études dendrochronologique, le captage des images aériennes (hivers), plusieurs entrevues, notamment Régis Brun (1937-2015), deux mois avant qu’il nous quitte.

Le partenariat avec le Musée acadien et le Centre d'études acadiennes Anselme-Chiasson de l’Université de Moncton nous aident énormément, l’équipe géniale, notamment Angèle Cormier, Jeanne Mance Cormier, Robert Richard et Bernard LeBlanc qui ont dévoué des heures et des heures de recherche, la cueillette d’anciennes photos, d’enregistrements de vielles chansons et d’articles précieuses. Merci. 

La planification de la production, le budget et le script du documentaire sont terminés. Les équipes sont en place et confirmées pour les dates requises.
 

Nous avons besoin de votre soutien

Grâce à votre générosité, nous apporterons à L’escalier de la chapelle, ayant déjà une richesse dans son histoire, le traitement nécessaire afin de garantir une qualité extraordinaire. Sans vous, il serait presque impossible de rêver si grand.

Depuis le début, nous avons été chanceux d’être entourés d’une équipe talentueuse et possèdant une grande générosité qui nous a permis de développer la pre-production du projet. Nous prenons à cœur d’accorder des rénumérations adéquates aux équipes qui vont nous aider à capter les images et les voix, d’y concevoir une trame sonore, et de créer les dessins qui vont animer notre imagination.

Proposer un film « broadcast », c’est-à-dire un film qui rejoint les exigences de la télévision et du cinéma, ça coûte cher. Nous sommes persuadés que plus la qualité sera élevée, plus le film aura toutes les chances de rejoindre un public plus large. Aidez-nous à faire de ce film un succès mondial.

story:
• My name is Seth Allen Spencer and I have been a director of film for over 25 years
  • This film deals with many obstacles and how they can be overcome with the help from the right individuals.
  • This film will help many people afflicted with narcolepsy realize they can do so much more with their lives.

 

  • Funding will be needed for production expenses and several other miscellaneous costs.
  • Any amount of funding will get you some great perks.  Like with as little as $25, you'll get your name in the credits,    $50 will get you copy of the script autographed by the cast.  $100 will get you a DVD of the movie.  And it will just keep getting better from there!  The more you fund, the more you'll get! 
  • This film will provide people with a clearer knowledge of narcolepsy and will show people that even with a condition, they can lead proper and fruitful lives..
  • Even if you are  not able to contribute,  Spread the word and get it all out there!  Anything that can be done to help spread the word for this cause will be greatly appreciated.
story_txt:
My name is Seth Allen Spencer and I have been a director of film for over 25 years
This film deals with many obstacles and how they can be overcome with the help from the right individuals.
This film will help many people afflicted with narcolepsy realize they can do so much more with their lives.

 

Funding will be needed for production expenses and several other miscellaneous costs.
Any amount of funding will get you some great perks.  Like with as little as $25, you'll get your name in the credits,    $50 will get you copy of the script autographed by the cast.  $100 will get you a DVD of the movie.  And it will just keep getting better from there!  The more you fund, the more you'll get! 
This film will provide people with a clearer knowledge of narcolepsy and will show people that even with a condition, they can lead proper and fruitful lives..Even if you are  not able to contribute,  Spread the word and get it all out there!  Anything that can be done to help spread the word for this cause will be greatly appreciated.

story:
It's not a scene Moulin Rouge

but- it's a little romantic.

It's not scientific, but talks about connection. 

It is set in a lounge that resembles the style of India, or Arabia. With colourful lamps and candles, it welcomes Ruby, a young woman who sits writing at the bar.  Her words roll on the page until Marcel enters. 

Marcel discovers Ruby to be a deaf-mute. But he understands her without use of words, where their connection travels beyond their surroundings and they're free to let themselves happen. As if there were no thoughts, no boundaries. 

It's a place ahead of time, that we call mind sometimes but I would say it's what we feel; what we can't express in words, or figures, or numbers. There is no word for it and yet we try to represent it somehow. 

 

 

We are super excited about this project but we also really need your help ! 

In any way you can help, it will make us realize this project. 

Let us show you where the support goes:

  • Production Design
  • Actors 
  • Equipment transportation 
  • Location
  • Distribution 

The team

Stefan Constantinou, Dop 

Rosie Lonsdale, Dop

Emily Usher, Lighting 

George Willmore, Set Design

Joahn Winstedt, Sound Design

Marco Caricola, Composer

Wesley Sloan, 1st AD

Victor Austria, 1st AC

Robin Mundell, Editor 

 

Flavia Peppers, Writer and Director 

My interest is to experiment with visual poems because of my passion for poetry and for experimental short films. We want to create a state of mind that crosses the invisible line between what happens in our minds when we feel watched and when we're free from the Others' thought.

 

Leyla Alizada, Producer

I'm Leyla, the producer. Growing up watching films, I have always admired the artistic fingerprint found amongst directors, and I believe in making these come to life. The execution behind the conceptual elements of Flavia's creative process is something I am eager to work with.

 

Share the story

Maybe we sent you this page, maybe you found it and that makes you be part of this project just for reading about it. If you want to see this story for real on screen and also want to help us rich out target budget, would be a massive help for us.

Thank you for stopping. Thank you for understanding. Thank you for caring.

story:
Summary

Set four days after D-Day, our story follows the events of a British 2nd Special Air Service soldier that was dropped into German-occupied Normandy as part of Operation Titanic.

In the early hours of 6th June 1944, a small group of SAS soldiers along with hundreds of dummy paratroopers known as Ruperts were dropped by the RAF to give the illusion of a large scale parachute landing and to cause diversion, confusion and havoc before the impending Allied invasion of France later that day. Deep behind enemy lines the soldiers were left alone to fight and survive.

The total running time of a short submitted to the Cannes short film corner can not exceed 35 minutes, and we aim for No Glory to have a running time of around 30 minutes.

NO GLORY is a tribute to all the brave men and women of the Allied Forces and I wish to dedicate the film to the bravest man I know - that handsome chap resting against the wheel of the Austin Champ in 1957, my Dad. His whole life has been a battle, he was born in 1937 and was never evacuated, spending his childhood living in London through the Blitz, and playing in the rubble of bombed houses and streets in Lambeth. He didn't see his dad (my Grandfather) for nine years as he was fighting for king and country overseas. Dad served his country as a soldier in the British Army and Ministry of Defence Police for nearly 30 years. Now in his later years in a retirement  he should be enjoying he is instead battling with prostate and bone cancer, 

My dad is a huge fan of WW2 movies, not because of the horrors of war, but for him and so many others I believe it gives some understanding as to the reason he didn't see his Dad for so many years.

World War Two was a truly horrible conflict that effects everyone of us. We all had family that played their part whether it was growing crops or working in ammunition factories at home, or serving on the front line, everyone did their bit, and it is so important we remember everyone of them and keep their memory alive, for us and future generations.

Cast

There are a few people we would like to approach and the casting  process will be starting shortly. We will announce cast as soon as they have been confirmed.

What We Need & What You Get

Unfortunately making a World War Two film (an accurate one anyway) is quite a costly affair, this is mainly due to costume and props, and wanting everything to be as period and historically correct as possible. 

We already have complete and original 37pt webbing and have been extremely fortunate to have been donated two full SS German uniforms, complete with patches, rank etc... which would probably have been the most expensive items to purchase, we near enough have full 37 patten webbing, and most firearms, along with several smaller prop items such a cigarette boxes and ration items, and if available we are able to borrow several smaller items from our friends of our local Army Surplus shop at no charge, but we still require so much more.

Any funding raised will go a very long way into seeing this production come to life, but over all £2000 is probably the lowest we can shoot the movie for to fully achieve our vision of what we are trying to create and we will really be pushing it and pulling those purse strings in. We have looked into various avenues for acquiring all the costumes and props we need, including hiring, but by far the cheapest option is that good old auction site we all know and love.

Any monies we raise through your generous support of this film will help us to: obtain the remainder of our required costume and props; pay and feed our cast; get them to our locations; pay for our practical effects from our triple award winning FX artist (who has worked on hundreds of films including Hugh Jackman's Logan); and licensing for a couple of songs (including Vera Lynn's "We'll Meet Again").

Our priority is getting this movie made, but anything we can raise above our target will mean we can do so much more with the production, including having the incredible composer Simon Finley - formally of 'Echo and the Bunnymen' - work on our score.

No Glory is just a small part of a big story we one day hope to create. As a result of this short we hope to be able to tell the full heroic story of Operation Titanic and develop our existing script to incorporate all 12 of the brave 2nd SAS soldiers that were involved, from their departure in England, their fighting through Normandy and their unfortunate end at the hands of the Nazi Germans.

The Challenges

The challenges this project presents are varied. We want to make the story as true and as authentic to this period in time as we possibly can.

We want to create something beautiful, fingers crossed we should be able to shoot our movie on whatever we are lucky enough to raise, but without the full £2000 certain elements of the process will undoubtedly suffer whether it is the quality of the wardrobe, or the quality of the team that we assemble. If we do not hit our goal, very important parts of what we are aiming to achieve could fall short. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are several ways you can help us with our project, word of mouth is an incredible tool, please let everyone know what we are trying to achieve with our project. Tell your friends and family, jump onto Facebook, Twitter and Instagram and spread the word through your social media, and use the Indiegogo share tools to help us bring our little movie to life.
