What We Need & What You Get
Unfortunately making a World War Two film (an accurate one anyway) is quite a costly affair, this is mainly due to costume and props, and wanting everything to be as period and historically correct as possible. 

We already have complete and original 37pt webbing and have been extremely fortunate to have been donated two full SS German uniforms, complete with patches, rank etc... which would probably have been the most expensive items to purchase, we near enough have full 37 patten webbing, and most firearms, along with several smaller prop items such a cigarette boxes and ration items, and if available we are able to borrow several smaller items from our friends of our local Army Surplus shop at no charge, but we still require so much more.
Any funding raised will go a very long way into seeing this production come to life, but over all £2000 is probably the lowest we can shoot the movie for to fully achieve our vision of what we are trying to create and we will really be pushing it and pulling those purse strings in. We have looked into various avenues for acquiring all the costumes and props we need, including hiring, but by far the cheapest option is that good old auction site we all know and love.
Any monies we raise through your generous support of this film will help us to: obtain the remainder of our required costume and props; pay and feed our cast; get them to our locations; pay for our practical effects from our triple award winning FX artist (who has worked on hundreds of films including Hugh Jackman's Logan); and licensing for a couple of songs (including Vera Lynn's "We'll Meet Again").
Our priority is getting this movie made, but anything we can raise above our target will mean we can do so much more with the production, including having the incredible composer Simon Finley - formally of 'Echo and the Bunnymen' - work on our score.
No Glory is just a small part of a big story we one day hope to create. As a result of this short we hope to be able to tell the full heroic story of Operation Titanic and develop our existing script to incorporate all 12 of the brave 2nd SAS soldiers that were involved, from their departure in England, their fighting through Normandy and their unfortunate end at the hands of the Nazi Germans.

The Challenges

The challenges this project presents are varied. We want to make the story as true and as authentic to this period in time as we possibly can.
We want to create something beautiful, fingers crossed we should be able to shoot our movie on whatever we are lucky enough to raise, but without the full £2000 certain elements of the process will undoubtedly suffer whether it is the quality of the wardrobe, or the quality of the team that we assemble. If we do not hit our goal, very important parts of what we are aiming to achieve could fall short. 

Other Ways You Can Help
There are several ways you can help us with our project, word of mouth is an incredible tool, please let everyone know what we are trying to achieve with our project. Tell your friends and family, jump onto Facebook, Twitter and Instagram and spread the word through your social media, and use the Indiegogo share tools to help us bring our little movie to life.

story:
Welcome to the Ancestors Rise documentary

KINSHIP A New Way Dreaming

 

 What is Ancestors Rise?

Ancestors Rise is a multi-media project dedicated to preserving the wisdom of our earth’s original cultures to strengthen the inter-generational link between youth and elders and create a series of film campaigns and multi-media projects that ignite humanity's collective awakening around our common origin and sacred purpose within the natural order of life.

 

Ancestors Rise asks the question: "How can we unlock the blessing of our planetary healing crisis is by reclaiming the wisdom of our ancestors to create a just, fulfilling and sustainable way of life on Earth?

 

Our film campaigns and media projects take you on a magnificent journey of intimate encounter with cultural custodians and revered elders that represent our earth's oldest ancestral cultures. You will learn about their prophetic messages for the current time of planetary change, and be able to apply their wisdom, to live a purposeful and spiritually connected life and activate your intended role as an Earth Steward- whilst giving back and supporting the cultural custodians and their community by choosing to sponsor our media campaigns.

 

Why the Ancestors Rise Media Project?

The prophetic teachings of our Earth’s original people tell us that we have chosen to be alive at a time of tremendous planetary change.This current evolutionary cycle is called Kali Yuga in India, the great Pachakuti in South America and signifies a transformation in time and a change in human consciousness, triggering a global healing crisis that is forcing us to redefine our purpose as a human beings.

 

This journey of awakening leads us through a very personal and collective process of re-remembering a long-lost memory revealing to us who we are, where we come from and how we can live in harmony with each other, the earth and all living species. The original people of Peru call the age we live in Taripaypacha, the age of re-encounter, in which we are all destined to unify as one people and re-remember our Original Nature.

 

"Ancestors Rise Media Projects intend to accelerate humanity’s awakening and support the global remembrance process of reclaiming our Original Nature". Founder of AR, Christiane Pedros

 

In order to unlock the blessing of our planetary healing crisis and embark upon the journey to reclaim our Original Nature, we are advised to return to our roots and reclaim the wisdom of our ancestors, far back in time, who lived in alignment with the Life-Originating Principles, known as the Original Seeds.

 

What is KINSHIP A New Way Dreaming Film Campaign?

 

 

Our first Ancestors Rise film campaign is dedicated to the Original People of the Great Southern Land of Burra, Australia.

Meet with Jingki Woonganu, Chief Navigator and Guiding Light of the New Way Dreaming Movement, Award Winning Singer, Songwriter and Storyteller and the Grandmothers of the Star Skin Law of Creation.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The Film Campaign MESSAGE:

"We gather at this point in time as part of an agreement to deliver Humanity a New Way forward from the most Easterly Point of First Light. As sovereign human beings, we participate in the sacred circle of life and by doing so take full responsibility as custodians of our land and uphold the divine and natural law. This is our Sacred Agreement that will guarantee a healthy environment and peace for all beings".

Join us on the "New Way Dreaming" journey and support Jingki and the 13 Grandmothers of Star Skin Law of Creation to share their important message for humanity as we build a global film campaign to support their important community-based work in Australia.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Throughout human history, there has been a splintering, which is leading to our disconnection and obliteration of all life. There is no room for questions only that you remember who you are, you know the way home.  As your first star family of first light, we welcome you home to join us and walk with us out of slavery.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

It is a time of transformation and integration.  It is time to come into authentic wholeness.  It is the embodiment of the physical, psychological and spiritual self. Together we come sharing our gifts, wisdom and the sacred.  We acknowledge our ancestors and put the ghost of history to rest as we enter the sacred circle of life.

By healing ourselves we have the opportunity return home to the earth.  The earth holds the frequency through the lei lines (song lines – we are all of one origin – we are indigenous – we are the Blue Flame Dreaming – it is our birthright – humanities blueprint – our DNA)". Jingki.

 

 

Your support will help produce KINSHIP A New Way Dreaming Film Campaign and allow us to create a series of multi-media offerings based on the wisdom shared by our ancestral messengers to finance the development of our organizational platform whilst paying forward a percentage to support the community projects, such as the Bush University in Australia.

Your support will help build and raise awareness around the New Way Dreaming Movement ignited by the Womyn of the Sun and

  • support Jingki and the Womyn of the Sun Sovereign Rights movement.
  • help toward the planning of a Bush University.
  • support the local youth with Original Culture based education opportunities.

 

 

So what is in it for you when supporting our first Ancestors Rise documentary film campaign?

 

Where will your generous resources and contributions go?

We are a passionate and professional creative team and strive to achieve a lot with great skills and minimal budget. Our total production budget is 47,900 Euros to produce our first documentary film campaign in Australia and that includes all production phases.

From research to shooting, to editing, the building of our online screening platform, creative production of our multi-media Ancestors Rise Wisdom products including E-books, Online Courses, and Teleseminars to help create a sustainable financial foundation for our project and contribute to the ancestral community projects such as the KINSHIP, A New Way Dreaming Bush University.

 

Here we go, take a peep at our Production Budget to get the first Ancestors Rise film campaign off the ground: 

 

Pre-Production Phase: 4.650 Euro

  • Proposal writing for the Ancestors Rise Multi-Media Project ( 900 Euro)
  • Development of KINSHIP A New Way Dreaming Documentary Film Expose ( 200 Euro)
  • Travel costs to build relations with ancestral messengers and planning of our collaboration in Australia ( 3.500 Euro)

 

Production Phase: 26.800 Euro

  • KINSHIP, A New Way Dreaming, Trailer Production Costs ( 1.300 Euro)
  • Production Travel and Accommodation Costs for two trips to Australia in 2018/2019 ( 20.000 Euros)
  • Production Team ( Camera & Director)  and equipment hire costs (5.000 Euro)
  •  Free Media Training Workshops for the youth of the ancestral community. ( 500 Euro)

 

Post Production Phase: 16.500 Euro

  • Editing of Film Footage ( 2.000 Euro)
  • Production contracts and legal advise   ( 2.000 Euro)
  • Setting up of our Online Documentary screening platform ( 2.500 Euro)
  • Development of Documentary Series Multi-Media Products based on the ancestral wisdom and narratives shared to support the long-term sustainability of the film project. Includes Online Courses, E-books, and development of a Wisdom Bridge Tele-Seminar Series to help promote our Ancestral Messengers. ( 10.000 Euro)

 

What will you receive in return?

 

  • Become a New Way Dreaming KIN and join our growing community of global supporters to build toward a new humanity. As you support us we look to support you and offering you a place in the heart of our community is how we plant a seed for collaboration going forward.

 

  • Join the Ancestors Rise Project Team. Take a look at the Ancestors Rise Project Flower Diagram below and see if there is a specific role or functions within our organizational community that resonates with you? If so we would love to hear from you and explore collaboration.

  • Receive one of Katja Große's incredible Dreamcatcher Perks in turn of your financial support. The Dreamcatchers are one-off handcrafted sacred pieces of art that will not only uplift your environment with beauty but activate the core teachings of our aboriginal peoples in your life.

 

 

Join us in Person at Unity Concert in, South Dakota, the US in September 2017. Receive a free entry ticket and spend an hour with the Ancestors Rise team and some of our Aboriginal messengers and cultural custodians.http://blancapaloma10.wixsite.com/blackhillsnot...

 

 

How Your Support of the Film Campaign Will Help toward a Much Greater Cause and the Ancestor Rise Mission:

 

• Bring Hope and Support the Global Unification Proces

Ancestors Ris is a message of love, unity and hope from the first ancestors to all future generations and a call for humanity to return to its original purpose within the natural order of life. Let‘s remember we are one earth, one people and come from one origin.


• Preserve and Share Ancestral Wisdom

The Ancestors Rise film series is intended to provide a direct transmission of light of the planet’s ancestors by sharing the seeds of wisdom preserved by our earth’s original people, some of whom pass on their wisdom down 70.000 years in unbroken tradition through song, sacred storytelling, ceremony, and prayer.

• Strengthen the Intergenerational Bond

The Original Peoples of our planet lead us back home and play an essential role in the age of re-encounter as humanity’s midwife, birthing us into the new age of unity consciousness.To preserve the wisdom for all future generations we unite elders and youth in the process of filming and reciprocate by sharing our production skills empowering a new generation of storytellers to take the light of the ancestors into the future.

 

• Working with the Youth to Support the Preservation of Original Cultures

We will provide the youth of the original community we work with a free training in media production skills and bring them on board with the development of the film series.

 

• Support the Communities of our Film Messengers

We will donate 10% of all profits made from online sales or community screenings to the community of the ancestral messengers. We will build a campaign platform to leverage the earth and community outreach initiatives of our ancestral messengers and their community.

 

  • The Ancestors Rise Promise

We strive to unite all Original Cultures and Humanity with our message, advocacy and community youth programme. By coming together, by a common vision and mission to restore people’s hearts and minds and our beloved Planet Earth. By producing the film series to bring every single human being into the healing experience of receiving a wisdom transmission of our planet’s original cultures and enable them to re-remember their Original Nature.

 

Meet the Ancestors Rise Project Director

 

"Ancestors Rise is a message of love, unity and hope from the first ancestors to all future generations and a call for humanity to return to its original purpose within the natural order of life." Ancestors Rise founder, Christiane Pedros.

Christiane Pedros was born in 1982, Bavaria Germany. Her Mother’s ancestors come from southern Germany by Lake Chiemsee and close to the Celtic ancestral mountain, called the Untersberg, which has been recognized as the Heart Chakra of Europe by his Holiness the Dalai Lama. Her father’s ancestors are from Catalonia in Spain and Ljubljana in Slovenia.

Christiane is a Photographer and Filmmaker and lives in both Germany and England.

•  She is a member of the Fountain, an Alliance of Indigenous elders and Western financial experts who have come together to restore a sacred World Economy. http://thefountaincss.org/

•  She supports the Long March to Rome Campaign which is an initiative to ask the Vatican to rescind the Doctrine of Discovery and associated Papal Bulls that empowered European Monarchs to colonize indigenous lands. http:// longmarchtorome.com/

•  She is the Founder of the Brand Heroes Academy, a UK based business that empowers Changemakers to design profitable business brands. http://www.brandheroesacademy.com/

•  In her free-time she works as a Minister of Earth-based prayer with humans and animals. http://www.livingheartcentredwisdom.com

 

Ways to join in the Ancestors Rise Film Project

 

• Be an Ancestral Messenger

Would you like to reciprocate the prayer and share the light of your original ancestors whilst empowering youth to embrace ancestral teachings and learn the production skills of a 21st Century Storyteller? Send us an email, we look forward to hearing from you.


• Join in the Ancestors Rise Community

Would you like to join the team and offer your production skills on a film series? Join our advisory council or be an ambassador for our cause? Take a look at our Ancestors Rise project community flower and see where you feel called to engage. We look forward to hearing from you.

 

We thank you from the bottom of our heart for believing in us and supporting our New Way Dreaming Film Campaign and Ancestors Rise media project.

We look forward to connecting with you as part of this journey and would love to hear from you throughout the building of our fundraising campaign.

This is a Peoples lead Movement in the building and every voice and contribution counts. Please get in touch.

With much gratitude, Your Ancestors Rise Film team and New Way Dreaming family.

story:
This film will ask the question; Can you forgive who have wronged you?

The Dinner will dive into a land filled with dishonesty and betrayal, a story that intersects different relationships among friends.

I will need the funds of $1,500 to have a proper location, good food for the actors, permits, trucks, and props for the set. I have gained experience with pre-production and production working for Constantin Entertainment. My crew also have past experience.

I will already have the equipment I need for shooting.

The perks for this film will include credits on the film as executive producer, a copy of the script, photos from behind the scenes, and special updates on the film as we shoot.

Thank you

story:
​

 

Recipe for Disaster

Creating short films is our passion as film-making students and we aim to utilise the funds to create the best product possible as it is our final year project and our dissertation piece. With your support, we will be able to create a masterpiece to help us get our foot in the door of the industry.

 

Cash Money Boizzz

We plan to start filming in February, the money generated would help with our actors, locations, filming equipment and other miscellaneous things, like a variety of gourmet toilet plungers, that we need during production and post-production stages.

We've used patented slogan technology for our perks, and we're serious about all the perks for donating. You decide! All the way from a thank you to a PS4 and a handshake.

 

Why us?

Look. We know we're aiming high here, and you might be thinking why does this project deserve my money over anything else. But we're just here to do what we've always done, make people laugh. Your money will help us make the film we want to make, with all the special effects and wackiness that we can buy. You can help with that, and we'd greatly appreciate any amount you can donate to help us achieve our dream goal. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by following our social media pages, we'll keep updating them with funny videos so stay tuned. And if you want just check out our previous work, you never know you might actually like it! 


Oh yeah, and thanks mate ;)

 

So why are we excited about this project?

Lewis Boniface - Producer

I’m super excited to work on this project as Producer. Comedy and entertainment is such an important genre and without it the world would be in a much darker place (than it already is, *cough* Trump *cough*). With our hysterical story line you can forget about the struggles of the 3 hour gap between lectures, the thought of Trump in the white house, and of course them government spies looking at your internet history (tut tut tut).

 


                                                                                                           

Robin Mundell - Director & Writer


There’s nothing much else that makes me as happy in life than to make a crowd of people enjoy themselves and laugh for a bit. Comedy has helped me through the darkest parts of this weird and wonderful planet and every film I make is just me hoping to spread that joy through anyone who needs it. This is our last big project of University and I hope to get the money we need to make the funniest film we can possibly make, for one last hurrah before we’re officially adults. 

 


 

Vishna Santhirasegaram - 1st Assistant Director

I am really excited on working on our third year graduation film, as this will be my third comedy film that I have made in these three years. My goal is to make the audience laugh and make sure they know what we are capable of. Last year, majority of the film students know about my directorial debut film "The Quick and The Serious", which gained a lot of fans with the absurd comedy style and I'm hoping for this film, we can create another comedic masterpiece. Only you guys can be generous and help our film come alive with every penny you donate to us.

 

 

Victor Austria - Director of Photography


I'm joyous, grateful and ecstatic in being the director of photography for this comedy short. To collaborate in such a creative piece is a wonderful opportunity to show the jokes rather than ‘tell’ them. I aim to visually tell the story in the style of Edgar Wright’s Cornetto Trilogy and we are certain to get a laugh out of you and others teary eyed from how funny it will be.



Stefan Constantinou - Sound Designer

I’m truly excited to embark on this task to create our third year film, a comedy sketch show. Life is taken too seriously, laughter should be brought to everyone and we are the team to deliver! Through being at university, I’ve adapted numerous skills and techniques to help express creative ideas which have helped the process of our film. I love comedy and have worked on previous short films of the same genre in the past, I’m propitious this film will be to the highest caliber and will have our audience in tears for the right reasons! 

 

 

Rebecca Helen Myles-Middlehurst - Production Designer

I'm looking forward to creating a visually exciting and surrealistic world on Recipe for Disaster
That's all Becky wants

 

 

Jaimini Ravrani- Camera Operator

I make comedy short videos on my YouTube Channel and will use my technical skills and comedic sense to help the Director of Photography and Director create an entertaining piece. 

 

 

Az Choudhury - Editor

This project is a culmination of the past three years of my university experience and all the knowledge that I have gained, it all comes together in creating this short comedy film. The script itself takes you on such a wild and exciting journey you can only imagine the humour and the adventure that will be portrayed in the actual film. The project has gotten together a crew made of tremendously talented individuals with exceptional creative minds. This film will be a comedic masterpiece that will take you on an adventure full of humour and unexpected turns. It will combine together the best of raw British comedy with an exciting narrative. To say that I am excited for this project would be an understatement, and I want to share this journey with you, so please donate and be a part of this journey with us, and in the end, we can all sit back and watch our creation and say how proud we are together.
story_txt:
​ 
Recipe for Disaster
Creating short films is our passion as film-making students and we aim to utilise the funds to create the best product possible as it is our final year project and our dissertation piece. With your support, we will be able to create a masterpiece to help us get our foot in the door of the industry.
 

Cash Money Boizzz
We plan to start filming in February, the money generated would help with our actors, locations, filming equipment and other miscellaneous things, like a variety of gourmet toilet plungers, that we need during production and post-production stages.
We've used patented slogan technology for our perks, and we're serious about all the perks for donating. You decide! All the way from a thank you to a PS4 and a handshake.
 

Why us?
Look. We know we're aiming high here, and you might be thinking why does this project deserve my money over anything else. But we're just here to do what we've always done, make people laugh. Your money will help us make the film we want to make, with all the special effects and wackiness that we can buy. You can help with that, and we'd greatly appreciate any amount you can donate to help us achieve our dream goal. 
 

Other Ways You Can HelpYou can help by following our social media pages, we'll keep updating them with funny videos so stay tuned. And if you want just check out our previous work, you never know you might actually like it! Oh yeah, and thanks mate ;) So why are we excited about this project?Lewis Boniface - ProducerI’m super excited to work on this project as Producer. Comedy and entertainment is such an important genre and without it the world would be in a much darker place (than it already is, *cough* Trump *cough*). With our hysterical story line you can forget about the struggles of the 3 hour gap between lectures, the thought of Trump in the white house, and of course them government spies looking at your internet history (tut tut tut).                                                                                                            Robin Mundell - Director & WriterThere’s nothing much else that makes me as happy in life than to make a crowd of people enjoy themselves and laugh for a bit. Comedy has helped me through the darkest parts of this weird and wonderful planet and every film I make is just me hoping to spread that joy through anyone who needs it. This is our last big project of University and I hope to get the money we need to make the funniest film we can possibly make, for one last hurrah before we’re officially adults.   Vishna Santhirasegaram - 1st Assistant DirectorI am really excited on working on our third year graduation film, as this will be my third comedy film that I have made in these three years. My goal is to make the audience laugh and make sure they know what we are capable of. Last year, majority of the film students know about my directorial debut film "The Quick and The Serious", which gained a lot of fans with the absurd comedy style and I'm hoping for this film, we can create another comedic masterpiece. Only you guys can be generous and help our film come alive with every penny you donate to us.  Victor Austria - Director of PhotographyI'm joyous, grateful and ecstatic in being the director of photography for this comedy short. The project has gotten together a crew made of tremendously talented individuals with exceptional creative minds. This film will be a comedic masterpiece that will take you on an adventure full of humour and unexpected turns. It will combine together the best of raw British comedy with an exciting narrative. To say that I am excited for this project would be an understatement, and I want to share this journey with you, so please donate and be a part of this journey with us, and in the end, we can all sit back and watch our creation and say how proud we are together.

story:
Premise:

This documentary takes us on a rollercoaster journey of getting to know Farwa, a young Muslim woman and an ambitious activist, who wants to bring change in her community. From the outside, Farwa can come across as a person who is trying to enforce her own beliefs onto others because she wears hijab. However, that isn’t the case. She is actually a soccer player by heart. She likes to participate in extreme sports. She likes watching movies, going out with friends, and listening to different genres of music. And most importantly, she has an open mind for understanding and respecting others. In other words, she is a liberal.

When you look into a religious human being, what do you think of them?

There is this presumption that religious people are conservative. That they are some how connected to terrorists. That they are immigrants. That they bring violence to the community. All these presumptions happen because they are religious, they dress a certain way or they look like they are from a certain part of the world. Presumption also exists towards culture. For example, Indian people must have a heavy accent. If you are light skin, you must be Hispanic not Indian. Everyone from Asia is either from China, Japan, or Korea.

However, that’s not true. There are many other countries that exist in Asia. In fact, India is part of Asia. The same way many religious people aren’t conservative, there are liberals who are also religious. As well as not every person who wears certain clothing, like the hijab, is a housewife. There are women out there, we now know of, that wear a hijab and are a ballerina, an athlete, and even a politician. All it took was to get to know them.

We will capture Farwa’s experience in extreme sports, throughout 5 different countries. To observe whether these presumptions exist only in the States or whether these presumptions exist throughout the world. How will human beings from other parts of the world treat her? Will they treat her differently than they will treat me; who just looks like an average woman? How will people behave when she will participate? How will she reciprocate?

 

Why Through Extreme Sports?

When I think of extreme sports, I imagine a Caucasian or an African American participating. Yet, I know, people of all kinds are into the extreme sports. I’m into extreme sports. Sport in general, is a platform where it teaches us to be active and disciplined. Extreme sport is a space where we not only learn these principles but at the same time we face our fears. Fear of heights, water, speed, and gravity.

So when Farwa expressed her interest in extreme sports I was surprised. I didn’t expect her to say, “yes, I am into extreme sports as well.” I knew she is a big sports person. Still, I was so surprised. I had to take a step back and think for a while, why was I surprised? I still didn’t have an answer. Until, I came across an article about France banning burkini. The article created a positive buzz in social media. It made many furious, confused and wondered why banning burkini was necessary. Around the same time there was another article about a hijabi girl’s dream to become a professional ballerina. This article however received a mixed response from within and outside of the Muslim community. Many weren’t celebrating the idea of a hijabi girl being a Ballerina. This is when I realized why I was surprised when one of my best friend Farwa, whom I know for a decade, who also wears hijab expressed her interest in extreme sports.

I was surprised because despite being liberal and open minded towards religion in general; there were still certain perceptions that the society taught me. A hijabi woman, not only represents her beliefs but also represents a particular lifestyle. Unfortunately most of us are raised in a society where we automatically associate certain religious attire with conservative ideology. So we get surprised, shocked and some get defensive when a hijabi girl wants to be a ballerina or play extreme sports. Our society teaches us to judge a book by its cover. In this case hijab is that cover we are taught to judge. So, despite how liberal and open-minded I thought I was; despite being a Muslim, I still judged my best friend by her cover.

I jumped on the opportunity to record Farwa’s experiences into the world of extreme sports and to find out, if I’m right. If I was surprised learning about her experience, how will others react? I am curious to see if only in the states people will be surprised and react differently or do most of us judge a book by its cover, despite where we are from?

 

About Nash (Filmmaker)

I come from a conservative middle class family. Growing up, I was taught to preserve my culture and hold on to my heritage and religion. I was encouraged to learn about other cultures, heritages and religions in order to increase my knowledge. It was film and entertainment where I saw the beauty of not only to know them, but also to try to understand them. Because, when you start understanding them you slowly understand the meaning behind “Don’t Judge a Book by Its Cover.”

 

I’m a proud Bengali American. I’m thankful to my family for moving to the States. Moving here opened up doors of opportunities, lessons and platforms that taught me not to judge a book by its cover. I know I wouldn’t have been truly able to understand or learn this valuable lesson in Bangladesh. This documentary is inspired by the possibility of all those opportunities and lessons disappearing because of discrimination. Discrimination towards people who has different beliefs or people who look differently. The opportunities that allowed me to find myself; gave me the confidence and taught me to love myself and others; won’t be there for certain future generations. Just because of what they choose to wear or how they choose practice their beliefs, is bizarre. We as a society are suppose to grow, not take a step back. Recent negativity within our community towards Muslims, Hispanics, and African Americans seems to me as if we are taking a step back. Instead of lashing out, I wanted to exhibit the positivity of keeping an open mind. Humanity Above Discrimination (HAD) is my answer, to remind us not to judge a book by its cover. While, I explore a global answer on discrimination itself.

 

I’m a filmmaker, who has been working in the industry for the last 4 years. I have been fortunate to work under some of the great minds of the entertainment industry. Interestingly, people have judged me on a daily basis. Because I look a certain way and I choose to live certain a lifestyle, most of the time I received the presumption of not being a Muslim or a Bengali woman. Usually people think, I’m Hispanic or Indian. When someone just starts speaking to me in Spanish or ask me questions about Indian culture, I find those moments precious. Because, instead of, getting to know me, they already have a presumption towards me. This is why I choose HAD as my first step towards making a mark in the industry as a filmmaker. And to send a message that is close to my heart.

 

About Farwa (Subject)

My name is Farwa Haider‬. I am 25 years old. In December 2015 graduated with a bachelor’s degree in psychology and a minor in political science. I volunteer often and work with organizations such as “Who is Hussain.” I am currently doing my Master’s on social justice and eventually will like to pursue human rights and international law. I love soccer and I am currently playing my fourth year of college soccer as a grad student.

Growing up, my dad has been my biggest influence for me. No matter what my parents went through or he was going through; he never let that impact, the way he showed me love and affection. We had a really strong relationship and the love that he gave me unconditionally is deeply instilled in me. After my father, my mom has been my greatest inspiration and a pillar of immense strength. She has been through so much, but you'll rarely ever see the sadness or exhaustion of hardships shown on her face. I think that's what makes me resilient in difficult times.

 

Then my credit is attributed to some of my family members and of course my friends. My friends push me to keep me working hard and support me through thick and thin, especially the ones who have stayed with me up until now. Everyone needs that push.

 

Nash is one of my most outgoing and crazier best friends. And I mean this in the most positive way possible. Whenever she had some idea or project in mind, I have always encouraged it and always will. When she proposed the idea of making a documentary about me, a girl that observes hijab, and my experience with extreme sports, I was like wait a minute; did you just say extreme sports? I am athlete and love sports; I have been playing soccer, basketball, and other sports pretty much my entire life. However, as for extreme sports, the closest I have ever been to experiencing it was when I did zip lining across a lake at a camp in 2014.  

Anyways, without even giving it a second thought I enthusiastically said yes! As someone that is, more than often, working towards bringing change within the community, spreading awareness, and promoting social justice it was intriguing. Specially when the concept behind the document was aiming for the same. Not only would it demonstrate that girls who observe hijab are into extreme sports, and religion doesn’t put restrictions on them, but it could potentially even be source of motivation and or inspiration for girls across the globe to pursue their dreams. Apart from this, it is really important for us to understand whether people in the other parts of the world have different perceptions to those who observe hijab as compared to here in the United States. Maybe this could even be a reality check for the people living within the U.S. in terms how the world, other cultures, religions, and races view us.

 

Funding Distribution Plan:

story:
Greetings Dreamcatchers,

ABOUT US

We are KASH - Krazy Ass Shooting Hooligans! 

Kash Pictures is an independent creative & production company specializing in entertainment-based content for television and social media since Feb 2009. With a reputation for being reliable, methodical, experienced, passionate, and driven, we have been sought out and trusted by some of the largest names in the business. Creativity and passion drives us to produce the highest quality product for our clients, the viewers, and the nation. We are always up for a new challenge. Know us more by visiting http://kashpictures.com.my/

ABOUT THE MOVIE

"The dream that united a village…The team that united a nation…!"

"Suatu Ketika" (Once Upon A Time) will be our first feature film project for the silver screen. This is our baby.  We want to nurture it to the fullest potential. And you could help us do that.

"Suatu Ketika" is a story about a school gardener and a talented 12 year old village footballer with a medical condition goes against all odds to form a band of misfit soccer team to compete in the JG Davidson Cup tournament to fight the reigning champion - the highly privileged British school, St James inspiring people around them to believe in something extraordinary.

MOVIE DEVELOPMENT

The research and development  of this film project started 6 years ago in 2011.  As we progress throughout the years, many milestones are marked with the development of a completed script, full story board & a featurette for a look & feel. All filming preparation are underway since October 2016 till now and comes 15th April 2017, we will roll into the production stage. The film is targeted for theatrical release locally in Malaysia in April 2018 which falls just 2 months before the Russia World Cup which begins in June 2018. Being a soccer theme based movie, this is a perfect prelude celebration that we want to contribute and share prior to the football fever mania worldwide. We have managed to raise enough funds to shoot the movie and release it in the local cinemas in Malaysia.

But we do not want to stop short by just releasing the movie locally, we want to go further, we want "Suatu Ketika" to travel the world. We want to bring this movie to your footstep. We need to create a chance for this to happen. How?

BRANDING IS THE KEY!

Our branding team aims to promote this movie in the international film markets exhibition & submit it to film festival across the world to stand a chance to be viewed by potential distributors from your home country/region to bring this movie to your footsteps played in your local cinemas/TV.

We are targeting to visit the following global film markets:

1. American Film Market (AFM) - 8 days

2. European Film Market (EFM) - 9 days

3. Hong Kong International Film & TV (FILMART) - 4 days

4. Independent Film Week/Project Forum (IFP Market) - 5 days

5. Marche du Film - 10 days

6. MIPCOM - 4 days

7. MIPTV - 4 days

8. National Media Market (NMM) - 5 days

9. NATPE - 4 days

10. TIFFCOM (Content Market at the Tokyo International Film Market) - 3 days

OUR GOAL

Our goal with Suatu Ketika is for the movie to be recognized as a classic  masterpiece film for generations to come, joining the likes and ranks of the ever loved movies of the late Tan Sri P Ramlee (Malaysian Film Hero) or even a Disney movie such as The Mighty Ducks.  Thus, leaving a legacy of recurring and continued screenings on across all platforms for years and generations to come.

THE COST

The general cost is at an average of USD 10,000 per film market and to cover expenses of 2 to 4 team members across 10 film markets worldwide for estimated total of 56 days in 2018. Thus to make our movie travel the world and to inspire others, we would like to raise approximately USD 100,000 to do so.

Our campaign drive is to raise funds for our team to/for:

1. Participate as an exhibitor (registration fee/ticket & booth rental and setup)

2. Design & produce advertising and print materials of movie for the exhibition

3. Air fare, ground travel, accommodation/lodging, f&b expenses.

4. Photocopying, courier and general administrative cost

YOUR CONTRIBUTION

By contributing to this film, you would have directly supported our vision to delivery tangible benefits such as stands for positive growth & going the distance for one’s own dream especially to kids around the world as such the key branding in this movie is associated to:

•Sports

•Teamwork

•Unity

•Inspirational

•Personal Determination

•The Importance of Believing and Pursuing One’s Dreams

 

 Our dream is for this movie to be viewed by millions of kids across the globe & we hope you will be our Dreamcatcher to grant our wish by creating the chance for us to expose our movie in the international arena.
 
Please help us out and give a shout to the rest of the world by sharing this campaign drive.
 
Thank you very much for your support & have a blessed day ahead!
 
Best Regards,
Prabakar Murugiah
Executive Producer

6. MIPCOM - 4 days
7. MIPTV - 4 days
8. National Media Market (NMM) - 5 days
9. NATPE - 4 days
10. TIFFCOM (Content Market at the Tokyo International Film Market) - 3 days
OUR GOAL
Our goal with Suatu Ketika is for the movie to be recognized as a classic  masterpiece film for generations to come, joining the likes and ranks of the ever loved movies of the late Tan Sri P Ramlee (Malaysian Film Hero) or even a Disney movie such as The Mighty Ducks.  Thus, leaving a legacy of recurring and continued screenings on across all platforms for years and generations to come.
THE COST
The general cost is at an average of USD 10,000 per film market and to cover expenses of 2 to 4 team members across 10 film markets worldwide for estimated total of 56 days in 2018. Thus to make our movie travel the world and to inspire others, we would like to raise approximately USD 100,000 to do so.
Our campaign drive is to raise funds for our team to/for:
1. Participate as an exhibitor (registration fee/ticket & booth rental and setup)
2. Design & produce advertising and print materials of movie for the exhibition
3. Air fare, ground travel, accommodation/lodging, f&b expenses.
4. Photocopying, courier and general administrative cost

YOUR CONTRIBUTION
By contributing to this film, you would have directly supported our vision to delivery tangible benefits such as stands for positive growth & going the distance for one’s own dream especially to kids around the world as such the key branding in this movie is associated to:
•Sports
•Teamwork
•Unity
•Inspirational
•Personal Determination
•The Importance of Believing and Pursuing One’s Dreams
 
 Our dream is for this movie to be viewed by millions of kids across the globe & we hope you will be our Dreamcatcher to grant our wish by creating the chance for us to expose our movie in the international arena.
 Please help us out and give a shout to the rest of the world by sharing this campaign drive. Thank you very much for your support & have a blessed day ahead! Best Regards,Prabakar MurugiahExecutive Producer

story:
The MESSAGE

Before going into detail about what this film is about, I would like to share the overall message of the story. 

Throughout Portland's history and widespread turbulence in it's current political climate, my friends and I have soaked up information like a sponge in order to gather ideas to create a film that will cause discussion and spark a realistic flame on the Pacific Northwest film scene. Many events in this film are inspired by actions that take place every day. The sentiment of this film cements what it means to have an unbreakable group of friends through the thick and thin of domestic dispute. Considering that we have a story beyond epic, why not help us create a film worth watching?

Short Summary

In a climate that can only be described as psychological-grunge-paradise, five friends take it upon themselves to conjure up a plan and rob their local drug trafficker in the hopes of escaping the talons of lower class despair. 

Visual Treatment

Here are a series of pictures depicting the look of the film we plan to achieve.

(True Detective, 2014)

(Only God Forgives, 2013)

(Green Room, 2015)

(Moonlight, 2016)

(Shame, 2011)

(John Wick, 2014)

 

What We Need & What You Get

Compared to our previous films, this has been the only one with a budget. The money will be used to make the filmmaking process exceptional.

Budget Overview

Keep in mind, our set budget reads "$1000" at the top of our campaign. However, we are striving for $1500!

We need money for the following: Props, set dressing, wardrobe, hair & make-up, electrical, rigging, sound, transportation, and food. Roughly a third of our project is for food and gas due to the extensive travel time for each location. Fake blood will be used in the film for death scenes (spoiler alert) as well as other various wounds. A tattoo artist has even offered to donate his services to the project (we need to provide the temporary ink). Cop outfits, rented sound equipment, witch doctor/gas masks (for a drug party masquerade), lighting gels...the list goes on. 

We have a ton of perks available. Look on the side!

The Impact

We the cast and crew of this significant body of artistic measure on all fronts, have a strong message that we feel must be known through the collaborative effort this work has undertaken. That true friendship has no color, no limits, no restrictions...even in the most detrimental of situations. By completing this project, we want to achieve recognition for a new wave of filmmaking. We will shed new light on an alternative kind of story. With mega-hollywood blockbusters filling your screens each day, wouldn't it be nice to see something true to the heart?

Risks & Challenges

Throughout this project, we hope to maintain a relatively tenacious attitude towards organization and punctuality on such a low budget. Locations can pose a threat due to the lack of weather control and studio space. 

  • As a director of over 13 short films and one year of film school under my belt, my goal is to maintain a consistently positive filmmaking environment. As far as weather goes, we will need to plan accordingly far enough in advance in order to get the most out of each scene we shoot. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please remember to share this campaign with everyone you know who would be interested in this kind of project
  • We are in need of extras for a farm house-party scene. If you are interested, contact us!
  • We are in need of camera equipment donations that we will borrow and return. 
  • Contact us if you are interested in sponsorship.

story:
About Us:

We are a group of successful independent filmmakers in the San Francisco Bay area who have been making award winning content and producing feature films now distributed across the country. We are tackling our next feature film, an exciting psychological thriller with elements of horror, about a student with a sinister past. 

As Bay area indie filmmakers, many films are a result of passion projects with a limited budget, and even small contributions can make a huge difference in the quality of what is produced. By producing 'Look Into The Fire' as an independent film, free of studio overheads and large star salaries, we are able to keep production costs low and that means a bigger bottom line. The film will be shot on a RED camera with Prime lenses and the filmmakers will use their vast experience, networks and resources within the community to give the film a high quality look and feel, despite the independently "low cost" budget.

The Team:

The film will be produced by Eduardo Castrillo, executive director of ‘Uncia Films, LLC’ a local independent filmmaking company based out of Fremont, CA and to date they have produced, filmed, marketed and successfully distributed five feature length films with notable name talent, such as Tom Sizemore, Eric Roberts, Clifton Powell, Miguel A. Nunez Jr, Tiny Lister Jr, Tony Todd and more! They are working in association with Bo Campbell of ‘Burnout Pictures’, who have a reputation of consistently producing award winning short films that gain lots of critical acclaim in the film festival circuits. Bringing these two powerhouses together, we hope to have another successful film for 2018!

Tim Morrill is the writer and director for this long-awaited project that he's been working on since 2015. He has directed / produced five short films and several commercial projects, as well formed his own production company, Full 88. 

Jackie Dallas is an actress, best known for her role as Jen on Stranger Things and will be coming on as a producer for this film, having worked closely with both Eduardo of Uncia Films LLC, and Bo of Burnout Pictures for several years on several different projects. She has an organized and analytical background with a previous career as a medical physician and clinical research department coordinator, possesses the skills to be adept for the demands of being a film producer. 

 

What We Need & What You Get:

For 'Look Into The Fire' we will follow the blueprint of Uncia Films' previously successful films such as 'Hunting Season' and pursue funds in a multi-phase manner.

Our overall budget for the film will be $50,000, but in this initial phase, we are looking to raise the reasonable amount of $5000 to get the ball rolling with pre-production costs. This initial phase will serve to begin creating publicity and buzz for the upcoming film, while raising money to cover costs such as storyboarder, location scouting, location and equipment rental deposits, website hosting, casting, and crew retainers. 

From there, we will simultaneously be approaching accredited investors and lenders for the actual filming portion of the budget, which will be phase 2 of our financing plan. A third phase will be negotiated upon distribution for backend and any differed payments.

As perks, we will offer the usual signed memorabilia, presale DVDs and concept art, but at higher tiers, we will also offer signed copies of the scripts used that are annotated with notes and scribbles from director and various cast and crew. Additionally, the highest contributors will get producer credit in the film, as well as an invitation to be a part of the movie and meet the actors!

The Impact

Our film is the most ambitious yet with the collaboration of Uncia Films and Burnout Pictures. This feature film deals with subjects such as memory loss, depression, domestic violence and suicide.  These are difficult topics that many people struggle with and have very few outlets for discussion or help. We hope to bring the conversation to the table after people watch our film. 

Additionally, diversity and women in Hollywood is becoming a hot topic and we have a balanced cast of male and female roles, including three lead-supporting female characters. There are also two roles that are envisioned as LGBQ, and we are welcoming any and all types to submit for all roles. We hope that this will broaden opportunities for female, minority and LGBQ actors and broaden the audience's perceptions of who Hollywood should be.

Given the successful track record of Uncia Films in distributions and DVD-sales, and Burnout Pictures with award winning pictures and festival accolades, we feel that we are in a great position to impact the social setting of these topics.

 

Risks & Challenges

By the very nature of filmmaking, these ventures have their set of inherent risks. There always lies the chance that a film will be unable to be completed due to unforseeable circumstances, however, as this comes with a devastating effect on an independent film's production company, this will be avoided at all costs once production begins. A second risk is that the film will fail to find distribution for marketing after completion, however, as our track record suggests and with an established professional relationship with  CINEDIGM, a leading distributor of independent content to over 60,000 physical and digital retailers, including Wal-Mart, Best Buy, Target, iTunes, Netflix and Amazon, we feel confident that this will not happen. Furthermore, recent box office success of low-budget productions (‘Moonlight’, ‘Get Out’, ‘Manchester by the Sea’) have confirmed a strong, developing market for human interest, low-budget films. Strong character driven stories, rather than just star driven vehicles are in demand.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that a financial contribution is a lot to ask and that people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. We are also looking for sponsors who can help us with the actual production itself:

  • Food is a massively important element of filmmaking and the surest way to keep a cast and crew happy making for a better film! If you own a restaurant or a food outlet, we are always looking for caterers! We've got a hungry and hardworking crew to feed every day of filming! Contact us if you'd be willing to feed us for a day or be able to offer any discounts with catering! 
  • Location scouting: This film is looking to take place in a university classroom setting, hospital setting, CT scanning room, a house that looks like it's in the deep woods, a cabin and a gas station. If you have the perfect location for us to film and would like to get a shout out for your business or location, let us know!
  • Props: The main props that we need are a car (that can get beat up, so a junker that barely runs is fine), and a CT scanner (doesn't have to work). Random, right? If you're our miracle worker, hit us up!
  • Share our website (www.lookintothefiremovie.com) and our indiegogo campaign (www.igg.me/at/lookintothefiremovie) to your friends and followers.
  • Be sure to sign up for our mailing list on our website and follow us on social media to show support and get all the exciting updates as they happen! (www.twitter.com/lookintofiremov and www.facebook.com/lookintothefiremovie

And that's all there is to it.

OFFICIAL EMAIL FOR ALL INQUIRIES: lookintothefiremovie@gmail.com

story:
Our Angle

We follow the footsteps of our protagonist Alvydas to bring the Hill of Crosses to life. Through his journey from being a devoted christian to a self proclaimed priest and an enemy of the church we travel through the history into today's reality of the Hill of Crosses. Instead of undusting the history books we turn to the people to find what lies beneath the thousands of crosses.  

Just like the Hill of Crosses itself, this is not a traditional documentary. We are going to use mixed narrative devices such as archive footage, UCG and animation to create an intriguing and visually beautiful piece.

The Hill of Crosses

was first mentioned in 1850. Even then the chronicles were full of wonder, why all of a sudden the crosses started appearing on such otherwise insignificant place. One of the legends state that a local man in early 19th century swore the God to build a cross on the hill if He would cure him of a terminal illness.  After the word spread that erecting a cross cured the man more and more crosses begun appearing. The other version of the story is that the crosses were built in remembrance for the death rebels after the mutiny against the Russian czar in 1831 and 1863. The later scenario repeated itself in the early 60's after Stalin's death Lithuanian people were released from Siberia. People would erect crosses for the ones who died in banishment. And that's where the interesting part begins:

The soviet regime was strongly against any religious expression therefore people contributing to the growth of the Hill of Crosses were prosecuted and the crosses were burned. Despite of imminent danger (in Soviet union dissidents were facing prison, torture and death) people kept building and rebuilding the hill with more and more resilience. Over three decades the Hill of Crosses turned from religious to a political symbol. 

Why us?

We have seen that the Hill of Crosses is an extraordinary, almost lynchesque place run by remarkable characters - not only tourist's or religious fanatics, but outsiders and dissidents, who found a refuge and outlet for self expression between thousands of wooden crosses. We wish to share and also preserve the bizarre character of this unique landmark. 

Yet, just as much we care to show that there are still places, where one can express himself with no regulations or restrictions. Places that not only allow, but encourage rebellion, places that even though surrounded by civilization are still holding ancient secrets.

Hill of Crosses - reflection of Lithuania

Img. Albertas Budavas 1938

To understand what is so unique about the Hill of Crosses, one should get to know Lithuania a little bit better.

Lithuanians did not wonder in the current territory at some point in history, neither somebody wondered in Lithuania. Lithuania is one of the oldest nations in Europe with the most archaic language around. Over thousands of years people were working the same land, walking the same forests and singing the same songs. Leaders, religions and times have changed, but nature and especially forest always stayed in the center of Lithuanian life.

During Soviet occupation people were moved from the villages into grey concrete blocks. Somebody who just moments ago were farmers or woodworkers, were now working in fridge or sparkling wine factories.  This created a new and bizarre culture, where the city and the nature blend in one and its dwellers are neither savage nor civilized.

 

Lithuania Today:

These were the times when the Hill of Crosses gained its strength and grandeur. Lithuanians: exceptionally lyrical and cold-minded people, who would not make rushed or extreme decisions, have created one of the most bizarre places in the world.

What We Need & What You Get

We have started the production in 2016 and after visiting and revisiting the hill, talking to scientist, priests and locals we are finally ready to bring this story to life. We have the narrative and the footage, now we need your help to get the time and the resources to bring it all together. 

To make a PayPal donation, just click this link paypal.me/downthehillofcrosses 

Down the Hill of Crosses is an extremely visually driven piece, therefore we are going to invest a huge chunk of post production budget into collaborating with animators and visual effects artists not only to show off the Hill of Crosses, but literally bring it lo life. 

It's not all about the money

Yes we are here for  money, however this is a passion project and most of all we care about getting people excited about exploring quirky and secret places. So do share our idea and set off to adventure of your own.

story:
The Adventure of Jake & Rusty Rogers:

Is a short film that takes us on a young scout boy's immersive journey into the woods. He runs away from a dismantled household with his dog and a walkie-talkie, in search of Rusty Rogers, a fictional character from a film he is obsessed with. In the wilderness of the woods the only companion this boy has is Rusty Rogers guiding him through the dense forest. Soon when the sun sinks to the sky and darkness take over, it breaks his little fantasy. The dense black blanket the night forms over the forest leaves the young boy and his dog anticipating Rusty Rogers arrival.

The Adventure of Jake and Rusty Rogers is an adventure/drama film set in a dense wilderness. inspired by movies like Raiders of the Lost Ark, Disney Pixar’s UP and Moonrise Kingdom.

The film explores the balance between Fantasy vs Reality and Good vs Evil. It plays with themes like adventure, suspense, danger, love, reality, and regret. The Adventure of Jake and Rusty Rogers truly is not only the adventure of the young kid but his father who looses him into the woods. It is definitely an adventure, either for the father or the son, whether that be good or bad. This film is being created by a highly talented and creative group of young student film makers studying at University of the Arts London.

Plot:

In present day England, Richard Abbott, a boy too young for his imagination, makes the decision to run away from his abusive father and to find a new life in a forest wilderness. He dreams of searching for his idol, Rusty Rogers, a handsome brash adventurer, and the hero of his favourite movie, The Adventure of Jake and Rusty Rogers. He creates a role play situation, where he pretends to talk to Rusty Rogers through his radio, while trying to find him. As time in the woods goes on, the real world catches up with Richard, and he realises that the woods is no place for a young child. Meanwhile Scott Abbott, Richard’s father, calls the police once he discovers his young son is missing. The police reassure him that they will find the child, and take him to safety. However safety may not be guaranteed for Scott, as he is now a suspect. The story ends with Richard sat up against a tree, unfound. He is truly on his last legs. In this time of despair he is finally discovered, and rescued by the one person he always wanted to find. Rusty Rogers.

What We Need:

We really need your help funding this project so we can make this film possible. All Money raised will go towards all aspects of the Production including:

Our Team:

Writer/Director: Caleb Svensson

Caleb is a 2nd year film practice student studying at university of the arts London. Formerly pursuing a career in fine art, he eventually landed on film and decided to convert his artistic visions to the screen. He has had three years of experience with film and this will be his 5th production.

Producer: Zaigham Hameed Butt

Zaigham is a young filmmaker studying 2nd year Film Practice at University of the Arts London. Over the span of three years he has worked over diverse mediums of moving image. He has had experience in producing several short films, advertisements, music and dance videos. Having produced work for the Government of India and several start-up companies based in London he has been able to gain some experience in the professional world as a filmmaker. Currently in the process of submitting two of his films to an Edinburgh festival, he’s more enthusiastic than ever and geared up to run this project to the best of his abilities.

Co-Producer: Miu Sá

Miu is currently studying Film at London College of Communication and has been directing and producing numerous projects over the years. Her first film was nominated for the Sophia Awards, presented by the Portuguese Academy of Cinema, and has been in several film festivals afterwards. She started writing when she was 9 and two of her books have been published since then. She’s passionate about visual storytelling, and determined to keep creating and pursuing her career in Film.

Assistant Producer & 2nd Assistant Camera: Rebecca Gill

Rebecca Gill is a 2nd year Film Practice student at University of the Arts London. With 7 years experience producing films around the country and filming wildlife documentaries in numerous regions of Africa, Rebecca finally took the plunge and moved to London from Lancashire to pursue a career in Film. To this day she continues to work on various mediums of moving image while gaining her degree and has an interest in pursuing a career in Producing and Cinematography in the filmmaking world.

1st Assistant Director: Gabriele Intelisano

Gabriele moved from Sicily to London to study Film at the University of the Arts London. He has worked on numerous projects with a wide range of different roles, such as Producer, Sound Designer, 1st Assistant Camera, 1st AD & Editor but ultimately wishes to specialise in music videos as Director or Cinematographer. 

Director Of Photography: Adam Trzcinski

Adam is a film student looking to bring back old school style cinema. Being a huge fan of classic films from the likes of Steven Spielberg and Robert Zemeckis he thinks it’s time to revitalise that decade in a period of dwindling creativity and craft. In the past Adam has filmed pieces for Award Winning Dancers, City councils and School districts allowing him to practice his art and create a wonderful style to his form. 

1st Camera Assistant: Cameron Vickers

Cameron Vickers is a second year film student studying Film Practice at UAL. With a strong background in visual effects and over 6 years of experience in editing, he feels he will he will be able to bring creative flare and true style to this film.

Gaffer: Berke Kerimoglu

Berke Kerimoglu is from Turkey, Istanbul. He moved to London to pursue a career in filmmaking. One of his short films "Copperteeth"; came 2nd place at Camberley International Film Festival. He is a 2nd year film student at the University of the Arts London. He has interests in Directing and Cinematography and is hungry to gain more experience and knowledge about them. He believes that the University will help him grow as an artist and to widen his vision.

Production Designer: Marisa Coley

Marisa is a 2nd year Film Practice student at University of the Arts London, who has been studying film since the age of 16. She has worked on a number of short student films, gaining experience in a variety of different specialisms. Marisa is now keen to continue filmmaking throughout her degree and beyond, and carry forward a career as a production designer.

Production Designer: Yiro Zhang

Yirong, 22, studied film making in Beijing Film Academy before moving to London. She has participated in lots of short films, such as "You are not a fish"; taking on the roles of Director and Editor. "My bike, My Halley", as a producer and co-production designer. "Blooding in November”, as a co-director and editor. As a Year 2 student in the University of the Art London (BA Film Practice), she did sound design in London for a short documentary named "Hounslow". She is now experimenting with production design and is looking forward to creating more interesting things to films.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Thanks for taking time to check out our campaign. If you would like to help but are unable to contribute via Indiegogo please share our page & check us out on outher social networking platforms:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AdventureOfJakeAndRustyRogers

Twitter: @rustyroger_film

Instagram: rustyrogersfilm

 

Help us spread the word to make this film possible! 

Team Rusty Rogers.
story_txt:
The Adventure of Jake & Rusty Rogers:
Is a short film that takes us on a young scout boy's immersive journey into the woods. He runs away from a dismantled household with his dog and a walkie-talkie, in search of Rusty Rogers, a fictional character from a film he is obsessed with. In the wilderness of the woods the only companion this boy has is Rusty Rogers guiding him through the dense forest. Soon when the sun sinks to the sky and darkness take over, it breaks his little fantasy. The dense black blanket the night forms over the forest leaves the young boy and his dog anticipating Rusty Rogers arrival.
The Adventure of Jake and Rusty Rogers is an adventure/drama film set in a dense wilderness. inspired by movies like Raiders of the Lost Ark, Disney Pixar’s UP and Moonrise Kingdom.

The film explores the balance between Fantasy vs Reality and Good vs Evil. It plays with themes like adventure, suspense, danger, love, reality, and regret. The Adventure of Jake and Rusty Rogers truly is not only the adventure of the young kid but his father who looses him into the woods. It is definitely an adventure, either for the father or the son, whether that be good or bad. This film is being created by a highly talented and creative group of young student film makers studying at University of the Arts London.
Plot:
In present day England, Richard Abbott, a boy too young for his imagination, makes the decision to run away from his abusive father and to find a new life in a forest wilderness. He dreams of searching for his idol, Rusty Rogers, a handsome brash adventurer, and the hero of his favourite movie, The Adventure of Jake and Rusty Rogers. He creates a role play situation, where he pretends to talk to Rusty Rogers through his radio, while trying to find him. As time in the woods goes on, the real world catches up with Richard, and he realises that the woods is no place for a young child. Meanwhile Scott Abbott, Richard’s father, calls the police once he discovers his young son is missing. The police reassure him that they will find the child, and take him to safety. However safety may not be guaranteed for Scott, as he is now a suspect. The story ends with Richard sat up against a tree, unfound. He is truly on his last legs. In this time of despair he is finally discovered, and rescued by the one person he always wanted to find. Rusty Rogers.

story:
Jaded: The New York Effect tells the story of Juan a hopeless romantic who leaves Puerto Rico and moves to NYC find true love. With his consciencia Juancé by his side he will discover thay NYC has so much more to offer.

Who’s who? One of the things that makes Jaded unique is that it features an all-Latino ensemble. With a diverse crew behind the scenes #TeamJaded has committed to telling stories of the LGBTQIA community of color in this web series.

Where are we now? The immensely talented and dedicated team of Jaded has just wrapped production on a sizzle reel. We are now preparing to launch a crowdfunding campaign to raise the necessary funding to shoot the first season.

What’s next? The production team plans to focus their energy on pitching Jaded to various networks and streaming services, while simultaneously raising the funds to produce the first season.

story:
LARVAE - THE MOVIE

 

LARVAE è il progetto di un lungometraggio di genere horror ideato da un gruppo di giovani professionisti di Torino.

Chi siamo:

  • Alessandro Rota, regista & autore
  • Stewart Arnold, interprete & co-sceneggiatore
  • Gero Giglio, co-sceneggiatore
  • Niccolò Fontana, interprete & crowdfunding manager
  • Federico Gorgoglione, communication manager
  • Francesco Cerrato, compositore
  • Maurizio Corigliano, scenografo
  • Giacomo Aliprandi, assistente scenografo
  • Filippo Delmastro, drone
  • Andrea Zirio, interprete
  • Agostino Porchietto, costumista
  • Massimiliano Nicotra, capo tecnico
  • Italo Draperi, operatore & editor
  • Enrico De Palo, vfx supervisore
  • Gerardo Schiavone, vfx operatore
  • Fabrizio Meynardi, assistente operatore
  • Stefano Pivelli, make-up
 
Alessandro Rota è il regista di LARVAE, progetto nato dalla passione per il cinema horror gotico italiano di registi come Mario Bava, Lucio Fulci, Dario Argento e Pupi Avati.

Il nostro film è liberamente ispirato ai veri studi che Cesare Lombroso effettuò sullo Spiritismo alla fine del 19° secolo.

Vi piacciono i film horror? Vi intrigano le storie di fantasmi? Vi interessano i film ambientati in un contesto storico?

Aiutaci a far diventare i nostri incubi realtà!

Contribuendo a questa campagna ci darai un grande aiuto nella fase di pre-produzione del nostro film.

SEGUICI SU:

Facebook: LARVAE the movie

Instagram: larvaethemovie

Sito Web ufficiale: larvaethemovie.com

 

Di cosa abbiamo bisogno?

Con il tuo aiuto saremo in grado di lavorare a tutto ciò che servirà per le future riprese del film:

•   preparazione di un piano economico del film

•   ricerca delle risorse finanziarie

•   ricerca delle location

•   presentazione del progetto nei mercati internazionali del cinema

•   ricerca di attori internazionali

Vi ringrazieremo per i vostri contributi con gadget esclusivi del film e con esperienze uniche...da brivido!

Rischi e sfide

Il budget necessario alla realizzazione del film è ovviamente molto più grande di quello che ci aspettiamo di raccogliere tramite il crowdfunding.

Stiamo parlando di circa 500 mila Euro. Il lungo percorso che ci porterà a raccogliere questi fondi non sarà privo di ostacoli ma vorremmo (e speriamo) di riuscire ad arrivarci entro il 2019 e cominciare così le riprese.

Non ti preoccupare, se il budget per realizzare il film non verrà trovato, cercheremo di realizzare almeno un cortometraggio!

 

Altri modi per aiutarci

Hai un’azienda e hai in mente un modo per collaborare al nostro film? Contattaci e ne parleremo insieme.

Vuoi contribuire al progetto del film con cifre superiori di quelle indicate, diventando uno dei nostri finanziatori accreditati come co-produttori? Contattaci a larvaethemovie@gmail.com

Tutte le possibilità sono aperte: il nostro film è in costruzione, aiutateci con il vostro contributo!

Siamo alla ricerca anche di collaboratori che vogliano far parte della nostra squadra: il film verrà realizzato in Piemonte e stiamo iniziando a formare la troupe tecnica e il cast artistico che intraprenderà con noi questo viaggio.

 

 

LARVAE is a horror film project created by a group of young professionals from Turin, Italy.

We are:

  • Alessandro Rota, director & author
  • Stewart Arnold, actor & co-writer
  • Gero Giglio, co-writer
  • Niccolò Fontana, actor & crowdfunding manager
  • Federico Gorgoglione, communication manager
  • Francesco Cerrato, composer
  • Maurizio Corigliano, set designer
  • Giacomo Aliprandi, assistant set designer
  • Filippo Delmastro, drone operator
  • Andrea Zirio, actor
  • Agostino Porchietto, costume designer
  • Massimiliano Nicotra, chief technician
  • Italo Draperi, camera dept. & editor
  • Enrico De Palo, vfx supervisor
  • Gerardo Schiavone, vfx operator
  • Fabrizio Meynardi, camera assistant
  • Stefano Pivelli, make-up

 

Alessandro Rota is the director of LARVAE, born from his passion for italian horror gothic movies by Mario Bava, Lucio Fulci, Dario Argento and Pupi Avati.

Our movie is inspired by real Cesare Lombroso's studies on Spiritism at the end of the 19th century.

Do you like horror movies? Do ghost stories intrigue you? Even more if they take place in a historical context?

Help us make our nightmares come true!

Contributing to this campaign you will help us in the pre-production phase of our film. With your help we’ll be able to everything necessary for the future shooting and realization of our film.

 

FOLLOW US ON:

Facebook: LARVAE the movie

Instagram: larvaethemovie

Official Website: larvaethemovie.com

 

What We Need & What You Get

Your funds will enable us in:

• the preparation of an economical plan

• research of financial resources

• location finding

• project presentation in international film markets

• international talent search

We will thank you for your contributions with exclusive gadgets and unique experiences...thrilling!

Risks & Challenges

To make this film the budget is obviously much larger than any we could ever expect to garner through crowdfunding. We are talking about 500 thousand Euros. The long journey that will take us to collect these funds will not be obstacle-free but we hope to reach it by 2019 and start filming.

Don't worry! If the budget to make the film is not to be found, we will try to make at least a short film!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you have a company and want to collaborate on our film? Contact us and we'll talk about it together.

Do you want to contribute much more in the project of the film with higher figures than those indicated, and become one of our financiers be credited as a co-producer? Contact us at larvaethemovie@gmail.com

All possibilities are open: our film is under construction, help us to complete the first phase with your contribution!

We are also looking for collaborators who want to be part of our team: the film will be made in Piedmont and we are starting to build up the technical troupe and the artistic cast that will undertake this journey with us.

story:
Short Summary

Big Picture Anthems creates dynamic media outreach campaigns that spread awareness for social issues of all kinds around the country. In partnership with YAP!, we gathered a team of talented team of artists to write and record the anthem itself, but now we're raising money to film an impactful music video that we hope will be the anthem for the women's rights movement.

Through a semblance of creative filmmaking and live performance, the video will highlight the issues that women across America face everyday from inequity to sexual harassment, and unrealistic body image expectations. We have filmed at several locations thus far including the Harriet Tubman National Historical Park and the Women's Rights National Historical Park in Central, New York. The project is directed by Ben Gilbarg and Angel Diaz.

What We Need & What You Get

Our fundraising goal is $10,000. We need funding for post-production, marketing, and to hold apremiere event.

By donating to this project, you'll receive some cool perks, such as being in the credits as a producer, autographed posters by the cast, or receive some of our new Big Picture Anthems apparel! 

The Impact

With all of the inequalities facing women today both inside and outside of the workplace, we need this music video to reach the masses and give some momentum to the Women's Rights Movement. We want to make this video go viral and inspire young women AND men around the country to stand up for what's right.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate to the cause, you can still help us make a difference with this video!

  1. Share this campaign to your Facebook Page or Instagram
  2. Share our video
