Get to meet the film team and attend a rough cut screening of the film ahead of it being finished and have your say in what we are making. This is an absolute must for anyone interested in Cricket and Film! Plus you get all the other lovely perks too!
CRICKET & F1 GAMING FAN!! - £100 (5 TO BE CLAIMED!!)
A very special one for the Cricket AND Formula 1 fan with thanks to our good friends at Codemasters - the team behind the classic 'Brian Lara Cricket' video game series. YOUR CHANCE TO EXPERIENCE THE FIRST ASHES TEST OF 2019!! 2 x TICKETS TO THE EDGBASTON TEST MATCH AGAINST THE AUSSIES IN AUGUST 2019 PLUS ALL OF THE OTHER GREAT PERKS!

MEET AND GREET WITH WARWICKSHIRE PLAYERS.

SIGNED BOOK BY SIR CURTLY AMBROSE

8 X DIGITAL DOWNLOADS OF THE FILM TO SHARE.

story:
The Woman Behind the Curtain

The Magician's Assistant is a story almost 10 years in the making. It started off as a simple idea that I came up with at 15 years old in my sophomore year of high school, and the first script was born in an hour the moment I got home from school. 

My name is Caledonia Hanson and I'm the proud director and writer of The Magician's Assistant. I'm a lifelong learner and born storyteller with a deep love for history and a good story. I'm a graduate of the Orange County School of the Arts for Film and Television and soon to be graduate of the Los Angeles Film School with a focus in Production Design. 

Between not knowing how to create a project like this, not having the right resources, or simply it just not being the right time; The Magician's Assistant was a project put on the back burner, not knowing if it'll ever be made. Until now. The stars have aligned for the first time in nearly 10 years with the right time and resources and we can finally tell a tale of love the world didn't know it needed. 

- Caledonia Hanson, Director 

What We Need

Historically accurate clothing, props, and sets are needed to breathe life into this story. Everything we earn goes towards making The Magician's Assistant as visually appealing and historically accurate as possible to make this story not only something to enjoy, but connect with.  It's a story nearly 10 years in the making, and it's about time we tell it.

Every dollar you donate allows you to glimpse into the forgotten world of France before the 1950s. The more you give, the more you will be able to step into the past to see how a pre and post Nazi France looked.  Explore a grand theatre from the 40s, a bakery from the 30s, and a family's home from the 20s. Don't just watch the Magician's Assistant, become one with history and be a fly on the wall as you watch the story unfold. 

Every penny will go towards the film, even if we don't meet our entire goal. Every last cent counts.

What to Expect After Curtains Come Down    

A project this special deserves goals just as big as its story. My ultimate goal in the end is to shoot for the Oscar Shorts, however my second goal is to enter as many festivals as we can with the big Sundance Film Festival in sight. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether financially or simply by sharing this, your support is appreciated and counted! Go ahead and 'like' our facebook page for the project as well to keep up with any updates leading up to the shooting and release of the film!

story:
My name is Alba García and I am a Director, Screenwriter, Producer, Animator at FANTASIATION Studio.  I worked at Celebrity Deathmatch, MTV, as an Animator.

I'm excited to work with  Executive Producer Heather Henson of IBEX Puppetry. I am proud to announce that our film  Dak' Toká Taíno  will be part of the Handmade Puppet Dreams series.  

IBEX Puppetry: 

I was animating my fourth film when Heather Henson asked me  if I would be interested in making a short puppet film about my Taíno culture.  Soon after that conversation, on September 17th 2017 hurricane María hit Puerto Rico and her winds were between category 4 and 5 which is extremely dangerous. It was  a shock to us all. Hurricane María destroyed homes, plantations and it is estimated that 4,645 people died. I was devastated for my Puerto Rico, the land were I grew up,  and the land I love.

Suddenly, it dawn on me that Puerto Rico wasn't getting enough attention, that food and other necessities  weren't arriving to remote areas.  I knew then that something was very wrong.  I saw that must of the help we weren't getting was due greatly because of our colonial status and old laws that keep Puerto Rico subdued. The film aims to reveal our Taíno culture but at the same time it creates awareness of the colonialism structure we were put in. I am hoping to inspire our mi gente, my Puerto Rican brothers and sisters to come up with solutions and shape our own destiny and give the new generations the tools to keep moving Puerto Rico forward.

Paper cut animated ships for I am Taíno, of  a spanish vessel 

Our desire is to inspire a revival of the Taíno culture and restoration of our Taíno Borikenaíki ancestral language as our ultimate goal. Our team of artists and performers  are top notch and they all share the same passion for puppetry and storytelling and especially to make a meaningful film to help Puerto Rico.

The Impact

Our story needs to be told especially now because our people are dying and some remote areas  still don't have water or power. A new hurricane  season started and  my Puerto Rico still in crisis. There are about 14 projected storms for this season alone and with the possibility of 7 of those to transform into a major hurricanes.

Storyboard and main characters

Story

A grand-daughter (Marabelí) 10 years old visits her grandma (Yaya) after Hurricane María. The little girl expresses her fears, Abuela Yaya comforts her and reminds her how their ancestors Tainos survived. This is a sweet and warm film that will help us reflect in our future as Boricuas (Puerto Ricans).

Experts and leaders on Taíno Community

I am working closely with Antropologist Dr. Yarey Melendez founder of the Naguake schools in Puerto Rico, she currently teaches a restored  version of the Taíno language in the school curriculum, and Luis Ramos a Taíno Community leader, a Bohike (Taíno Healer) and Activist of Naguake community.

Also more leaders of our Taíno community have been interested and gave us advise, here they are: Bert Correa, Bobby Gonzalez, and Ramon Rivera. I thank you all for your input and kindness.

Our Short Films

We finished our second animated short Film Time Space Reflections, this film has won many awards all over the world.

 

Time Space Reflections Trailer
 

Our third film still in the works, it is a stop-motion  animation titled Dangerously Ever After.  My husband and I are animating this film at our home base studio. We  are closing on animation production in the next 6 months, then post production will continue.

Alba animating Dangerously Ever After, May 2018

 

Work in Progress Stop-motion Film, end date in the fall 2018

 

I am Taíno was shot June 21 to June 24th of 2018. Because it is a puppet live-action film, the duration of production is a lot shorter than stop-motion film.  Right now the film is in it's post-production stage. We need your help to cover the costs of Music, Visual FX, Sound FX, Editing, promotion and many festivals fees  to ensure entry at International film festivals in the fall 2018. Our goal is to hit  the Academy Award nomination to ensure our film its viewed worldwide.

Plus transfer the footage to theatrical, so it can be seen at theaters! This  is an expensive cost we can't afford at this time. 

 

Danny Hastings, Producer, Director of Photography

What We Need & What You Get

The funds with go to:

1. Show this film at international film festivals; every festival requires a fee to enter plus other costs associated with the screening and converting the film to a big screen format. Our aim is to be in the biggest film festivals with the purpose of being nominated for an  Academy Award, and win the Oscar. And yes representing Puerto Rico.

2. Cover costs associated with post production: editing, music, sound effects, talent, sound studio rental and cleaning labor, set designers labor, set materials, animatronic making plus maintenance, digital clean up, 4k camera rental, lights etc.

3. Your support will help us bring this vision to the BIG screen by paying incredible artists to do what they do best.

You will get unique perks like  a digital 4k still of the film and get your name at the end of the film!

Boricua Iconic Actress for film and theatre, Activist, Amneris Morales.

Pedro Rivera our Set Designer, Carpenter and Prop Maker

Costume Designer/Prop Maker, Laura Fernandez

Prop Maker, Adam Reichard

 

Risks & Challenges

There are risks at any live action puppet film.  Some materials are very delicate and especially with animatronic faces and hands. The circuits can stop working and we need to have extra cables, motors at the shooting.  Our head animatronic designer can fix it at the moment with the right tools.

Animatronic designed by puppet fabricator Julio Garay

We are using the best quality materials we can afford and hiring experienced puppeteers can help reduce these risks.

AMAZING PUPPETEERS

 Frankie Cordero, Puppeteer 

Sam koji Hale, Indie Film Director and Puppeteer

 

Kervin Peralta, Actor, Puppeteer and Musician

Other Ways You Can Help

Please TELL everyone about it and SPREAD the link far and wide.

                                      Bo-matúm, Gracias, Thank you, Merci, Danke.

                                   I  LOVE YOU! We will make this happen together!

If you are as passionate as I am to restore our Taíno culture and language, please share this campaign everywhere. Make some Boricua noise! Mi gente se puede!

When you use the Indiegogo tools of social media sharing at the top of our campaign page it will help us tremendously.

Alberto Garcia Jr. Filmmaker, Editor and Director, currently living in Puerto Rico. He has taken footage of Hurricane Maria's devastation.

story:
Stealth follows the story of Madgie and Rupert, a true love at first sight couple as they decide that they must take action and infiltrate their long time friend Dennis’ house, because he has persistently borrowed their possessions and never returned any of them creating a collection over the years. While on their robbing spree through Dennis’ house they discover more than they expected searching for their worldly items. 

The story is a comedy but touches on a layer of romanticism of an elderly couple whose fever for each other and characteristics are an embodiment of what true love should be. Their ability to be best friends and trust one and another is a highlight that will be raised through the aesthetic style of the film as well as the comedic portrayal.

The Story is based on a true story and the film was first conceived as a collaborative project at University. Recently Gerald and Lexy worked together to rewrite the script and our talented Writer Lexy then put pen to paper to create the film we now love and believe in. Stealth is a fun, beautiful love story showing the lengths we would go for a loved one. 

Madgie

Our heroine of the story she captures the camera fiercely with the fire that still burns in her eyes, but from a distance looks an ordinary lady. Leader of the operation, clever and witty she must never be underestimated. 

Rupert

The comedy Clyde in this adventure whose clumsy nature and forgetful memory is shown in his ageing appearance. Devoted husband deaf as a bat but always masked with a smile on his face, Rupert is Madgie first and only true love and he will do anything for her.

Dennis

A dashing silver haired fox who has been in his prime for almost half a century, he has the demeaner of a young boy in the playground who likes to hoard all his classmates’ toys however an appearance that could match any bond villain.

 

Our team of dedicated professionals are made up of a close-knit group who happened to attend the same University, each with their very own talented skills and specialisations! Overall the production will have over twenty committed members working on the film!

Director – Gerald Zibengwa

Graduated in 2016, Gerald has spent the last two years working in different aspects of production from Runner, AD and Camera Assistant in a freelance capacity, Working with a variety of ormats from music to film, was able to shadow talented directors and learn from them building up to directing again. Spearheading the recruitment of the crew and getting to this stage. Very excited about the prospect of making this project as it has been in the works for a long time. 

Producer – Ryan Calland-Scoble

 

Ryan a graduate of UCA and specialist in producing, has a diverse background which is a reflection in his creative style and logistical strategies. While working on shorts or documentaries he has a background of work involving advertisement and corporate video, a keen rom-com lover and festival goer! 

Writer – Lexy Anderson

Lexy whose past involvement with Raindance festival has seen her work on numerous creative shorts whether it involves writing or directing she has embarked on a creative visionary journey to tell the stories she is passionate about!

Director of Photography – Matias Gaggiotti

 

Since graduating from UCA with the crew, Matias has built a body of experience working across all visual formats, from art films to shinny commercials - passing through shorts, features and music videos. For over the past two years he has been working on British documentary and factual television programmes for the main terrestrial broadcasters. Stealth marks his return to scripted/drama/comedy of which he is very excited about!

Some of the teams past work can be seen below! 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jmp6eScMa5s&amp...

https://youtu.be/tIdG_v_aw24

https://vimeo.com/114880479

https://vimeo.com/220471988

https://vimeo.com/kimberleycoupland

While we have saved on costs in some areas of the film such as crew costs and equipment hire through sourcing and working for free we are portioning what we have saved to help us in other areas such as paying for quality actors as well as expanding our set design to meet the creative demands of the script.

Our major costs will be significant to cover even with the money we save on these areas, which is why we need your help to achieve the creative abilities that we have set out. With your initial funding we will garner enough funds to cover our exploited areas.

Take a look at our budget breakdown to see which areas of production we need to finance most.

While the story is short and sweet, most logistical issues will arrive at our house location which will be shot in East London. The most challenges issues we face when dealing with this production are scheduling and our end scene. Our budget doesn't allow for comfortable shooting schedule, hopefully with the help we recieve we would be able to add another day to our schedule in our location. 

Getting everyone together at the same time can be an issue but through structured schedules an openness to changing with the flow we will overcome these barriers with significant results. Our other main issue will be shooting the final chase scene, which we have worked on run through for. In accomplishing this we will utilise everything from licensing and shooting rights, traffic signal block offs, road safety tests, vehicle safety tests as well as cinematic angling to fully capture our pivotal end. 

If you are unable to financially invest in this production, don't worry there is still plenty that you are able to achieve, you can always share, endorse and create some buzz on our social media pages, tweet us or hit us up on our Facebook page or maybe even drop us a line or give us some feedback on our email! We appreciate any involvement with funders or anyone interested in our production as filmmaking is a team effort and we want you to be apart of it!

 

  

 

Thank you!

Stealth marks his return to scripted/drama/comedy of which he is very excited about!Some of the teams past work can be seen below! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jmp6eScMa5s&amp...https://youtu.be/tIdG_v_aw24https://vimeo.com/114880479https://vimeo.com/220471988https://vimeo.com/kimberleycouplandWhile we have saved on costs in some areas of the film such as crew costs and equipment hire through sourcing and working for free we are portioning what we have saved to help us in other areas such as paying for quality actors as well as expanding our set design to meet the creative demands of the script.Our major costs will be significant to cover even with the money we save on these areas, which is why we need your help to achieve the creative abilities that we have set out. With your initial funding we will garner enough funds to cover our exploited areas.Take a look at our budget breakdown to see which areas of production we need to finance most.While the story is short and sweet, most logistical issues will arrive at our house location which will be shot in East London. The most challenges issues we face when dealing with this production are scheduling and our end scene. Our budget doesn't allow for comfortable shooting schedule, hopefully with the help we recieve we would be able to add another day to our schedule in our location. Getting everyone together at the same time can be an issue but through structured schedules an openness to changing with the flow we will overcome these barriers with significant results. Our other main issue will be shooting the final chase scene, which we have worked on run through for. In accomplishing this we will utilise everything from licensing and shooting rights, traffic signal block offs, road safety tests, vehicle safety tests as well as cinematic angling to fully capture our pivotal end. If you are unable to financially invest in this production, don't worry there is still plenty that you are able to achieve, you can always share, endorse and create some buzz on our social media pages, tweet us or hit us up on our Facebook page or maybe even drop us a line or give us some feedback on our email! We appreciate any involvement with funders or anyone interested in our production as filmmaking is a team effort and we want you to be apart of it!    Thank you!

story:
During a creative block, I challenged my FB peeps to send a one-liner that I could turn into a short story.  A former co-worker mentioned driving past a bus stop and Christmas tree stand in the middle of nowhere.  I was intrigued.  And just like that, GREG AND THE TREE came to life. 

In September, I attended the Lady Filmmakers Festival in Los Angeles.  I was struck by the energy and sheer talent of all the creatives in attendance, many of whom were first time filmmakers, directors, actors, writers, etc.  I was also lucky enough to have one of my shorts win the festival's BEST SHORT SCRIPT.  This lead to several amazing conversations with my fellow creatives who, in turn, challenged me to take a leap of faith and develop my new script.

And now here we are. 

Every project requires passion.   check.

Every production requires a good script and a great crew.   check.

Every film requires money.   dang.

Our goal is to make an incredible film on a very, very tight budget.  But the reality is, we need your help to make this happen.

All funds, every single dollar, funnel back into the film. 

So where does the money go?  Music/soundtrack licensing; equipment; camera and sound crew; Christmas trees and set design; permits; gas for the bus; catering; all the post-production magic: editing, sound mixing, coloring, etc.

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially.  You can also help by spreading the word about our project on your social media accounts.  We can accomplish anything if the individual becomes the many *just like voting*

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Angelo (27) suddenly awakens from an incapacitating heroin high and is immediately thrust into the freezing waters of withdrawal. It is evident from his surroundings that his use has been habitual for a very long time. In this moment it has reached an extremity. He is scraping along rock-bottom.

Drenched in sweat, with a needle still sticking out of his arm, he forces his body to cooperate as he tries to open the drawer next to his bed, looking for another fix. Riddled with foil, burnt spoons, and empty syringe wrappers, the drawer does not contain what he is desperately looking for. His attempt to get out of bed results in him hitting the floor as his legs refuse to hold his weight.

Angelo exits his run-down flat and enters the stairwell of his building. His objective is the top floor, where his dealer resides. From this moment on, he is faced with an existential struggle as nature begins to fight back and everything is not what it seems.

As the story progresses, Angelo is dragged through the darkest corners of his psyche, painfully exorcising the demons of his past through confrontation and agonizing self-sacrifice. He is led to his own personal hell before he can finally stand on his own two feet once again. 

O Superman seeks to peel back the defensive layers of the pathological psyche in a thrilling and literal way so as to show the dangers of compulsive conflict avoidance with one’s own shadow and the disorders that can arise as a result (serious substance addiction in the case of Angelo). Furthermore, it seeks to demonstrate the function of pain in the healing process, as well as the necessity and difficulty of self-sacrifice in the interest of exorcising the demons of one’s past.

The Funding Challenge

Let's not beat around the bush. We're a bunch of minimal-wage aspiring filmmakers, who are doing everything possible to create impactful pieces of cinema, that will better people's lives and not be forgotten in a hurry. Since our family background somewhat prohibits us from asking our folks for a small loan of a million dollars, we need the help of backers like you, who believe in the potential of our project. We are no nonsense, serious creatives, and believe that with the appropriate resources, this film will undoubtedly be worthy of international festival submissions. 

We are raising money to shoot this film in the beginning of November. 

The money that we raise through this crowdfunding campaign will be spent on: 

- Paying actors/the crew

- Equipment Rental 

- Set Design 

- Paying for rights to the music 

- Catering? 

- Festival submissions

The Impact

We have all met people with varying degrees of Angelo in them. Even I, myself, have certainly created plenty of elaborate mental mechanisms to shield me from the painful reality of my own inadequacies and destructive tendencies. 

We are enthusiastic about the creation of this project as we believe it carries an important message to those who view it and not only promotes empathy towards people who experience mental illness but also represents an opportunity for introspection. While the surrealistic approach helps to make the final product engaging to watch, it also provides a literal basis for interpretation, where complex ideas can be effectively communicated in an understandable way.

O Superman is the director's most ambitious project to date and we believe that with the appropriate resources it can truly become an impactful short film, which will remain in the minds of people for years to come. Although challenging, we are confident that with the support of each other, as well as the crew we are gathering, this project can be executed in a timely and competent manner.

We are eager to get started and appreciate your support!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like our concept, but are unable to contribute financially, you can still help out by sharing this page wherever you can! 

The more people who see this page, the greater the chance that we are able to reach our goal. We also urge contributors to share the campaign as much as possible. 

The Team

Writer/Director - Plamen Valkov 

Director of Photography - Michael Herbers

Producer - Nano Rodriguez

Art Department - Tegwen Evans

story:
Thank you for your support!!

Team Supreme Perks!

Featured

$25 - Early Bird Special

Donate or purchase a perk during the first two days of our campaign and receive a special price of $25.00 for on Team Supreme Film Crew T-Shirt. The special pricing is ONLY available WITH the purchase of a separate perk or donation. Fly fast to this time limited reward! Thank you!!!

100 available

Anticipated Delivery: December 2018

 

$1 - Unlimited Super Power

Any amount that you are able to give will be meaningful! It's true.  Whatever you give gets us one step closer to producing Team Supreme!  You will receive a special "Thank You" message from Joshua Leonard, creator of Team Supreme. Your super power is optimism. Thank you!!!

Unlimited

Anticipated Delivery:  No later than December 2018

 

$15 - Superhero Thank You E-Card

This perk is an autographed personal Thank You E-Card. The e-card can be addressed to you or to another Team Supreme fan.  It will include one of the Team Supreme characters and it can be used as computer or phone wallpaper.  Your super power is collaboration. Thank you!!!

300 available

Anticipated Delivery: December 2018

 

$30 – Team Supreme Superheroes

You made the final cut with this perk! We will include your name in the Superheroes of Team Supreme closing credits (theatrical and festival versions only) of the film! Your name (or the name of a Team Supreme fan) will be in lights on the big screen.  Your superpower is generosity. Thank you!!

Unlimited

Anticipated delivery: December 2018

 

$35 - Team Supreme Film Crew T-shirt

When you hit these streets, eyes will be on you in your Team Supreme Film Crew t-shirt. The t-shirt carries the official movie image of all the characters and the Team Supreme logo on a white background. Your superpower is teamwork. Thank you!!

750 available

Anticipated delivery: December 2018

Please add $10 for shipping outside of U.S.

 

$40 – Team Spirit

Receive special behind the scenes updates on the progress of the film, a shout out on our website, and a video message from the Team Supreme Production Crew delivered to either your Facebook or Instagram page. The bad guys will know to stand back when you stand with Team Supreme. Thank you!!!

100 available

Anticipated Delivery: December2018

 

$200 – Supreme Styling

Superpowers look good on you. This perk puts you in Team Supreme style. You may send us a photo of you or a Team Supreme fan. Once we approve the photo, we will create a digital drawing of you alongside one of the Team Supreme characters. Your superpower is “awesomeness". Thank you!!!

20 available

Anticipated Delivery: December 2018

 

$500 - Animation Dojo

Are you working on or planning an animation project? This perk gives you the level up factor of superpower artist Joshua Leonard with one (1) hour of consultation or class on drawing, storytelling, or any other animation topic via Skype. Your superpower is creativity. Thank you!!!

5 available

Anticipated delivery: February 2019

 

$1500 - BRONZE: Team Huddle

You are on the Team Supreme coaching squad and we want to shout you out!  Once you brand name/logo is approved as Team Supreme compatible, it will appear in one of our scenes for no less than 5 seconds. It will appear on Team Supreme social media and in closing film credit. Thank you!!!

10 available

Anticipated delivery: December 2018

 

$2500 - SILVER: Featured Extra

Lights, camera action! This perk will utilize your photo or the photo of a Team Supreme fan  that will be drawn as a background character in a scene in the film. Once we approve the photo, we will determine the best scene to show off your animated extra profile. Thank you!!!

3 available

Anticipated delivery: April 2019

 

$5000 - GOLD: Associate Producer

As an Associate Producer, you may be assigned tasks with the in Pre-Production or Production. You will receive a film credit, a film crew t-shirt, two tickets to the premiere of Team Supreme (travel and lodging not included) and walk the red carpet with Team Supreme.  Thank you!!!

 2 available

Anticipate delivery: December 2018
 

$10000 - PLATINUM: Executive Producer

The Executive Producer perk is a 1-hour session with Joshua Leonard via Skype to discuss animation topics or Joshua's inspiring life journey. Includes advanced online screening, red carpet walk, opening and closing credits, backpack, t-shirt, poster and digital sketch of you. Thank you!!!

1 available

Anticipated delivery: January 2019

 

Welcome To Team Supreme!

I am Joshua Leonard and I'm a 2D frame-by-frame animator.. I love art and storytelling. I've been drawing for over 20 years and animating for 4 years. I have a successful track record in animation including credits with the short film Mila. I am an emphatic advocate of inclusion and diversity which is why I want to create the animated short film "Team Supreme". I truly want to share the a message of openness and acceptance while the audience gains more perspective  on the strengths of all members of our community. Although I have seen cartoon heroes with a special need, I've never seen characters  that are young kids who all have special needs and are portrayed positively and as superheroes.  I researched  and sought out knowledgeable friends and family members to provide me with the marvelous flip side and insights about their special needs children. These children have amazing skills. I was able to feel a story of  the beauty and purpose in the lives of these children that we don't often see. I  thought how  fun it would be to have a cartoon that built around the celebration and  respect for differences  in an animated format for children and adults. Team Supreme  is a story about  adventure resilience, hope, family and fun that needs to be told  this way ,really, for all of us!

I have been both deeply honored and  encouraged by the outpouring of support of Team Supreme.Team Supreme has been featured in  many magazines and media outlets such as  Attn:, Aplus, Be Modern Man 100 Men of Distinction 2018, Mashable, Vibe Magazine, CBS 46, Black Enterprise, AMB Magazine, SundayTimes (Johannesburg, Africa), and VoyageATL. With the help of  our contributors, we will be able to make an industry standard animated film  that is the  new  baseline for how inclusion and diversity is presented to the next generation! I am humbled and grateful to be among those who will stand up this film.

What We Need 

To fly,Team Supreme will need your help securing production costs such as animators, writers, equipment,legal support, licensing costs, voice talent and insurance. You are the secret  weapon that will make these kids soar!

If we are lucky enough to exceed our initial goal of $100,000, we will still need to pursue our STRETCH GOALS of $150,000 which will allow us to secure premier voice talent, offer additional perks, cover submission fees  and travel costs to film festivals, and raise awareness through inclusive pop-ups events for the community and Team Supreme Street Team. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help 

I understand that some of you cannot make a financial contribution at this time. But you can still  be of tremendous help!

SHARE: You can share this page on your social media page and email contacts. This is truly important and invaluable to the success of the campaign.

WORD OF MOUTH: PLEASE tell your friends and family about Team Supreme and how they can help make a movie that inspires, affirms and celebrates the perfection of imperfection. Please tell everyone you know how important it is to be a part of  this campaign. We truly appreciate word of mouth  endorsement from our supporters. Your personal endorsement means you stand with us and we are grateful to have  you spread the message of Team Supreme. Please use our Indiegogo share tools everywhere you can! Thank you!

The Impact

Joining this campaign means that you are a part of moving all our children and those that care for them to a table where there is a seat for everyone. There has never been a project developed around this topic in this medium of this creative and social magnitude before.  I know that these bright soaring images are needed and will inspire! Imagine how many lives we will touch by taking Team Supreme to a larger platform. 

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges relate to  the time it takes to produce an animated film. We need animators to  join the team and to be able to secure their participation to the end of the project. We need adequate funding to give the project the look and sound that is due to the subject matter and our fans.  

 

Characters

When a group of kids is born with a special need, they're Superheroes! 

 

 

The Team

(From Top Left to Bottom Right)

Joshua Leonard- Creator/Animator of Team Supreme 

Ben Bromfield- Composer

Eric Elder- Producer

Shekira Farrell- PR/Marketing Administrator 

Vincent Shinholster- 3D Modeler 

Joe Garner- Animation Supervisor 

Ryan Brackett- Camera Operator

Gia Compton- Consulting Producer

Ola Garner- Animation Supervisor

Sharif York- 3D Animator

David Wilkerson- Animator

Linton Barnett- Writer

James Mosley II- Animation Production Coordinator

 

The Cast

COMING SOON!!!
